Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Michelle H
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here the first week in April. It was very centrally located, just around the corner from the place de Cataluyna and a lot of cool restaurants. The breakfast was a little pricey--17 Euros but there wer plenty of other places to eat. The room was big by European standards and very clean. The staff was helpful and the bartenders in the lounge made a mean cosmopolitan--very friendly and entertaining. The view from our room was not so good as it looked out on the back of the sign grill but it was not significant to us. I would absolutely stay here again and recommend it to friends. Great value for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, well situated, clean, staff pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Fertnig
Reviews.Content: Excelent hotel in a good location. Staff pleasant & helpful, clean and well presented. Planning to return in September for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Denisa P
Reviews.Content: We spent Easter time at hotel Regina with children. It has great location, only few steps from Rambla and Plaza Catulunya and that's why we chose this hotel. Staff and also interior of the hotel is nice but we were little bit disapointed from family room. We had family room on the 4th floor and it was not very spacious and comfortable. But every other things were ok...

Reviews.Title: “Merely Okay”
Reviews.Author: dttj
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights when I came for a trade show and fortunately, as I was here for business, didn't stay in the room or hotel very much. I actually made a booking at Pulitzer Hotel, which is the sister hotel of Regina, and literally next door. But he Pulitzer was full, so they booked me a room at the Regina instead. The best things I would say is the fantastic location of the hotel, which is a short walk to Ramblas or Paseo de Gracia, with great shopping. The other good things are the reasonable rate of the hotel and the impressive lobby, which feels like a grand old hotel. However, once you pass the lobby and go towards the rooms, you come to a tiny lift (only one lift!) so be prepared to wait and if there are 2 of you with luggage, its a tight squeeze. Then the rooms ... you start to feel the age and tiredness of the rooms when you step in. Room size is also on the small side. Opt for rooms in the front, at least you'll have a window. My room was at the back and there was a tiny window in the corner, facing a brick wall. Can be depressing if you don't walk out of the hotel to look at the sky. If you need a drink, its better to walk next door to the Bar at the Pulitzer, which seems more civilized and lively. Personally, I wouldn't come back to stay here as there are so many other great choices in Barcelona. For a similar location and type of hotel, I would probably opt for Pulitzer or Jazz Hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Friendly Staff, Good for couples.”
Reviews.Author: Nimit P
Reviews.Content: I would say this hotel would fit the bill for couples of smaller groups of travelers looking for something a little more upscale, clean, and serviceable without any of the high priced hotel frills. It's a hotel that is good at a lot of things but not great at anything. Good front desk staff, Nice (but very small) room, Good (not great) location which was put a handful of things in walking distance and for everything else, the metro was a short walk away. From what we found, we thought it was probably fair value for the price ( we paid 100 euros a night) and ideal for couples of smaller groups who want a nice, clean hotel, in a quieter area of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location!”
Reviews.Author: Christakis1974
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the hotel is the great location; only a few minutes away from Plaza Catalunya and metro lines. You can walk easily to La Rambla and Gothic quarter as well as many shops and cafes/restaurants. The reception staff was friendly and kind, while the rooms are clean and spacious. The lobby is very nice and includes lift as you walk straight in the hotel. Also, the bathroom and shower facility especially in rooms were excellent. The bed was comfortable and there is enough space in wardrobes which also include a safe. It was also a nice gesture to have a set of arty black and white postcards from Barcelona sights. In addition we asked when booking for a quiet room and was indeed very quiet taking in mind the busy location of the hotel. There were no coffee/tea making facilities and as with most hotels, breakfast rate is expensive. Overall though, we had a nice stay at Regina as our aim was to enjoy central Barcelona within minutes and we would definitely return to this hotel. Recommended for Barcelona trips.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but Hotel is very tired”
Reviews.Author: dunesdweller
Reviews.Content: I normally stay in the Pulitzer hotel next door which is a sister hotel and represents far better value for money than Regina which is really showing its age. Locataion is great for either business or tourists so that is a major plus but the regina is not as good value as the Pulitzer. Rooms and public spaces are definitely very tired and room service menu is very limited (no restaurant) - breakfast was decent but due to a conference in town at the time the cost for my room was prohibitively expensive

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: Michealdoody
Reviews.Content: Amazing location, just off Placa da Catalunya and Las Ramblas. The airport shuttle bus stops on Placa da Catalunya and is only a 2 min walk from the hotel. The hotel itself is beautiful. Large rooms, comfortable beds, large flat screen tv and in room safe. I would not hesitate to say here again!

Reviews.Title: “absolutely top location”
Reviews.Author: karen m
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the best position just a few shops away from the main Plaza ..We had a lovely room with a balcony that looked up the street to the plaza and the madding crowds below. Our room was lovely , the breakfast room a feast and the staff wonderful ( had travel troubles with Tempo Travel agency) . so why only the three stars? Our room was next to the staff elevator shaft, so we heard the mechanics of this until about 10.30pm and again early in the morning. Also the walls must be made of tissue paper. We heard EVERY word spoken by the couple and their little children in the adjoining room. Then, late at night one night, quite a few youngish people were flitting between their rooms and the noise of their banging on each others doors was unbelievable ( until I put a stop to it!) Such a shame because this is truly a nice hotel..but I would risk it again but be choosy with the room..

Reviews.Title: “Central, comfortable, with great service”
Reviews.Author: remy v Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: this hotel is very well located near plaza catalunya. nice furniture and well equiped . smiling ans efficient service . having a cocktail at the bar is a nice rest. good advises given at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “birhday surprise”
Reviews.Author: gemmapatrol
Reviews.Content: spent 2 days here celebrating my 60th birthday with the best friends ever. We arrived at the hotel to leave our luggage in a safe place but were able to check into our rooms. The staff were amazing and really friendly our room was on the fifth floor so really quiet. The hotel is really central to all Barcelona's attractions. Breakfast is very expensive but one block away is a cafe serving the most amazing bacon and eggs there were 10 in our party and on the 2 mornings we eat there they sat us all together. Barcelona is the most amazing city can't wait to return

Reviews.Title: “everything you want a hotel to be”
Reviews.Author: beckymonster
Reviews.Content: Great price, great service, nice clean rooms (somewhat modern too), and PRIME location, 5 minutes walk from Las Ramblas and walkable to the seaport/pier on a mild day. Not to mention there is a metro, hop off/on bus and Aerobus right down the street and around the corner from convenient shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: tai y
Reviews.Content: Very clean, quiet and relaxing hotel, we had a very good rest after a long day out in the big city. The rooms are large and much more modern than we expected, huge bathrooms, flat screen TV. The staff were very helpful. Absolutely perfect location, convenient to get everywhere in no time: La Rambla and the Gothic quarter, shopping area, metro, restaurants, the beach is very near by metro and also reachable on foot. Overall an excellent stay, we couldn't have asked for more!

Reviews.Title: “Confortable in the centre of Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: S58M57
Reviews.Content: Very good location, in the so called "Triangle" just on the side of Placa Catalunya, the live heart of the city. Free wifi in all the hotel and rooms. Computers with internet available in the lobby. Very good breakfast, that we had included in the fare... otherwise, we can imagine it is a little bit priced. We chose a prepaid fare, that was a good value for money... but for the cost of the hotel we expected more accurate services (i.e.: soap and bath foam in the bathroom should be renovated daily, specially if I have already used it). The location, however, justifies the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - ok rooms”
Reviews.Author: Geogguy1960
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Regina is in a great location - steps from the Plasa da Catalunya and La Rumbla. We spent most of our 3 days prior to our cruise just walking around from the hotel. It's also a short walk from the airport bus stop which is right in front of the square and an easy and very cheap way to get to the airport and back. Since breakfast was not included in our rate, we didn't eat at the hotel as it seemed expensive for what you paid and therefore can't say what the food is like. There were tons of fast food and local eateries in the area plus a small grocery store right across the street for snacks and drinks. The lobby was fairly spacious and there was a bank of computers to use off to the side for free Internet access. I found the the free WI-Fi in the rooms worked fine as well. As far as the rooms went, they were adequate but not luxurious by any means. Fairly modern with wood laminate floors. The bed was comfy however, as others have commented on this site, you can hear every noise in the hallway - and our bed was less than 2 metres from the door. The doors seem more like cheap hollow bedroom doors that you would find in an older apartment than you would expect in a hotel - maybe a simple fix for part of the noise issue the next time they renovate. The rooms had air - but I figured out why the cleaning staff always left the bathroom door closed - since there was no air duct in the bathroom, if it was left open the cooling system could not keep the sleeping area cool. Worked ok once we figured that out. We were on the 4th floor and never noticed a problem with the subway noise that others mentioned. We did have a window - but it looked at wall - so there was no natural light coming in - but then we were rarely there other than to sleep and shower. Considering we only paid 84 Euros per night for a room in the centre of town we weren't surprised at the view we got. Had I paid full price then I might have had an issue. All in all a good deal for what we paid and the location.

Reviews.Title: “Too Small”
Reviews.Author: ChristineAnna
Reviews.Content: Hotel Regina is too small to stay in. If you want to cook, you have to go all the way down to the reception to borrow the adapter. It's too troublesome.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely coming back!”
Reviews.Author: cssnin
Reviews.Content: Great location, room, breakfast! Air con was a bonus, given how hot it gets! In the heart of the city and the main bus stop for tourist tours, regular local buses, airport transfer bus and train stations. Because it's so central, you can walk everywhere and save so much on transport. You can walk around the city, to restaurants, markets, shops, la Rambla, the marina, the aquarium as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, best bed i've ever been in..!”
Reviews.Author: kvanniko
Reviews.Content: This hotel can probably go both ways depending on the person. For me, I appreciated the 1916 era architecture right away at least. The location is quite good for access to La Rambla and the old castle part of the town, about a 15 minute walk down to the seaside. The only negative aspect that I encountered was the 'thinness' of the walls, on the first day I was there I noticed I could here every source of music and loud conversation on the floor (1st floor). Luckily, any noise that did seep into the room was completely cancelled out by the unbelievably comfortable bed and bedding... I was pretty shocked by it at first, as I did not think a hotel bed would ever qualify that highly for such a price (I've stayed in a LOT of king beds at hotels all over the place and they so far have never been exceptionally mentionable). I was also suspicious that the comfort was proportional only to my exhaustion, but this proved to be unrelated during the three nights I spent there. So yes, nobody should go to Barcelona to hang out in hotel rooms anyways, so if you need a place to stay that is mid-range, I highly recommend the Regina!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: Denni L
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location near La Rambla no doubt about that but it is very noisy. We could hear when people talked in the hallway, when people flushed their toilet and when the metro passed underneath the hotel (which it did very often). The staff in the reception was very helpfull and the service was great. Overall we had a very nice trip but we expected that a 4 star hotel would be more quiet.

Reviews.Title: “best location, good accomodation”
Reviews.Author: dapip
Reviews.Content: Location is great, by walk; 1min to Pl Catalunya, 3mins to La Rambla, 10-15 mins to Barri Gothic and cathedrals etc.. We did not prefer a hotel on La Rambla street, we thought it might be too loudy for sleep. So the best choice for us was around Pl Catalunya. Even on the day of new year 31.12, we slept very well although there was still new year celebrations going on Pl Catalunya. We stayed at a standart room which was clean but a little bit tiny. The room door was opening very close to our bed, that was a little uncomfortable however, at the end of the day, the size is good for a city centre based hotel. A bigger room can be an alternative. Breakfast was fine. Staff was friendly. We didnt face any problems and would definitely check for the next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff, Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: SheilaRBS
Reviews.Content: Stayed a few nights in this hotel in November, 2011. The front desk staff was extremely helpful and very pleasant. The hotel is nice and the rooms are nice, standard sized European rooms, with hardwood floors. The breakfast that comes with the hotel package is a standard European breakfast - both scrambled and boiled eggs, cold cereals and oatmeal, several types of ham, sausages, and bacon; pastries, several types of breads/rolls, butter, jam, fruits, orange juice, milk, and mineral water, all buffet style. There is free Wi-Fi access. The hotel is situated around the corner from Las Ramblas, which is great if you like the activity of Las Ramblas without having to hear it in your hotel room. The hotel is directly across the street from the entrance of the Metro station, but with the room I stayed in, I had no problems, couldn't hear the train at all, just peace and quiet. Had a walk-out balcony, which was nice to view the surrounding area. In my opinion, it's best to take a Taxi to the hotel. There are buses and the metro nearby, but depending on the time of night and how much luggage you have, it's probably better to take a taxi if you're not familiar with the area. Of course there's tons of stores and eateries in the Las Ramblas area. I suggest getting the hop-on/hop-off tour bus pass from the hotel, it's a few Euros cheaper and well worth it. Start out early though, as it takes you to other nice areas to shop and eat and lots of beautiful sights to see. I've been to Barcelona previously, so I definitely felt comfortable in the area. Even if I hadn't visited previously, would definitely still feel comfortable being out and about alone. Hard Rock Cafe is a five minute walk away as well, if you're interested. Staff was great there too!! Would definitely recommend this hotel again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great style... everything we needed”
Reviews.Author: Mikela K
Reviews.Content: My colleagues (who are also great friends) and I spent 4 nights at the Regina during the Sonar Music Festival. We were hesitant at first, especially since none of us had ever been to Barcelona before and did not know the area. We were very pleasantly surprised and ended up having a great stay at the hotel. Granted, we were not there much, however, the hotel had everything we needed and was just as advertised. The location was excellent and we walked to the event venue every day, plus could easily walk around and explore the area during the day. The staff were all very helpful and all spoke English, which was extremely useful. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “dont use laundry service, dont stay in room near triangle, trains rumble th floors”
Reviews.Author: manipulation101
Reviews.Content: hotel is clean, the service is fine although variable. We stayed in a large room, well equipped with a spacious bathroom and bedroom. Dont use the rooms near the triangle especially 1st floor-the trains rumble the floor regardless if your windows are shut. dont use the laundry service unless your willing to part with more money than your clothes are worth. Overall-depends on what deal you got for your room, because despite the cons the location is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Nancy P
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights prior to our cruise in late October. Originally booked online (non-refundable) because of the price discount and were not disappointed. Upon arrival, we were given a free upgrade to a large, clean room with a balcony. Within walking distance of Las Ramblas at Pl. Cataluyna, close to Metro for easy travels. Recommed Dim Sum restaurant across the street and the grocery store for snacks, including alcoholic beverages if desired. Easy, inexpensive access from the airport with the Aerobus.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: FrankieSeesTheWorld
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Regina while on our honeymoon in Barcelona. The hotel has sleek and modern decor, but a warm and cozy atmosphere. The service at the front desk was a bit slow sometimes, but the staff was in general, very helpful. The room we stayed in was clean and spacious. The bathroom was large and offered toiletry items for both men and women. There were also bathrobes and slippers. The one complaint we had with our room was that the beds were very uncomfortable. We had two twin beds that converted into a king size bed. The gap in the middle of the two beds was undeniable and the mattress and pillows were very firm to say the least. Breakfast was included in the room rate and the small buffet was chic, with quite a few selections of breakfast breads, fresh and dried fruits, cheeses, cereals, juices, and coffee. The real reason to stay at this hotel is the LOCATION. We were able to walk everywhere! Las Ramblas is only one block away from the hotel, and the Barcelona Cathedral is about a 10-15 minute walk. We also visited the Sagrada Familia while we were in Barcelona. We had to take the metro to get there, but the station was only a 5-minute walk from the hotel and once on the metro, we were there within minutes. If you are interested in mainstream shopping, there is a Top Shop and a Pull & Bear right across the street from the hotel. Stores like H&M and Sephora are also within walking distance. The large public market La Boqueria is about a 10-minute walk from the hotel. There are also an abundance of restaurants and cafes in every direction, both local and chains. For travelers who need coffee in the morning, there is a Starbucks right around the corner from the hotel entrance. Overall we greatly enjoyed our stay, and would book here again.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location... adjacent to Plaza Cataluna”
Reviews.Author: DSteveCA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Regina for two nights after returning to Barcelona on our cruise ship. The best part about this hotel is location, location, location... The hotel is located a half-block from the central Plaza Cataluna (spelling ?) and one block from the Las Ramblas district. A subway station, the Aero bus stop (direct to Barcelona airport) and the multi-story Corte de Ingles department store are at the plaza. Located on a side street, the hotel avoids much of the street noise common to other hotels in the area. Our 5th floor room was spacious, clean and had a small balcony overlooking the street. We appreciated the 5 computers which were available for use by guests. The hotel's full-service bar also served delicious tapas and small plate options. A breakfast buffet -- available for about 13 euros ($17 US) -- offered a nice array of food and beverage options. There was no valet service -- at least no one offered to help us move 2 large bags from the sidewalk to our room. The front desk staff spoke good English and made several useful suggestions on where to eat and where to go. Given its central location, this hotel provides an excellent value for travelers. Not an especially romantic setting.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodations”
Reviews.Author: jim B
Reviews.Content: I had heard not to expect much from the hotels in Europe. Well I can tell you that is not the case with the Hotel Regina. Renting the Superior room was as good as any in America. The rooms were spacious with king sized bed; new and modern baths; remodeled rooms; very relaxing lobby bar and great location...Just a block off of the Rambles. And, not a horrible price. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Location is its best asset”
Reviews.Author: Zzzz13
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at the Hotel Regina, and chose this hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews. It was not as good as we had expected it to be, mainly because we were given a poor quality room. Pros: Excellent location next to Placa Catalunya - easy walk to Las Ramblas/the beach/all transport links and aerobus etc Comfortable beds and quiet room which was clean Free wifi Nice, relaxing bar area with very helpful waiter who fed us free crisps etc when we were having wine Bathrobes and slippers provided in rooms (both huge) Cons: We were given a very small, cramped room. There was no view from the window (see photo)and no sunlight into the room. We couldn't tell what the weather was like from our room. Despite asking for a non-smoking room, our room smelt strongly of stale cigarette smoke and other people's smoke came through the air conditioning into our room. No kettle to make a cup of tea No iron/board in room - although staff did provide us with this on request. Safety of iron questionable (see photo) Didn't always replace toiletries in room Reception staff variable in terms of helpfulness. Our room phone didn't work and wasn't fixed during our stay. Small shower-room, with water from shower escaping onto floor. Overall, if you are looking for a no-frills, central hotel close to all transport links, then Hotel Regina is probably worth considering. If you like a bit of luxury on your holiday, probably best avoided. In our view, not worthy of its four star status and more like a three star.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: LouiseT44
Reviews.Content: We were seven women travelling together to celebrate a birthday. It is not easy to find rooms sleeping so many people at once, but we were able to book into a 4 and a 3 room. The rooms were spacious and comfortable, the location was really convenient and the service was great. A perfect choice for this sort of a weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Becky C
Reviews.Content: We had a group of four of us - no couples - so really appreciated the "family room" we were able to get here (for a reasonable price). It was very spacious and clean and had a big bathroom and lots of room to spread out. Sadly we only stayed one night but we had excellent service from the very friendly staff. We asked a lot of questions for getting around Barcelona and they were extremely helpful. They also have a room (and great organization) where you can lock your bags up securely if needed (we checked out but were not heading to our cruise ship until late in the day). One reason we chose this hotel was the location but we did worry about the noise - there was no need to! It was quiet even with the location so close to Plaza Catalunya and Las Ramblas! I would definitely stay here again! Oh and the beds were quite comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but..”
Reviews.Author: BTH904
Reviews.Content: As with previous reviews, the location was great. RIght off of La Rambla, close to shopping (el Corte Ingles) and the metro. The staff and service was all great. We had a triple room and it was beautiful, modern...but the bathroom was a real dissappoinment. A hotel of this caliber (and price) I would have liked a nicer bathroom/shower. The tub/shower door was so short that the minute you turned on the shower, water gets all over the bathroom. Plus, the rubber seal at the bottom the short shower door was nonexistant so water would hit the glass and go right out all over the floor. It was no wonder there was a drain in the middle of the bathroom floor and 2 shower mats provided! I'm positive it wasn't user error as you can see mold growing along the edges of the bathroom floor. Considering the price we paid per night...this was a real dissappoinment and I can only rate it average.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CarmenSandiego1985
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 5 nights in October 2011 in a standard double room with a small terrasse overlooking the street. The best part of this hotel is the location as it is right at the intersection of La Rambla (the main tourist strip in the Old City) and Passeig de Gracia (the main shopping street). Travelling by taxi to Placa Catalunya can be a bit bothersome at times as there were often protests and other reasons that the area around the square was blocked off from traffic. Although if you are planning on travelling by foot and metro, the location is very convenient. The area is quite noisy and the street itself is a small side street that is not very nice though. The room was on the small side but still comfortable for two people. It was very clean, with the exception of the shower that could have benefited from a soap-scum scrub down. No full length mirror unfortunately. We were happy that they gave us a room with a terrasse. Overall the room was good for a standard double. The service at the hotel was kind of poor - reception was not friendly (no smiles) and seemed a bit aggravated at times when we asked for help. Not what I was expecting from a 4 star hotel. Overall, our experience there was decent. Next time I'm in Barcelona, I would rather stay on the nearby street Rambla de Catalunya as this is much more picturesque, still perfectly located and has several nice 4-star boutique hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Sister property of the Hotel Pulitzer but choose the Pulitzer”
Reviews.Author: PC_expat_in_AMS
Reviews.Content: The hotel is next door to the Pulitzer thus very convenient to explore the City. The hotel rooms are comfortable. The lower floor in the front of the hotel has the privilege of being able to hear the underground passing regularly. The hotel is filled with "American cruise ship tourists" so be prepared for the consequences of these types of groups. When compared to the Pulitzer this hotel is a step below so if it is available (it wasn't for me this week) choose the sister property for a few Euro's more. This was my third visit to the two properties in three weeks and although this is a good place the other is much better.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Amazing Bed!”
Reviews.Author: DeuxLoves
Reviews.Content: Location: PERFECT. It only costs 7,50 Euro to get from the airport to Placa Catalunya, a 20 second walk to the hotel. Can't beat that for an airport transfer! The hotel itself is off of the main strip but literally right next to Las Ramblas. If you go to the portion of Las Ramblas that is north of the Placa Catalunya, you are greated by a multitude of tapas restaurant options that have non-tourist pricing, great food, and friendly service. If you go to the lower part, you can stroll through the Barri Gotic area all the way to the water. In one word- Perfect! it is also walking distance to most of the sites of Barcelona, but I would suggest taking a cab to Parc Guell and La Sagrada Famiglia. You can easily walk to the beach from here- something we figured out much later than we had hoped to! The Room Itself: PERFECT! We had a balcony facing the street and could see the action going on at Place Catalunya without hearing it. The room was fastidiously clean, the bathroom was stocked with everything we could possilby need (but no conditioner, ladies, so dont forget it like I did!), including slippers and bathrobes. I always give a place an extra star if the supply a comfy bathrobe! And the bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever been lucky enough to sleep in. If I ever suffer from a bout of insomnia I might even be able to justify a trip to Barcelona just to sleep in these beds again, because I would be out like a light! The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. We did not purchase the breakfast, but I checked out the room and it looked like quite the feast. If I do not stay closer to the beach next time I visit Barcelona, I will definitely stay at Hotel Regina again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel close to placa catalunya”
Reviews.Author: jinxleprechaun
Reviews.Content: stayed a night here - 3 people stayed comfortably. Situated close to the placa and the beginning of the Ramblas. Staff friendly and the hotel very clean. Only thing was that the wash basin was located outside the shower room in the bedroomroom and you had to come from the shower to the bedroom to shave and brush your teeth. A bit odd but not a major issue - dressing gowns and slippers complimentary - free wi - fi.

Reviews.Title: “You cannot beat this hotel for location!”
Reviews.Author: lmd19
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a perfect choice for location for Barcelona, it was away from the noise and literally around the corner from the top end of Las Ramblas where all the great shops are! The hotel i felt had a very masculine feel with all the dark wood and as a girl thought it would suit a business man quite well, but it was clean and comfortable especially the bed! The room was a good size for a couple and had all expected ammenities. There wasnt really any negatives as long as you dont want to watch TV in English and we never actually seen the resturant as it was hidden, i would recommend however a higher floor room as there is a little rumble noice from the underground tube. Overall, the location of this hotel was perfect for everywhere. Top tips, get the aero blue bus from the airport straight into Cataluna which is its last stop, takes about 25 minutes and is a bargain 5,30 euros! the hotel is just across the street (look for a habitat store its on that corner) The tour bus is also a must, you see everything Barcelona has to offer and get discounts for attractions too! Another tip is to buy the value pack from the hotel as it works out cheaper then buying from the bus. The tour bus goes from the same stops as the aero bus so its again easily accessible. I would take the blue route tour from there then change to the red route tour at the exange point, this way you can see everything almost in a day! Overall loved Barcelona and it does suit all budgets, just dont buy drinks from the small street cafe's on Las Ramlas as they charge a fortune! Everywhere else we vistited were great value! Check out the the Dolphin show at the zoo too if your like animals it was an experience and bargain! I would definitely stay at this hotel again for the location, convenince and experience of Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: NL_Trekker
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed Hotel Regina pre and post-cruise. We decided to have a couple of extra nights in Barcelona to explore and we are glad that we did. First I must say that the staff at the hotel were extremely helpful in every respect. We did not encounter any issues with the staff during our stay. We required a family room (very reasonably priced) and requested a room each time on the upper levels. The size and layout of the rooms that we had were great. Plenty of space and very clean. There have been comments about the sound issue and this can be true, especially if you have noisy and boisterous neighbours. Fortunately we did not have to deal with noisy individuals. Everyone was very considerate of noise levels, at least where we were in the hotel. There seemed to be a lot of family travelers to the hotel when we were there. The rooms were very clean and when we requested extra supplies the staff were there to provide them. The location was great, very near the downtown area. Plenty of restaurants, cafes, and shops to explore. Transit was just around the corner as well off the main square. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: medmertz
Reviews.Content: We had a terrific time in this hotel. It was clean, comfortable and a nice size for our family (two adults and two children), especially by European standards. Very close for a nice stroll to the Plaza Cataluna and Las Ramblas. Near Casa Batllo as well. We stayed here prior to our cruise and found it convenient to the port area. We loved the free wifi internet access as well. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again when we return to glorious Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel close to Las Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: nynoisette
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few days before and after a cruise. Great modern decor. Clean. Helpful and professional staff. Habitat store up the street. Conveniently located. Las Ramblas a few short blocks away. I'm glad I stayed here and not anywhere along the Ramblas as it gets loud and busy almost all hours of the day/night. Since I stayed in 2 different rooms, I had two different experiences. My first room was smaller but the bed was in the back of room. The bathroom which was in the front provided a buffer from the hall noise outside. My second room after the cruise was bigger but the beds were close to the door; consequently, I heard everything from outside the room. I couldn't get another room as it was fully booked. I would blame the cheap thin doors installed. Security was not a problem on the door. I mean the construction and quality. If heavier doors were used, it would block out more noise. It's unfortunate detail they missed because I would given this hotel 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrstravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in a quad room with my family. The location was excellent. It was walking distance to the top of Las Ramblas and La Pedrera as well. The quad room had one main room with a king size bed and a smaller room off of it with 2 singles. There was more than adequate space. It also had a very large bathroom. Bathrobes and slippers were supplied. The air conditioning however was a little weak. The room was very quiet, we did not hear any outside noise at all. When I return to spain, I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We had a lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: Racls
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed for 3 nights for a birthday treat. I booked this hotel through thomas cook after alot of searching and having read some of the reviews on here i requsted a room on the upper floor. On ariving at the hotel we were allocated a room on the 5th floor (not sure if this was as our request or just a coincedent) but we were very happy the room had a great view. There was a problem with the safe in our room but a call to reception and 2 mins later there is a man to fix it knocking on the door. it was fixed very quicky. The paint work in the room was a bit shabby and the shower leaked round the shower screen ALOT. The room was cleaned daily and the air conditioning was not to noisy either, we could leave it on over night, the last hotel in Barcelona we stayed in was so noisy we had to turn it off. Apart from the odd siren through the night the room was quiet. We didnt realy request the help of any staff (apart from the problem with the safe) so couldent coment on helpfulness but they always gave us a smile or held a door open if we passed. If we were to return to barcelona we would more then likey return here.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room, comfortable beds, great service!”
Reviews.Author: maggieclark79
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel day-of on booking.com and got a great rate!! The service was lovely, the room was grand - best bed I slept in during my whole trip through Spain! Good service, great great location - easy to walk anywhere. Great bar downstairs - super friendly bartender and you feel like you are on the set of Mad Men - great 1950's decor and furniture! Andy Warhol posters in the bathrooms! Loved it, hope to be back

Reviews.Title: “Another Quad Room Found”
Reviews.Author: Parisbreakfast
Reviews.Content: Since we already found a quad room at Saint James Albany Hotel in Paris, I wanted to get another one in Barcelona, Spain. And I found it at the Regina Hotel. The location is conveniently located without the noise of Las Ramblas but walking distance to everything else. It was the perfect location. It even had white bathrobes for the four of us. I felt like I was in the privacy of my own home. Talk about making you feel at "home!" Try to find out which days they have a discount and plan your trip around it if your dates are flexible. Their breakfast is not included in the room rates but be adventurous and eat out. It's also cheaper to eat the breakfast buffet outside. Barcelona is a party city. You can't be bored here. People are very friendly. The hotel staff was so accommodating with our requests. They will do everything they can to help you with your questions. I'd strongly recommend this hotel especially if there's 4 of you and you want to share the cost. You will have the time of your life here. Also, don't forget to eat your churros with hot choclate or you'll be sorry. We wondered if there's a buffet for dinner in Barcelona and yes there is. If you love meat....it's a feast! And sangria accompanies every meal. You will love this place. Don't miss Monserrat up in the mountains. Just take the train and ask the hotel staff how to get there. Be careful with the pickpocketers. They can spot the tourists who wears their shorts.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and location”
Reviews.Author: artstarr
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine and I stayed at the Hotel Regina for 3 days in August. The rooms were clean and spacious (something unexpected after we had just come from Paris). The best part of the hotel may be the location. It's a block away from Placa Catalyuna (where the Aerobus is located), shopping, and Las Ramblas. If you don't have to pay full price for a room (we used a expedia vacation package and got it for cheap) then it might be one of the best deals in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “a bit disappointed”
Reviews.Author: jimmybyron
Reviews.Content: stayed one night after finding the jazz hotel fully booked, check in was ok. location is pretty good. Once in room were disappointed to find that the room looked like it needed a paint, scuff marks on the walls etc. The ac vent was filthy, lucky we could open the balcony doors we were a bit frightened to use the ac ! Beats me why the management can't just book a room out for a day and paint the walls ! also the hall way carpet stained in places. The room was quiet though and the bed , linen was good. Its probably ok value but the jazz is better. Our room rate included breakfast (32e) but we were leaving before 7 so couldn't have the breakfast. I was a bit p*ssed off when the guy at the desk would not refund the 32E. Would not stay there again

Reviews.Title: “great location near las ramblas”
Reviews.Author: familyofsixNJ
Reviews.Content: This hotel was located right off of Las Ramblas and Plaza Catalunya which is right where you want to stay in Barcelona. The metro picks up right down the street and if using the Aerobus from the airport you can get to this hotel for 5 euro each which drops off a block from hotel in plaza catalunya. I believe this is the central area in Barcelona. Hotel is clean... make sure you get the updated rooms. We booked 3 rooms and the two rooms which were with 2 single beds were very updated. The one we got with the double bed was a little older, bathroom was not as updated as the others but still clean. But for the price and location and the complimentary breakfast made it good for traveling with family. I would highly recommend this hotel and wish we booked it for after our cruise as well since the location was so good. Girl at the front desk was so helpful and helped us get into a triple room which i could not book online but she was able to get for me saving me from getting a 4th room for only one person since we traveled with a family of 7.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: GrrlDetective
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect. It's right at Plaza Catalunya, an easy walk from where the airport bus stops. Great for getting to and from the airport at a reasonable price. Also an easy walk to some of the Gaudi buildings. Metro stops are just a few steps away. Also, by booking in advance through the hotel's website, I got a reasonable rate on this hotel. The people working here were all friendly and helpful, providing me with directions and train schedules. This was my second stop in a trip that would involve hotel stays in five different cities. I'd spent the past week in a beautiful hotel in Vienna. When I walked into the hotel, and saw the very nice lobby area, I thought I'd lucked out again with a very nice hotel. Then I got to my room. My room was kind of horrible. It was an L-shaped room, and the area where the bed was located had no access to windows. Also, nothing on one of the walls, just a big white wall. I felt like I was in a little bed crammed in a storage room. Made me feel very closed in and uncomfortable. There was a door that led to a balcony of some sort, but it faced a wall and there was no sunlight entering the room. I suppose the only purpose it served was maybe for smoking. The drapes remained closed as there was no view at all. I don't think all the room were like this. I noticed across the hall, when someone had there door open that they had a big window with lots of sunlight pouring in. Sunlight probably would have made a huge difference regarding my impression of the room. Also, my room reeked of cigarette smoke. It was really bad. I asked to be moved to a non-smoking room and was told that I was in a non-smoking room. For the rest of my trip everything in my suitcase had this cigarette scent attached to it. However, I wasn't in Barcelona to spend time in a hotel room. It served its purpose of providing a bed, a place to change clothes and a shower. I thought the positives - the location, the helpful staff and the price - outweighed the negatives. Now, if I'd paid more for the room, I probably would have been upset with what I got. If I were returning to Barcelona, I wouldn't entirely rule out staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sharkiesgal
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, would definatley stay again. I could not find a fault anywhere. All staff i encountered were very friendly and helpful, including housekeeping staff. The rooms were spotless and very spacious. Great location, felt very safe in the area. I cannot reccommend the hotel enough

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!!”
Reviews.Author: bootskel
Reviews.Content: If it's location you're after you won't get better than this! Hotel was immaculately clean. We booked at last minute and requested good room as we were celebrating a special occasion. Our room was very spacious and we couldn't have been happier. Despite city centre location noise could not be heard. Breakfast is a bit expensive on top of room fee however Starbucks and Subway on same street if you want a small breakfast for a fraction ot the cost! Contrary to other reviews we found the reception staff extremely polite and helpful. We experienced foul smells from the sewers in Barcelona and we could smell them occasionally in the corridor outside our room. From time to time the smell was overpowering in the room as it wafted under the door from the corridor. However this would not deter us from returning and would recommend the hotel to anyone seeking location and comfort in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “What a View!”
Reviews.Author: BoozyP
Reviews.Content: We were here for a long weekend. Very well located for Las Ramblas. We had a standard twin room with balcony with no view to speak of accept the boards that were covering the building to make it look more modern in line with Starbucks downstairs! The beds were of different height and even if you did move over for a snuggle they then moved apart - so much for the romance here! The bathroom was a bit tired and the bath was only a half bath with shower above, bathrobes and slippers were available. Breakfast was straight forward and self service, catering for all. We was a little disappointed as did try and change the room but they were fully booked. However, we would probably book here again if we go there again purely because of the location and is a good base to explore.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a group of friends”
Reviews.Author: totallyjo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located for being walking distance to so many parts of Barcelona like the gothic quarter, main shopping areas, public transport and is really close to the beach too - you can be there within 15 minutes on the underground metro. The hotel itself is what I would call a 2-3 star with comfortable beds, nice enough rooms and all the basics are provided for: towels, toiletries, phone etc Since we were three females in a group it was perfect that they could easily accommodate us. The hotel was quiet, we slept well and enjoyed our stay there. There was no need for us to use any of the other hotel facilities as we were there to see more than a hotel! But all in all a perfect low-medium budget base for a group of not-so-youngsters!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: INNA_BZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 days. The hotel is located near Plaza de Cataluña - so you can immediatedly start exploring the city. The breakfast was great. We also used internet room. The stuff was very helpfull (we forgot telephone in previous hotel and they helped us to get it back).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, a little rough around the edges”
Reviews.Author: Columbia_ScMimi
Reviews.Content: Hotel Regina is well situated just off the hustle and bustle of Las Ramblas, but close enough. Staff was very professional and helpful. We had a very late flight the evening of our check-out and they took care of our 4 large suitcases until we were ready to leave. Beds were comfortable and bathroom toiletries were well appointed, including robes and slippers. The sink in the room was not the best idea in the floor plan. Overall, a good hotel. Many options for breakfast near by since hotel breakfast was overpriced. The rooms could use some refurbishing as wear and tear can be seen. Not a very big deal though.

Reviews.Title: “Back again at the Regina”
Reviews.Author: Sören
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel a few years back, and because of the location and value for money, we decided to come back. Our impression is really the same like the first time. The location is fantastic, the value and the reasonable quality makes it hard to beat. The hotel felt a bit more worn than the first time we stayed here, seems that not too much money is spent on refurbishment. I doubt that we'll be back for a third time. Nevertheless, I you want to stay in center of Barcelona without paying megabucks, we can recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Family of 4 vacation stop - was perfect”
Reviews.Author: jleifer
Reviews.Content: We flew in to Barcelona and had a cruise to catch the next day. The hotel was perfect. The location was right in the heart of the city. starbucks was next door and the main city square was right out the door. They offered to do anything we asked. We were shocked how helpful and kind the staff was. the bar was warm and the lobby was clean and neat. Rooms were typical for a city. They were very clean and neat. Bathrooms were very modern and more than functionable. We are looking forward to finding a reason to go back to Barcelona and enjoy their hospitality for a longer stay. When we returned back from the cruise they stored our luggage until our flight . no charge... Very class act. they sold us on how to treat a guest - Not sure anyone can match their quality but we do travel a bit so we are using them for a benchmark. They also corrdinated private drivers to meet us everywhere we asked

Reviews.Title: “21nd visit since 1984, still excellent all together”
Reviews.Author: rudolf57
Reviews.Content: I have been here numerous of times in the past when the hotel had different flags. Seen most phases of its performance from past to present. Evolved from a local to a very international hotel. The service has allways been good to very excellent depending on ones proper attitude. It is one of Barcelona's most strategic located hotels. 3 or 4 stars discussion not important, you will feel very fine even with rumbling metro line L7 below. Expect some noise. You are in the very heart of the city. This time i found it rather quiet even. But for that you are 100 mtrs located from all the immediate necessary. Tourist tours, Julia, excursion tours, Plaza de Catalunya, McDonald, Burger King, KFC, Corte Ingles department store and good metro connections and a bit further but in walking distance the Aerobuses to the El Prat airport. The service in the hotel this year is the best and fastest i have ever seen. You won't wait 5 minutes to be attended. Staff is very helpfull and will show you where to go. Security is stepped up around Ramblas and Plaza de Catalunya by all kind of police forces. No sign of pickpockets. The FNAC store on the corner is huge and interesting. Should change name , sounds like a bank. I recommend you take a few drinks in evening in the bar. As we have 2 children we were forced to eat at their mandatory fastfood outlets. In the past I dined in the Regina or in the El Corte Ingles Restaurant. The Hotel is perfect for allergic people since they have no carpet. Nice surprise for our youngest. If you take that red tourist bus, do step on and off and visit Gaudi's wonders and the Aquarium. If you leave early for your flight, check out very early or night before. This is a busy hotel that many people like. They can speak enough english these days in barcelona. My kids could do any business themselves. We speak spanish. There is a nice internet corner to google around. My family wishes to return a few more times to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended to anyone”
Reviews.Author: topconker
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit ot this hotel after we discovered it when we got married 3 years ago. From the very moment we arrived till the time we left we were treated extremely well and all our requirements and requests were met without problems. As the hotel is situated so close to La Ramblas it is ideal for us as I do have mobility issues. We would recommende this hotel to anyone visiting Barcelona. Phil & Anne

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: MargGoldCoast
Reviews.Content: Staff friendly , the room was ready on arrival at 11am & great size for the 4 travellers . A Starbucks around the corner, the Ramblas 2 minutes walk & hop on hop off bus 2 minutes walk. Would return.

Reviews.Title: “security problems”
Reviews.Author: lilexysan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Regina on two occassions in July. The 2nd time we arrived with a rental car and while we were unloading luggage someone stole one of our hand bags from the car. That same day another thief walked away with a camera bag right from the lobby of the hotel. After learning about the second theft I spoke to the hotel manager to express my concerns and was told (in short) it was not their responsibility. A font desk person later admitted that thefts are a regular occurance and blamed the legal system for the problems. Unfortunately I cannot recommend this hotel as it does not take the security of its guests seriously. It will take a tragic situation before this hotel begins to take action. On the same trip our family also stayed at a Marriot (about the same cost) and there were constantly staff in the lobby making sure that your were an actual guest and a bell hop ready to assist with bags.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: MSplit
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with friends during a girls stagette. The hotel was clean and spacious, but wouldn't give it a four star rating compared to North American standards. We slept four in a room, and the two extra cots were not very comfortable. Staff was pleasant but not overly helpful. There is no parking and nearby parking in an underground garage is a bit pricey. We found it was best to walk two, three minutes to a taxi stand to grab a taxi, when going out at night.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but slightly frayed”
Reviews.Author: JOCK65
Reviews.Content: Stayed twice at the Regina within the space of 10 days (pre and post cruise)and found its location at the top of the Ramblas and next to Catalunya Square to be excellent for shopping,buses,taxis and general sightseeing. Despite other peoples experiences with the staff we found them to be efficient and helpful BUT you get what you put in so maybe a bit of courtesy towards them would pay dividends when you want early check ins and somewhere to hold your cases after you checkout or taxis,information etc. Anyway down to the Hotel itself the Public areas are pleasant and well kept there is a small free internet cafe.The breakfasts looked good but we did not have any as they are pricey and you can just wander out and go to nearby cafes anyway. The room themselves were probably chic/fashionable/minimalist when it opened 10/12 years ago but now whilst they are clean and functional they are worn around the edges and like the towels slightly frayed.I would also agree with other reviewers that the sound insulation is poor. We stayed in a large family room with our two young children and have no issues with it as we got a good rate, just take the online pictures with a pinch of salt. I do not know how the Hotel rating system works but this is a 3 star not 4 star Hotel. Would we stay there again yes, but not for more than a couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “BIG family room in great location”
Reviews.Author: travel5
Reviews.Content: After staying in several Spanish hotels we welcomed the big family room we had purchased. Finally, we had 4 beds for 4 of us (two adults and two teenagers). The hotel is conveniently located a block away froma Plaza Cataluna, which made it very convenient to walking around town. The only downside to the city was the protest taking place by students and homeless in Plaza Cataluna. We loved Barcelona and fell in love with Gaudi's art. We will be back to Barcelona and to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star? No Way!”
Reviews.Author: Dan15OnTheGo
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights there. Got a very small room close to the lift on the lower floor. Soundproofing of rooms is atrocious; we could hear every footstep and conversation in the vicinity of our room; as if the people were right next to us. Hotel is clearly understaffed; no one to help take luggage from or to taxi. We asked for a one hour extension of checkout on the day we were leaving and got a curt "No" response; no explanations or apology. Front desk clearly not interested in serving guests with a smile; not very helpful especially an elderly sulky old guy with specs; everything was re-directed to the younger chap. It rained badly on the day we were leaving and when we asked whether we could borrow an umbrella, you guessed it, no umbrella. A totally un-satisfactory stay for a 4 Star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: vingummi
Reviews.Content: Really good size room is a huge plus. Bathroom was okay, but looked like it had seen better days - rust stains on the mirror and water stains on the floor. Rough around the edges - looked like it needed some attention. Comfy bed. Bathrobe, slippers and toiletries are a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: esmari
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is centrally located. It is near Plaza Catalunya and Las Ramblas. We took the bus from the Airport and paid 5 Euros per person. We took a taxi upon departure and that was 40 Euros, which included a surcharge per luggage piece. There is a 5 minute walk from Plaza Catalunya to the Hotel. We found the staff to be attentive and gracious in getting our taxi quickly when checking out very early in the morning. A good Chinese Restaurant with reasonable pricing is located direclty across the street. We found the nightly rate a little pricey eventhough we had prepaid our hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location nice modern accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Jadehaw
Reviews.Content: I stayed in hotel Regina for 3 days with my mum and sister and overall we were very happy with the hotel. Staff were friendly enough nice,modern,clean, and spacious room the only falt was that the rooms were very dark ther were only spotlights that were extremely dull but overall we enjoyed our stay and would definetly recommend this hotel as the location is great :) x

Reviews.Title: “Experience spoilt by poor reception service”
Reviews.Author: benny001
Reviews.Content: We ended up at the Regina after booking at their sister hotel (Pulitzer) next door and on arrival being advised they had double booked and we needed to go to the Regina. In general the stay was ok until it came time to check out. On arrival we were advised to get carpark concession from reception before collecting the car. When i asked for this the man rudely advised we should have done this some time earlier and despite my pointing out to him that were not told this continued to tell me it was my problem! My wife checked out while I went to collect the car. For some reason the hotel system did not accept her credit card. On my return I tried mine and a couple of other business cards and in no case would the machine accept them. The man clearly saw this as our problem and offers no solutions and was frankly rude. I walked to the ATM machine at the bank next door, used my card, withdrew the cash and paid in cash. Even then the man insisted it was our problem! We travel relatively frequently and widely staying in various types and classes of accommodation and I can't remember having being treated as rudely.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: Farfallinas
Reviews.Content: I visited Barcelona in November 2010 and I had chosen Hotel Regina. The location is extraordinary, it couldn't have been better than this. It is located in Catalunya Place, where from are starting La Rambla and Rambla de Catalunya. El Corte Ingles is 1 minute away from the hotel and a lot of others stores. I guess the hotel is rated 4* because of the location, otherwise I would give it 31/2*. The rooms are very small, you are almost jump into the bed. For the first night we got a room without windows, which was a little bit strange - no sunlight. I asked the reception stuff to change it, they were gentle and we got another room the next day (I understood that there were not available in the moment I asked for it). The second room had a window and a small balcony, although in front of it there was a very large panel, so there was no view in the street. The rooms have very thin walls, any movement seems to be noisy, especially from the hall. However, it is very clean, the linen are white and gentle touching. We had no breakfast included and the price seemed to me a little bit higher, but I guess it's because of it's central location. Maybe it is worth being booked very early for better prices.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Silvermouse82
Reviews.Content: Good location right at the top of ramblas. The staff were very dismissive, but I think that was the language barrier because they had very poor English and tourist skills!, Not much else to say really! Try somewhere else if you want good help with touristy stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Good room, very random balcony!”
Reviews.Author: Nathalieemma
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely super for what I needed. It could have been anywhere in the world, and a single room had a large single bed only (which is quite unusual in my experience). Everything was clean and tidy and there was a nice fluffy robe and slippers. The shower was good but leaked (didn't flood the bathroom), the mini bar wasn't replenished, and the balcony was just odd (see pictures), but based on what other people told me I got a bargain for where I was staying. The metro rumbles a bit underground, but certainly not enough to actually disturb my sleep. I'd definitely go back here if I went to Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, meh hotel”
Reviews.Author: nonrevver
Reviews.Content: Location of the hotel is perfect for visitors. It's just off Placa Catalyunya and there's a metro stop in front of the door and the airport Aerobus drops you off about a block away. It's at a great location for easy walking access to plenty of different neighborhoods and is around the corner from a lot of shopping options. After walking around and seeing other hotel locations I preferred Regina's the most because it was just off the busy street whereas a lot of the other hotels were right on La Rambla which was too touristy (like Times Square) for me. I was a little disappointed by the service. Upon check-in I was told that we would get a complimentary breakfast which I was surprised to hear about. The next morning we went to breakfast which wasn't anything special (stale pastries, juices, coffee, some eggs, potatoes, various meats, etc.) and then got presented with a bill for almost 20 euros per person (you could have a feast for that price)! I went up to the front desk to clarify and the manager just said that we weren't supposed get complimentary breakfast and laughed it off. Now maybe there was a language barrier from the person who checked us in and I misunderstood, but I didn't appreciate how the situation was handled. The original check-in person also stressed locking our belongings in the safe which I think is a good idea, but made me a little uneasy about how he kept mentioning how important it was for us to do so. Made me think that they've had recent problems with this. As for the room it was fine, but the thermostat didn't keep the room cool at all. It wasn't hot out (60s mostly) so not a big deal, but I'd be worried in the summer. Overall I would stay here again for the location mostly, but would shop around with other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location & lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: jillrussell
Reviews.Content: Regina hotel is in excellent location at top of Las Ramblas. Accomodation at front of hotel with small balcony, Rooms were spacious and beds very comfortable. Excellent friendly staff at reception who were extremely helpful and must be commended for their willingness to give advice and assistance. Breakfast was nice and also one particular female member was extremely attentive and provided pots of tea without having to be asked. However, pick-pockets are very prevalent and we had an unsuccessful (thankfully) attempt on our first night. Barcelona is certainly not a safe venue with little or no police presence - whenever we saw a police car the guards were standing around in groups laughing and smoking amongst themselves - not very professional! There is no restaurant in this hotel so the provision of tea/coffe making facilities within rooms should be considered by management.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: andrewpeat
Reviews.Content: Very well done out hotel with large rooms in a good location. 2 decent restaurants opposite

Reviews.Title: “City trip”
Reviews.Author: touristtt
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very conveniently located off the Plaza de Cataluna, walking distance from the shuttle bus from the airport and to all main shops and great restaurants. The staff was very friendly, we stayed two nights, hotel was clean and quiet, breakfast very nice. The room was a little small from the price and even though we had asked for a queen, we got a twin room. General impression: OK, would book there again.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location, Super Staff, Breakfast 'til 12”
Reviews.Author: CM1977
Reviews.Content: This is a perfectly located hotel at the top of Las Ramblas near Playa de la Cataluna (my spelling may be wrong) It's about 30 seconds walk from the bus from the airport, all the tourist buses, the metro & right between the gothic area & Gracia avenue where the 2 Gaudi house are. Right in the middle of everything and yet completely peaceful once you're through the door. The staff are great - really efficient but you never notice them around. (They don't do the fake smile thing but don't be put off by that, every single one is outstandingly professional) Room was lovely - 2 large comfortable double beds. Bathroom was large & had plenty towels, robes, slippers & toiletries. Breakfast which was a buffet with a lovely selection of hot & cold options, was served until 12. Hadn't planned on having breakfast late but the room was so comfortable, quiet and dark when the curtains were drawn that we slept 'til after 10 both days we were there. Also, free wifi in the rooms. There's a bar in the lounge which is a lovely space & the barmen were, again, super professional & friendly. I don't think there's a restaurant but there did seem to be a room service menu. We were eating out so I didn't pay too much attention to it tbh. To top it off they sent a thank you email after we got home. Really, really nice touch. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Greate location, nice rooms, recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Guy293982
Reviews.Content: After a huge disappointment with our booked hotel room, my wife and me moved to the Hotel Regina. Beside a small problem with the A/C, our stay was very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in great location!!”
Reviews.Author: UK-jenster
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and had a thoroughly enjoyable time there. Staff were all very helpful and attentive (especially the breakfast waitress). The room although arguably a little small was very clean and the bed was comfortable. Subway noise can be heard inside the hotel, however you will find this a reoccuring theme within different establishments throughout Barcelona...you soon get used to it. The hotel is only a matter of yards from the Catalunya Square, therefore it really is perfectly placed for sightseeing and very good for travel to and from the airport (aerobus terminates and departs from the Square). I also received a birthday cake from the hotel which was a lovely gesture and thoroughly appreciated!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, Great price, great location”
Reviews.Author: mini9184
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with a friend and I loved it, for the price we were very pleasantly suprised, the room was spacious, clean, with a nice modern decor, we even had a tiny step out "balcony" (handy for smokers..!). For some reason the bathroom sink was in the bedroom and not in the bathroom with the shower, but I've noticed it elsewhere so I'm guessing it's how most spanish hotels are? Either way, it didn't bother me. The hotel is literally 30 seconds away from the Catalunya Square and the tube stop, also there are a gazillion taxis around so it's very handy for moving around, and it's very nice to be able to just walk out and stroll down La Rambla and into the Bario Gotico. Breakfast was good, there were all the basics, scrambled eggs, bacon, cereal, croissants, but also pizza, the local bread with tomato, hams and cheese. A good selection. I would most definetly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for location and value”
Reviews.Author: StewsOnTour
Reviews.Content: Selected Hotel Regina after looking at reviews and, being honest, that it was within my budget of the selection of reviewed hotels. Excellent location, rooms very nice, mine was quite spacious and everything that we required was available. Not overly plush, but then I wasn't expecting that, but certainly far better than some other hotels I've stayed in on visits to Barcelona. Would recommend this hotel to anyone going to this great city

Reviews.Title: “Safe and central, but worn and noisey.”
Reviews.Author: norwegian68
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in a superior room with our children in January. Entrance and lobby is dark as others have mentioned but fine.First impression here was fine.Receptionist showed us to our room and explained how to use the safe and gave practical information about the room. The room:situated to the back of the hotel with a view of the busy shopping street below,4th floor with the El Triangel sign just below us.The rooms on this side of the hotel have not yet been refurnished:old windows,poor drainage and worn furniture. The children had an alcove towards the window with two beds.All the beds were very comfortable and noise from the street was not a problemHowever, we did have a problem with noise within the hotel.There is,I would say,no soundproofing between the rooms.We were very unlucky to have two ladies in the room next to us who obviously didn`t need to sleep.The first night it actually sounded as though they were in our bathroom taking a bath.They sang and talked all night which ment we virtually had no sleep.So after the second night we told reception we would like to change rooms because of the noise and were told to keep our room, but if it happened again to call down to them and they would deal with it.OK.So on the third night I obviously had to ring reception because they were just as noisey as the previous nights.The man who took my call could not speak English very well and said he would come up to our room.I have to say I found him a little scary and would not have felt comfortable speaking to him if I had been alone.The noise stopped for about an hour and then they were off again.What a nightmare!!!!!Lucky enough they were" only " staying 3 nights so our last night we finally got some sleep. Your sleep in this hotel depends on the goodwill of fellow guests who take in to consideration the poor soundproofing, because of this I would not stay here again nor would I recommend the hotel.There are plenty of hotels just as central as the Regina, the only problem could be if like us you have children and would prefer to stay in one room and not two you may have to stay in an apartment.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutly fine for a few days in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: nalish
Reviews.Content: The views from the room wasn't great but it was clean, spacious and in a fabulous location. We didn't have any of the noise problems that others seemed to have had either. . Service was not overly friendly but efficient and quite acceptable. If you have just a few days to sample Barcelona you really couldn't get a much better location and my kids loved running up and down the stairs!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: intervention
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a terrific location. Supermarket and train station across the road, la rambla ( main walking tourinst street) five minutes walk away and the cities major department store five minutes away. All within eyesight of the hotel, yet the hotel was situated where there wasn't a lot of noise. Restaurants and cafes also very close. This was very important to us as we went in winter and didn't want to waste time travelling to places. it also felt like a very safe area to be in. I felt very comfortabe walking around by myself even at night, as everything was very lit up and the spanish dine out and have shops open till very late. We didn't have breakfast included and it seemed vvery espensive to pay for seperately. There was plenty of well priced food nearby and even a large fresh food maket nearby. We walked to the beach area. That was a bit far but a very pleasant walk. We like walking so it wasn't a problem but if you went in warmer weather and liked the beach it might be a bit far to go. Overall, a well priced, clean, attractive and spacious place.

Reviews.Title: “If you want a restful stay, this is NOT the Hotel for you...”
Reviews.Author: 1Worldtraveler00
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Regina is in the perfect location, just around the corner from "Las Ramblas", and directly across the street from the Metro. It's an older Hotel, but was tidy with clean rooms and a nice lounge area. However, I would not recommend this Hotel, as the walls are paper thin and we could hear every sound made by the housekeeping staff and other Hotel guests. We booked four rooms for our extended Christmas family vacation, for 9 adults and 1 child. The housekeeping staff staging area was located on our floor. This consisted of an archaic service elevator and supply room, which was accessed from early morning until evening daily. The loud clanking continued throughout the day and evening for our entire 9 day stay. Although the housekeeping staff and bartenders were wonderful, I was shocked that the front desk staff refused to ask our upstairs neighbor to refrain from allowing their child to run sprints back and forth in the hall at 2 am, on the floor above. We were told, "we can't help you with that., but we can give you their room number and you can call yourself if you'd like." You could literally hear every minute sound. The bare hardwood floors and thin walls made getting a goodnight sleep nearly impossible! This would not be the place for honeymooners. On a brighter note, although there is no restaurant on site, delicious meals are available via room service from the Hotel next door. The food is very good and the prices are reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel.. Ticks all the boxes”
Reviews.Author: Lasfromleeds
Reviews.Content: I was a little apprehensive as I've never been to Barcelona and wasn't sure which hotel to choose. I settled for Regina.. And me along with my three friends were not disappointed. Staff were lovely.. Who never failed to help. The room was spacious for us all and everthing looked and worked brilliantly. Location is fantastic as your two mins away from everything.. It's just opposite the main square. If I'm to come back i will defo come back here.. Thank you for making our stay that more special.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, modern rooms and fabulous cocktails!”
Reviews.Author: CorkOwl
Reviews.Content: We couldn't believe how close to the very centre this hotel was- on a side street just off Placa Catalunya- less than a 2 min walk from the square that's on the top of La Ramblas. Yet the hotel is far enough away not to be noisy at night, and the street is very quiet at night. The room we stayed in was small- but I've stayed in smaller rooms in higher star hotels in London, and so I expected it in such a central hotel. Esp as we booked through a discount website and not directly. The bed did take up most of the bedroom space and the window looked out over a dark alleyway so not much natural light. However the room looked to be recently refurbished and was very comfortable and I didn't feel at all claustrophobic despite the room size. The bathroom was gorgeous, and the shower was wonderful- very powerful. The toiletries they provide are lovely and they also provide robes and slippers. There's also free internet all over the hotel, which is great if you've a laptop or iphone. The bar is really nice- big comfortable sofas and a big cocktail menu. The staff in the hotel are all very friendly and helpful. They also have discount rates for the bus tours and are quite happy to book restaurants and answer any questions. I really couldn't fault this hotel at all and if we return to Barcelona it would definitely be our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Some positives, a few negatives. Seems rooms vary immensely.”
Reviews.Author: scouserjapan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family for five nights for my birthday. I had quite a lot of contact with the hotel before we arrived and they always were very courteous with their replies and advice. We took the cheapest bed and breakfast option yet still seemed to have received a large room. They had also prepared a cot for my son. As far as I could see all the rooms are street facing yet I cannot guarantee that. This meant there is some signifcant street noise despite there being two windows and three (!) curtains. The rooms are a little dated and one window did not quite close fully. Staff were fine but often seemed rather rushed. Breakfast was adequate but not exceptional and reminded me a little of an Ibis hotel breakfast. The hotel is very centrally located at the top of La Ramblas and next to a metro station. I would recommend this hotel dependant on the room you receive and of course the rate per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location good service but thin walls”
Reviews.Author: JenniePernilla
Reviews.Content: Think I will stay at Regina again despite the thin walls. Can't find a better location, the rooms were nice (but the sofa was hard). The staff helped us reserve tables a great restaurants. Brought my PC and used the Internet access but they also had computors you could easy borrow for free.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible room, but the common areas were nice.”
Reviews.Author: OU812Kiev
Reviews.Content: Sorry I am taking so long to review this hotel after my stay in March 2010. I will preface this review by saying that I live in Europe and have stayed in hundreds of hotels in the region. I'm accustomed to small rooms, and I think I'm a reasonable reviewer of hotels. I don't require top-notch luxury if I'm not paying a lot of money. But I have to say this was the worst room I've had in a highly rated TripAdvisor hotel and a terrible experience given the amount of money we spent for the room. After seeing other reviewers' photos, I see that perhaps my experience was unusual, but be warned that it could be you next time.
