Granted, we chose the least expensive room when booking, but even the least expensive room at this rate should have been better. My girlfriend and I checked in late and after waiting 15 minutes for the front desk employee to get off the phone, we were given a terribly small, dark, depressing, windowless room. I say windowless, but it actually did have a tiny high window that opened a little into a crawlspace/alley that was perpetually dark. The room itself was stark with the bed taking up almost the entire space. The bathroom was equally unimpressive. We asked immediately for a room change, but the front desk employee said that no others were available that night. He said he would switch the room in the following day or two. Every day we checked back, but to no avail. The only positive I can say about the hotel was that the entry way and common areas were nicely designed in a modern style. And it had a good location for touring. But we wanted nothing to do with the hotel and strived to be out as much as possible. I do not recommend that you choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A FANTASTIC LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: PlymouthJoeyA
Reviews.Content: What a gem of a hotel, so close to everything and such large rooms. Such good value for money and the little extras are so sweet, there are dressing gowns and new slippers awaiting in the bathroom and even lady and gentleman packs, for those little bits you might have forgotten. The hotel itself could do with lighter decoration as there are always lights on due to a lot of dark wood but that is a small price to pay. The staff are very smiley and extremely courteous, very accomodating and friendly. Well done, customer service at its best. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: cuxtongirl149
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was of a good standard, however there were several things that really let it down and caused us (the customer) more hassle than we wanted. When we arrived early the staff appeared to be quite accomodating and gave us a room key etc - when we got to the room it was appalling, next to a cleaner's cupboard and with no window - it was small and not worthy of the 118 euros my now fiancee (he proposed in Barcelona) paid for it. After going back to reception I said that I was not happy with the room, the staff member (whose name was maybe Sr. Jose?) did not argue but said ok, as I began to justify why I wanted to change he was quite rude and did not listen to my reasons which outlined what we wanted. He offered us another room but said we'd need to wait until it was clean - that was fine and we went for a stroll. When we got back his colleague (who was really nice) showed us the room - we still weren't happy with it really, it had a window but no view as it was behind a billboard. I said that this was a birthday treat and could he not organise a nicer room for us. He was again very rude and ignored what I'd said but claimed that this was the last room in the hotel! We reluctantly accepted the room and did have a really nice time in Barcelona. When we checked out two days later the staff were so friendly and polite, as were the breakfast staff who served us. The location is brilliant, the breakfast is brilliant, rooms vary, the actual standard is good but some have either no window or decent view, the staff vary - some were brilliant some were really rude and unwelcoming, with lack of understanding for customer service. Seriously dampened the start of our visit to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff... rooms were ok”
Reviews.Author: Electricious
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Regina was almost perfect. The staff members were extremely helpful and very polite. The hotel itself is quite beautiful inside. The decor is in dark, earthy colors, giving it a warm and cozy feeling. Everything is extremely clean. In comparison to the rest of the hotel, the room was a bit disappointing. We had booked a double room and though immaculate, it was very cramped. The minimalist decor would have been better if everything hadn't been just black and white. As there were construction works going on outside the hotel, the room's window provided us with absolutely no natural light. This made the room seem very dark even in the middle of the day. It did make for a good night's sleep though. The rooms were comfortable and quiet. Breakfast was good. There was something for everyone. The breakfast room staff didn't speak English which proved to be difficult for some people. I speak Spanish but my friend didn't, so when I came down for breakfast my friend was struggling to explain to the staff member that coffee had run out in the decanter. Funny for me, maybe not so much for others. If you're staying with friends or family this is a good hotel to stay at. The location is excellent and the staff is really nice. If this is a romantic getaway, then I would recommend staying somewhere else. Tiniest bathtub ever!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: JH1076
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Regina in October of '09. The hotel is modern and comfortable and the staff was superb! Our room was huge and the bed was very comfortable. My only complaint was you could hear/feel the subway late into the night but once I was able to fall asleep, I slept in every morning! They provide computers and free internet in the lobby which is very convenient. The location was great! Right off Las Ramblas without the noise (minus the subway) and crowds. We were there for our anniversary and the management thoughtfully had cava and chocolates delivered to our room. We will definitely stay there again when we go back to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Not quite a four star property”
Reviews.Author: foodists
Reviews.Content: I would rate the Hotel Regina much closer to a three-star than a four-star property. It's obvious that they've undergone some renovations (lobby and bar area are nicely furnished), but a coat of paint and updated IKEA furnishings do not a four star property make. The location of the hotel is excellent -- great things w/in walking distance and one-half block from the Metro. The common areas (especially the hallways) are right out of a 1970's B-movie set: cheap carpet, wood-panel doors, institutional color palette, etc. The amenities are limited and cheap (no soap for the shower?). The sinks (there were 2 sinks in our room) were located as part of the living/sleeping area (common layout for European and Asian hotels). One of our sinks was perpetually clogged. We notified the front desk of this problem but they failed to correct it during our 3 night stay. Although there was plenty of hot water for the shower, because the glass "door" extended along only one-third the length of the bathtub, the result was a very drafty shower. There was an itty bitty balcony with our room w/ enough space for two people to stand upright (but certainly no sitting) that had a very nice view of the "Triangle," the area just beyond Placa Catalunya. The hotel is woefully understaffed. There was no doorman or porter/bellhop so we were left to our own struggles to get our many bags through the front door and up the stairs to the aging (and SMALL) elevator. They had a business centre w/ free and fast internet access but we did occasionally have issues w/ WiFi from the room. Generally, an adequate hotel, but doesn't live up to other Spanish (including Barcelona) four star properties.

Reviews.Title: “Great location making a short trip easy, safe and memorable.”
Reviews.Author: Minty_Fresh_10
Reviews.Content: This palce is really great! I love how it's so conveniently located near Placa Catalunya. Just across the street there's a mini grocery, and half a block down you will find the red tour buses and the airport bus (no need to transfer!). My friend and I only had a couple of days to see barcelona so I thought booking a hotel that's central would be best. We arrived after 1AM because our flight was delayed, and they gave us a small discount which was reasonable. The whole trip was excellent, we were able to go to all the museums and parks during the day by red tour buses which starts at the Placa Catalunya (all buses passby this block), took the Metro and walked around the gothic quarters and the surrounding areas because it's really just a few blocks away. There are a few familiar shops around the area, but you can also take the tour bus that stops right across the malls. The only thing I didn't like are the cafes and some restaurants in the area. They all tasted as though they microwave just about everything. We were able to sum a lot of Barcelona in 2 days. If we stayed further out we would have spent just as much on cabs and waste time on trying to figure out the bus and train schedules. Plus the staff is great! Although the concierge didn't explain that there are TWO red bus compaines meaning TWO different line ups (which you can figure out once you get there), everything else was great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: crek
Reviews.Content: we stayed there for 3nights and it was really excellent. Room was clean and large, close to Catalunya place where we can take a bus to everywhere, and it was cheap with this value. I highly recommend anyone who goes to barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: philbern
Reviews.Content: Staff were helpful in allowing us to change our arrival/departure dates because of a general strike in Spain and the subsequent cancellation of our flights. The Regina is in a very good location - just a few strides from Placa Catalunya and La Rambla. Front counter staff were pleasant and helpful and their English was good. We were lucky enough to get an upgrade to an Executive Room which had a sink in the bathroom and not in the main room - although it wouldn't have bothered us much either way. Everything worked OK.. the aircon was good and the shower was a good temperature and pressure. The bedroom had a laminate wood floor which was a pleasant change from carpets, which, as we all know, can become the low point of many a room. The lifts were a bit dodgy and were out of order a couple of days. They - or should I say it - is quite small, but luckily we were allowed to use the service lift when needed. Check-in/out was efficient. Rooms have safe and minibar (expensive). A Starbucks round the corner and a supermarket right across the street as well as a bar/cafe provided ample opportunities for breakfast (I wouldn't advise having the in-hotel fare as it's not brill and quite expensive). The area appeared safe and while there was some traffic noise at night it wasn't too bad, The beds are two singles pushed together, which is something you've got to live with a lot of the time in Europe if you're travelling as a couple. The hotel bar was OK and there were a couple of internet PCs available for limited free use as was a printer. Being our first trip to Barcelona we wanted it to be memorable and the Regina helped us in that. We'd definitely consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: thomas054
Reviews.Content: Great location, very nice hotel, lovely staff. Only problem was that the rooms had poor sound insulation. Ours was just above the bar and hence quite noisy. Ask for a room to the atrium at the end of the hallway and you should be fine. Also the quality in the bar varied quite a bit, from very good to barely okay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Budget Traveler”
Reviews.Author: FabricDancer
Reviews.Content: I ended up with a reservation at this hotel instead of its sister property, Hotel Pulitzer (right next door). So, watch the website link you are taken to...to ensure you're reserving at your preferred property. The accommodations at Hotel Regina were fine though it does lack luster in terms of decor. The room I had was simple and not one to 'hang-out' in. It served as a home base and for sleeping primarily. The excellent room rate obtained was due to the room being located just over an underground transportation line that didn't shut down until about midnight and would start up about 6:00a.m. the following morning. I was so tired from jetlag and being on the go, that the first few nights...this didn't bother me. But over the 8 nights of my stay, there were a couple nights when it was a bit annoying. Overall, the room was clean, and desk staff were helpful. There was no breakfast included with my room rate.

Reviews.Title: “On The Money”
Reviews.Author: mos13_2000
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Barcelona for my 30th earlier this year. Having never been to Barcelona and not knowing anyone who had, we booked the Regina purely on location and web reviews. ...and the Regina did not disappoint. Our room was huge with his and her sinks, a small balcony overlooking the main city square and a huge King size bed. The hotel itself was peaceful and offered a great night's sleep. Location is simply fantastic. Just at the top of the Ramblas, by the main square which gives fantastic access to all the tourist sights, food and drink areas, tourist bus services, public transport and a 25 minute walk to the seafront. Our visit to Barcelona was equally as good. Out of all of the European cities we have visited, my wife and I both agree to Barcelona being the best. Really quirky drinking places, plenty of culture and history, a football stadium thrown in and a fantastic beach front. All boxes ticked. I have already recommended the Regina to friends and they also had a great experience when they stayed. Just make sure you check the directions from the airport to the hotel carefully. We printed some that were wrong and had a bit of a panic then a long walk from the tube station to the hotel on arrival. Also make sure you get a local guide book on food and drink as there are some real gems in the city that are hidden away that we would have never found if we hadn't gone prepared. (There's a bar with a rainforest theme that has storms and fountains that is a must but very secluded). If that's not your cup of tea, the hotel is also 200 yards from Macdonalds and Hard Rock Cafe! Barcelona = great. Turning 30, no so good.

Reviews.Title: “Regina Hotel has an Excellent location in Plaza CAtaluna in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan999984
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Regina for 3 nights after a Mediterranean cruise. The staff was excellent specially Carmen. It's location is fantastic, just a couple of blocks away from las /Ramblas, but you don't have the noisy of the crowd of Las Ramblas. However with the rooms, they are very closed to each other and at night when you come back to restetimes you can hear the conversations and noises from your neighboors. Also the doors don't close normally, you have to bang them to get them properly closed. This is really a problem, because after 3 or 4 o'clock in the morning you can hear these noices from guest leaving the hotel and you feel they are happening in your own room.Before our cruise we stayed for 2 nights at another 2 stars guesthouse, and didnot have to confront this situation.In all this is the only complaint we have, an very honest not good for what we paid. Jose L. Perez (stayed from 10-10-10 th. 10-13-10

Reviews.Title: “The Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Orchid73
Reviews.Content: Hotel Regina did not disappoint. Our group of 6 arrived, and were pleasantly surprised that we were all upgraded to their best rooms. The front desk was very friendly and helpful, and quick the service us as we entered. Upon entering our rooms, we all found champagnes in our rooms as a welcome. What a fantastic way to start our trip! We stayed in #410, the room was very clean, very spacious and the view from the 2 balconies were amazing. The beds were comfortable enough, and never did we fear for our safety in a foreign city - it was in a good location. Sure, it was a bit noisy - but what do you expect, when we were there during La Merce Festival? It's noisy everywhere! The hotel is in the perfect location to everything. Steps away from the main shopping area, steps away from La Ramblas and steps away from Starbucks. lol. You really can't go wrong with staying here, it's very convenient!

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm with Modern Convenience and Comfort”
Reviews.Author: uopercival
Reviews.Content: Our group was delighted when we checked in to find that we had all been upgraded to rooms with views. Our room was on the top floor overlooking the busy street below. The room was not noisy when the balconies were closed was very roomy. We were even treated to a special gift from the hotel manager! The room was large and clean as the floor were laminate wood. Our room came with some nice little touches like his and hers sinks with toothbrushes, robes, slippers, turn down service on the first night, free internet, in room bar with reasonable prices. Yes, there is some background noise when there's a festival happening outside or when the subway train passes beneath the street below but overall I didn't have any problems sleeping and would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “A Truly Enjoyable Experience”
Reviews.Author: franhalp
Reviews.Content: We spent two days at Hotel Regina before embarking on a cruise. We had a very enjoyable stay. We advised that we were celebrating an anniversary and a bottle of champagne greeted us as we entered our room. Our room was very spacious and looked out into the square. The staff was marvelous and very attentive. We will definitely return to this hotel when we are in Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: kung_jenny
Reviews.Content: Totally love this hotel, from the deco, location, friendly staff and service! Would love to stay there again! I was impressed by the service because i had asked for the city's festival program prior to my arrival months ago, and it was not released at the time. 2 Weeks before my arrival, they still remembered and send me the information! Would totally stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: benry62
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights on business. Room was basic but clean and comfortable (my view was not so great). Staff were courteous and very helpful, the location was excellent. I would have no qualms in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but big let down in cleanliness and noisiness!”
Reviews.Author: Smellseys
Reviews.Content: - Fabulous location, so close to everything - Breakfast only average, juice not freshly squeezed (in a land of plenty I don't get this), poor choice and warm breakfast was extremely greasy and unappetising. - Sheets were only changed once in 4 days, and that was because I stripped the bed myself and so the cleaner had to put a new sheet on. My sheet had a little blood on it as I cut my finger on the first day and so I left the sheets back so the cleaner would see it would need changing but when I returned at the end of the day I saw the cleaner had simply put the quilt cover back on teh bed but had left the bloody sheet unchanged! - Room 314 : avoid - very noisy and no decent window so little/no natural light

Reviews.Title: “Courteous staff & excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: SDH71
Reviews.Content: We tried this hotel during a 2night stopover on the basis of previous trip advisor reviews & completely satisfied with all aspects. The hotel staff were friendly & courteous, spotless rooms with large well equipped bathrooms. The location was ideal for all tourist attractions & 2min walk to the main bus area for connections to nearby attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: Veronika2010
Reviews.Content: phantastic location a few steps away from the Ramblas and a lot of exciting museums, tapas bars, restaurants, shops; the bus stop to the airport is very close by at Placa Catalunya; there are lot of shops, and if you go into the side streets, you find a neighbourhood bars and restaurants with no tourist (other than yourself); the hotel is a bit noisy due to traffic, and a bit old fashioned and dark in design, but very clean, offering free internet connection in the business lounge; the check in staff is particularly friendly and forthcoming; we have stayed there during all of our trips over the past few years

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied!!!”
Reviews.Author: MVM924
Reviews.Content: I could not have asked for a better place to have stayed. The hotel, the staff; in particular, Isaac & Mr. Gamito. They went out of their way to accomodate my sister and me during our 4 day stay at Hotel Regina. Unbeknownst to me, the staff noticed my birth date on my passport. Upon our returned from touring the city, I had a beautiful chocolate torte waiting for me in the room, in honor of my birthday - 9/24. I feel very privileged and honored to share the same birthday with Barcelona's Patron, "Le Merce". Barcelona will always have a special place in my heart, as well as Hotel Regina. Muchas Gracias! Mercedes

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, Fantastic and Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: pixiebe11
Reviews.Content: Hotel Regina was fantastic place right in the heat of the city of Barcelona it was walking distance to all the main places from Las Rambles, some of Gaudi artwork and beach. The hotel room clean, tidy and made us feel like a princess with comp bathrobes. the price was very reasonable

Reviews.Title: “I would highly recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Alwayshonest39
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in August with my kids 19 and 22. We loved the location. The staff was helpful, the room clean, and my kids, who are used to 4 star hotels, loved the room. Only issue, the housecleaner cleaned the room next door around 8am. Early for Barcelona standards..and there are thin walls. Other than that? Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RamziM
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel located in a quiet street less than 100 m form piazza Cataluna and the metro stop, and walking distance to the Ramblas. Spacious rooms, very good amenities. Friendly and helpful staff specially Luis at the front desk. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in the Best location.”
Reviews.Author: blondespot11
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I just stayed here for a week. You will not find a better hotel for the price in a better location. You are in the center of the city. You have access to cabs, buses and subway to get you any where you want to go. The subway system in Barcelona is amazing. It is clean, fast and easy to use. You are within walking distance to Las Ramblas which is a wonderful maze of streets with all kinds of different shops. This hotel was perfect. The rooms are big and the AC is great. The beds are comfortable and linens are clean and comfortable. The staff will do anything to make you happy. They recommend places to visit and restaurants to go to. When you get to the airport, I highly recommend the Aerobus. It is a light blue bus that goes from the airport to 3 or 4 stops in the city. The last stop is Placa Catalunya. Get off here and walk across the plaza to Hotel Regina. Its 5 euro a person. Really nice buses. A cab will cost you much more. Super convenient. If you are looking for a place to stay in Barcelona, stop looking. You found it. When I return to Barcelona, and I will, I know I will stay here. Its the best.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Moggie1957
Reviews.Content: Superb location, easy trip in from the airport. At the top of Las Ramblas. Lots of hotel and bars to pick from nearby. Almost on top of the metro, so access to all parts of the city is easy. Good staff, attentive, but not pushy. Great bar, very good service and amazing measures on the spirits, try the irish coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in Barcelona, some small inconveniences”
Reviews.Author: JC_and_JS
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Regina end of August for 4 days. Situated near Plaza Catalunya it is well located in the city, nearby almost everything. An extra advantage for this location is the fact you can take from the airport the airport bus, which drives directly to Plaza Catalunya. The drive takes about 30 minutes. We were postively surprised we could check in already at morrnings, which made the first day already as a real holiday. The hotel staff is very friendly, however some of them lack a good knowledge of Barcelona itself. Asked at the reception desk for how much a taxi costs to some place in Barca, the answer was “I do not know, I never take a taxi in Barcelona…” . The standard room we booked was not entirely what we expected. It was not large and spacious as mentioned in the brochure, but rather small and it had just a very small window, giving a view to an ugly wall nearby.The biggest problem was the noice, coming from doors that were closed (slammed) everywhere in the corridor. Breakfast was all ok, with the advantage of having Spanish hours (you can take breakfast till noon!). In general we found this hotel a good choice, especially for its great location in Barcelona, allowing to do almost everything by walking.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: J_McCNorfolk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location, just off Catalunya Plaza. It is about a 200 meter walk from the place where the Aeroport Bus stops as well (8.5 Euros for a return ticket). The rooms were not very big, but there was more than enough space. The beds were big and comfortable and the efficient air-con was a blessing in the 30 degree heat. This is not 5-star luxury, but it is very comfortable and stylish. If I went back to Barcelona for another city-break I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay Exceed my expectation”
Reviews.Author: edison074
Reviews.Content: I came across Hotel Regina Barcelona from Tripadvisor, after reading the review, I booked the hotel for 3 nights. The room is excellent, spacious, equipped with Free WIFI, Security Box. Good location very near La Rambla tourist area and also next to Catalunya metro and shopping area. The staff is helpful and polite, on the first day stay, I was given complimentary bottle of wine and subsequently when I mentioned that I don’t drink, the reception replace with bucket of fruits. Hotel guests have free access to Holmes Place Fitness Centre however, it is about 3 block away (10 to 15 minutes walk) The fitness centre is equipped swimming pool, sauna, Jacuzzi. I didn’t spend much time there because there is a lot of shopping around. Good value of money and I booked the room directly via the hotel website. Will definitely recommend to friend.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended if you're not too fussy, not expecting luxury and just want somewhere to sleep on a city leisure trip”
Reviews.Author: PasserbyPiPeR
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in August for first time Barcelona tourism, which entitled to us to a long stay discount (probably regarded as quite expensive otherwise). The location is very good - Passeig de Gracia where the renfe trains from airport connects is very close, and perfectly located by the Placa Catalunya for walkable access to both the new town (for Gaudi architectures) and the old town (for catedral and la rambra) and restaurants are great. Staff were capable of speaking English but occasionally difficult to communicate - otherwise very friendly and helpful. Good selection was provided for breakfast and the fact that it was available from 7-12 was very handy. 3 computers available in the lounge for free access to internet was useful too. The rooms were generally modern, simple and clean, and the beds were comfortable but quite small and bathrooms were somewhat moldy... Something I wouldn't have expected from four star hotel. We were also allocated a disabled facilitated room which was more inconvenient to get around, let alone it was already small, because of the extra handles etc. Also beware of the thin walls - you can hear the people next door and the movements in the corridor. Good enough if you just need a comfortable bed to sleep in after a long day of walking,

Reviews.Title: “Great location and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: walnutlobe
Reviews.Content: Last year we went to Barcelona because we were going on a cruise. Checked the reviews about this hotel and did not regret choosing it. Very close to the Rambla, restaurants and some shopping, and bus stations. There is a Corte Ingles walking distance. Very clean and comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mvsteve
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night prior to going on a cruise. We are a family of four - we have two girls, six and eight. I found and chose this hotel based on the fact that it had a room that could accommodate all four of us - not so easy to find in Europe. When we arrived we were super tired and also a little early. They rushed to get the room ready for us way ahead of the regular check in time. The room was great! Super clean, modern and big. There were two singles in a separate alcove, and a big, comfortable bed in the middle. The location is perfect for tourists. It sits right at the top of La Rambla and has great food all around. It's right near the plaza and there's a taxi stand and bus stops right there. Don't do the bus tour! Too crowded, waste of time and too expensive. Cabs are everywhere and very reasonable. It would be cheaper to see everything by cab - seriously.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - great location, rooms and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: DaniRMelbourne
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just off "La Rambla" which is perfect. It's a 5 minute walk to the main action! You don't want to stay right on La Rambla in August because it's very noisy and busy. The hotel itself has excellent rooms, great breakfast and very comfortable. It has a large convenience store accross the road for your necessities (water & snacks) and a star bucks next door. It's also only a 4 blocks from La Predera and about 30 minutes walk to Sagrada familia. The only negative is that the rooms are a little on the small side but I would rather comfort, luxury and small then large and not comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “we got more than what we expected”
Reviews.Author: boysau
Reviews.Content: hi we stayed at hotel Regina on august 7th for one night returning from a cruise.... we were very happy with the location...SO central, next to the hop on Hop off bus, as well as the Rambla and the big shopping store El Corte Inglis our room was #110, and just super nice....we had book and paid in April (as you get an extra 20% rebate on hotel reservation page .) we thank the manager as when we came back from our day excursion, he had delivered a bottle of Champagne to our Room, as I had mentioned in reservation( back in april) that it was our 20th wedding anniversary...so i was EXTREMELY impress that they remembered my comment 4 months before.... thank you very much Natalie and Francois

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for a City Break”
Reviews.Author: holidayaholics
Reviews.Content: 18 - 22 Jul 2010 This hotel came highly recommended and it lived up to expectations, couldn't fault it. Spotlessly clean. Excellent quiet location, airport bus and the metro a couple of minutes walk away. The breakfast, although a bit expensive was very good, plenty of variety. and not a paper napkin in sight. Had no problems with noise either from our neighbours or road traffic The staff at this hotel deserve all the praise they get. We will definitely come back to this hotel next time we are in Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Very thankful parents”
Reviews.Author: SBC109
Reviews.Content: Our son had to be hospitalized. We were in US & didn't speak language. Andrea, Alberto, and Rafael were unbelievable - translating with hospital, assisting in middle of night when he returned. They went above & beyond without hesitation. My son says the hotel is beautiful & great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: ShadowTiger
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty nice hotel. Rooms are good, clean, comfortable, quiet. (Note: I had a room a the end of a hallway, so that may have helped with noise, but I also had balcony windows facing the street.) Plenty of room, nice bathroom, desk, TV with english channels (three, I think, all news-related, though MSNBC showed Leno and a couple other things at night). Internet connection was fine. Didn't try the breakfast based on other reviews, but there is a starbucks just around the corner. In fact, the hotel is in a great location, a half-block away from Plaza Catalunya and La Rambla. Tons of resturants (local, touristy, and fast food). Metro hub/station. I will stay here again if I need to go back to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and modern room”
Reviews.Author: nusmik
Reviews.Content: Stayed from 13 to 15 July 2010. Nicely located near Placa Cataluyna but away from the busy La Ramblas. Walking distance from the Aerobus drop off point. A small grocery shop is just opposite the hotel. The rooms are comfortable but the soundproofing can be better, can easily hear other hotel guests on the same floor going in & out of their rooms. Hotel staff are friendly and speak good English. Asked for double queen bed but only twins are available.The hotel is also next to one of the Hop-on-hop-off Bus drop-off points. You can buy the Hop-on-hop-off bus ticket from the hotel and get a discount, too bad we have already bought ours from the Tourist Centre (Turisme) along La Ramblas. We can also walk to Passeig De Gracia for shopping & visit Casa Batlo & Casa Mila.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: conygar
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 days in July. Excellent location just off La Ramblas and near Catalunya Place. Staff very helpful and room good, although facing street it had good double glazing so traffic noise was not a problem. Good choice at breakfast although hot selection was sometimes not very hot. Overall a great place to stay and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Clean comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: PVmomontherun
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I had very high expectations of Regina especially after reading some of the reviews on Tripadvisor...While it is true that the hotel is perfectly located (just off the Ramblas )and the rooms were clean and nicely decorated, I was very disappointed when I first entered the hotel.... When we first arrived at the hotel, it felt like we had just walked into a cheap hotel. The first thing we saw when we entered the lobby doors was the elevator with a gray wooden ramp in front of it, the dark reception desk to the left with one sofa and a large dining table to the right which looked so out of place... Where was the beautifully decorated lobby I had seen on the photos online...Well...you do not actually see that portion of the lobby until you go around the corner towards the bar area.... Although the lobby did not bother us that much after the first day, I wanted to mention this as I wanted to set the expectations right for future guests who are expecting to walk into a stylishly decorated hotel... The Quadruple room that we had was perfect for a family with 2 adults and 2 teenagers. There were 2 twin beds in the main area and 2 single beds in an alcove close to the window....The room was large for European standards, was tastefully decorated and was clean. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel as I felt 16 euros per person or 64 euros for 4/day was too expensive to pay for breakfast. But there is a Starbucks right next door and a grocery store across the road.... which was perfect. On the whole, Regina was a perfect base to explore the wonderful sights of Barcelona. We wish we could have stayed one more day, but it was not possible....

Reviews.Title: “Great location Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RadlettJack
Reviews.Content: We had 3 nights at the Regina and couldn't fault it. The rooms were excellent and the location is ideal - just off the Placa Catalunya 5 minutes from the airport bus. Staff were friendly and very helpful. We were directed to a tapas restaurant on our first night and had an excellent meal at a very reasonalbe price, not you usual hotel recommended rip-off. Nice bar downstairs. Only niggle is that breakfast is good but expensive at 16 euros per person I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a relaxed and easy stay in Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and very accommodating to families with young children”
Reviews.Author: JacqC
Reviews.Content: As regular visitors to Barca, we have never quite found a hotel that has met our needs as well as the Regina. Family rooms are difficult to find or are ridiculously expensive. This hotel was perfect for us, a great central location with a decent sized room. What really made our stay so pleasant was the helpful staff - everyone's English was excellent and a couple of members of staff really made us feel welcome, particularly an older gentlemen who attended the front desk and showed us to our rooms (he had a twinkle in his eye) and the lady with short dark curly hair who attended to us at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “"WOW" what a great stay in barcelona”
Reviews.Author: niazof
Reviews.Content: I have stayed for four nights at this fabulous hotel . The hotel is located just 1 minutes walk from the Plaza Catalunya square and the metro station. The easiest way to get to the hotel from the airport is using the Aerobus shattle, it's a direct bus from the airport to the city center, the last station is the Plaza Catalunya square, it's cost only 8 euro for a retorn ticket that valid up to 9 days. Tha hotel staff wad so delightful and they were always willing to help answer my questions or provide recommendations. The room was very clean and comfort with a free WIFI, a air-condition and even a bathrobe and slippers, it's was so nice to came back to the room after a long day out.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, just off Plaza Catalunya and cinvenient for a tourist”
Reviews.Author: K_Rajiv
Reviews.Content: Read about the Hotel Regina on TripAdvisor (everyone had given rave reviews) and decided to stay there between 20th and 22nd May,2010. Beautiful place and very elegantly furnished with large bed and bathrooms. Immaculately kept and quita a value for money. Just outside the hotel the Hop On-Hop off tourist buses start at Plaza Catalunya. The AeroBus also operates from here and makes the hotel a very convenient place to stay for people like us, on a very short visit to Barcelona. High-speed internet is very good.

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: Woodturner
Reviews.Content: This hotel has obviously seen better days, but the location is great. The rooms are neat and clean but worn. The shower leaked. The metro and rail lines run near/under thehotel so you hear and feel the vibration starting at 0500. However, the windows facing the street have been improved to minimize the traffic noise. The service staff was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Airbound13
Reviews.Content: You cannot beat the location of this hotel. Just off Las Ramblas - less than a minute walk but not right on Las Ramblas so it is much quieter. Close to the major metro stations and a short walk to Passeig de Gracia. The rooms were decent sized, nice comfortable beds, hardwood floors and big bathrooms. Beware, the shower is a little bizarre and sometimes it felt like a fight to get it to not spray all over over the bathroom. The staff was nice but not very helpful - incorrect directions to the train station, poor restaurant recommendations and varying distances to major locations depending on who you asked. There is a business center with a few computers and free Internet access. Tip - there are not clocks in the room so bring your own alarm/clock I would stay here again and would recommend to anyone visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: shill88
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Regina both pre and post cruise. I really enjoyed our stay here. Being that we never traveled in Europe before, I was a bit nervous about picking the right place to stay. I chose to stay here based on other reviews and I am so glad I did. The hotel is very nice, clean, and the staff was friendly and spoke good English. They went the extra mile to accomodate us, and we loved the breakfast the hotel offered. I wish they could send me the donuts and wonderful tappas. The locations was perfect, and since its slightly off the La Ramblas, we didnt find it noisy at all. I would definately stay there again and recommend it to anyone traveling to Barcelona. We particular enjoyed taking the Hop on Hop off bus tour and the hotel is located right near the stop. Can't wait to visit Barcelona and the Hotel Regina again!

Reviews.Title: “VERY PLEASANT AND WELCOMING”
Reviews.Author: lisasmexico
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May we had an extended holiday due to volcanic ash so ended up booking Hotel Regina. It is a lovely hotel and the rooms had everything in you could possibly need down to toiletories, slippers, bathrobes ladies and men's wash kits it has all the special touches you stay in a hotel for. Staff and reception staff are very friendly and will do anything to help you out we had a great experience of this due to the circumstances of our flights being cancelled. It is in a great safe location minutes walk from everything where its happening. We would definatly stay here again thanks Regina :0)

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient centrally situated hotel”
Reviews.Author: 123boxall
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews regarding small rooms I emailed the hotel and requested a large room and they didnt disappoint. The room was very large and my friends had the mirror room on the other side. This hotel is at the top of the Ramblas and so we only had to go out of the hotel and just walk straight. Unfortunately, it was bank holiday and all the shops were closed - not good when you have two shopaholics. We didnt have time to do too much as we were going on a cruise but cant wait to return to Barcelona and would definitely go back to the Regina Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Noisy!”
Reviews.Author: tocr93
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel to be of a very high standard in clenlyness and service but if your looking for a good nights sleep or a lay-in in the morning forget about it! Walls are paper thin and what ever is happening in the room next door or if someones wearing high heels coming down the stairs your sure to hear it! One night I was kept awake from a person snoring in the next room and that morning the cleaners were banging doors in the storage rooms which was a regular occurance every morning! Other than that it was a plesent stay and Free Wi-Fi was a plus to keep tabs on emails and news at home etc. I found the bar tender very polite and effecient and the food was nice also!

Reviews.Title: “Two fabulous stays--surpassed our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: twobluecats
Reviews.Content: Thanks so much to the staff of the Hotel Regina for ensuring that our pre and post cruise stays were enjoyable. Everyone we encountered at the hotel was pleasant and helpful. The airline lost our luggage when we arrived in Barcelona, and the staff offered to make the phone calls for us to check the status of our luggage. The bar and lobby are peaceful retreats from the busy city, and we really enjoyed an evening coffee before bed each evening. The location was wonderful for exploring all that Barcelona has to offer, and we will definitely return to Hotel Regina on our next visit to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in Playa Catalunya”
Reviews.Author: Marnie33
Reviews.Content: We are in the midst of a three night stay at this comfortable, classy, family-friendly hotel. Staff is attentive without being at all intrusive. The bar/lounge area is the perfect spot for reading/checking e-mail while enjoying a glass of wine or cool drink after a long day of sightseeing. Yesterday I had to file a story on a tight deadline and I couldn't have asked for a more perfect environment. The family room is spacious and well-appointed. What I love most about Hotel Regina is that it retains a funky charm--nothing sterile or homogenized. Of course, the real draw is the perfect location--we can walk down La Rambla to the port, through the Gothic Quarter and back, take the Hop-on, Hop-off bus (stops virtually in front of the hotel) or catch the Metro within a one-minute walk. Highly recommended when you come to this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and a fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: 100310f
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my partner and another couple. We took a long time to select our hotel via the internet and eventually plumped for this hotel because of the location. It was at the higher end of our price range but we were very pleased with the location and the service we recieved. We stayed for three nights at the beginning of May. On our arrival the gentleman at the reception desk gave us a friendly welcome and recommended some attractions and restaurants at our request. Our rooms were spacious and clean with balconies to the front of the hotel. The bed was very comfortable and the room was extremely dark at night with only a small hum of the metro beneath so we had no problem with sleep. I actually had to leave the bathroom light on because I'm not used to pitch black at home. The location of the hotel is directly off the main square Placa de Catalunya where you can easily get a taxi back to the airport and jump on the Bus turistic tour. The bus tour can be booked through the hotel for a discount price. You pay 4 euros each at reception and then get 6 euros off the price in the kiosk in the square. So a you get a saving of 2 euros each over the two days. We didn't use the hotel breakfast facillities as we initially thought the price was high, but after venturing out into the town we would probably use the hotel if we went to Barcelona again. The food was very expensive. Although in the end we did enjoy a breakfast at the Happy grill near the hotel that was a reasonable price. Overall we would definately recommend the hotel to others and would stay here again if we went back to Barcelona. (rooms 204 & 205)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!! - but watch out for Dereck”
Reviews.Author: jaymo2710
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at Htoel Regina...the rooms were lovely and clean and most of the staff were really helpful, apart from one man DERECK...me and my mate stayed in a room together...and he laughed at us presuming we were homosexual....me and my friend felt very uncomfortable.... we asked DERECK where a good place to go on a night out was - we would have been better asking the plantpot.....he directed us to a ghost town...Loved Hotel Regina and Barcelona is one of the most fantastic places in the worl...but watch out for DERECK!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ct-cruisers
Reviews.Content: We had an overnight in Barcelona before the start of our NCL cruise. We chose the Hotel Regina for its location a block from Placa Catalunya and the start of Las Ramblas. When we checked in, they gave us a superior room, which had plenty of space for the two of us with double beds and a then a couch in an alcove area. The room and large bathroom were clean and orderly. The breakfast buffet had a wide variety of options although the restaurant is not clearly marked, You had to walk through a doorway by the bar and then go pass the toilets to find it. The one negative comment would be that the space between the beds and the wall unit did not allow for luggage to be rolled through. I had to lift them over the beds to get to the other side. It was only a few blocks to the Gothic area and the two wonderful churches there, the Cathedral and Santa Maria del Mar. The Hard Rock is right on Placa Catalunya as well. We walked from the Hotel to the end of Las Ramblas to catch the cruise terminal shuttle right across from the Columbus monument. (olny took 30 minutes and that was with stopping at a few shops along the way) We would not hesitate going to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Site, Space and Staff, the stuff of luxury. Now about that refit...”
Reviews.Author: lakanga
Reviews.Content: Mixing business with pleasure, the kids & I finally joined DH on one of his many jaunts to conferences in Barcelona and chose the Regina because it had a family room for 4 people and airconditioning. What we were not expecting was the fabulous location, right near Plaça de Cataluyna - the place where La Rambla meets the Modernisme trail of the Eixemple and conveniently located for art, history, architecture and food. Even for the kids (who are used to being dragged about on foot, but at 8 and 5 have their limits) it was a reasonable walk to all the sights mum was insisting on and close to several helado opportunities for icecream o'clock. Meanwhile, you are not obliged to wade through the human traffic on La Rambla every time you needed to go into the Barri Gotic or beyond. The beautiful modern lobby behind the smoked glass doors was an absolute joy to come home to. So was the enormous room (104) with two large single beds pushed together and a sofa bed and an extra bed, with a huge marble and granite bathroom with full bath and large shower, fluffy bathrobes and slippers. The free unlimited WiFi was brilliant. Double-glazed windows giving onto the main street meant that while we heard a little noise from fellow guests going up the stairs, not a sound could be heard from the street side at all. Most unexpected of all in this modern, chocolate-toned haven was the lovely staff, from check-in to check-out, nothing but pleasant smiles, a rub on the head for the kids and no question is too stupid in their mother's abysmal Spanish. Even when the airconditioning did not work the first night, it was up and running smoothly the second after a quick word at reception before we left in the morning. Breakfast, while expensive at €16 for adults and €8 for kids was a gorgeous buffet with everything you could want from scrambled eggs and bacon to cheese and deli meats to cereal and yoghurt and best of all, beautiful fresh fruit (from the nearby Mercat de la Boqueria?). The breakfast ladies were lovely. The mini bar was well-stocked and comparatively low-priced and the bathroom courtesy packs well thought out (body milk, shampoo, conditioner, shower gel plus a ladies' or gentlemen's pack with tissues and a razor, lip balm and a very cute touch, peppermint foot massage cream). Could do with a shower cap. The only downside for our stay, and one that makes the Regina overpriced is the beautiful refit needs to extend to the bathroom, where some of the floor tiles are loose and grout has come away in the shower allowing mould to set in. There were also mildew spots on the aircon vent. If this were fixed, in an otherwise spotlessly clean hotel, it would be well worth the price tag.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, couldn't have tried harder to make our stay a good one”
Reviews.Author: Cheshiretravellerz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a really good location at the top of Las Ramblas and very convenient for the excellent airport buses to the main airport (but equally convenient for Reus or Girona as so close to Placa Catalunya). Really convenient for the Tour bus, walking to anywhere, the train and or local buses. Our room was spacious with bath and shower, robes and slippers, chocolate left on the overturned sheet on the bed. Check in was easy and pleasant even though we arrived at getting on for midnight, bar staff pleasant (although its expensive in the bar), efficient cleaning, helpful reception staff, easy check out. The only fault you could make from my perspective is that Barcelona is an incredibly noisy city all through the night and this hotel is equally a victim of that - but I can't see how you can get away from that unless you stay way out of town. I would definitely stay here again. I am a regular traveller to Barcelona and this is the best of the hotels I have stayed in for the price. Oh and as an added extra you can use the internet easily and freely.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, Convenient, Clean, Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: NGinNY
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Regina last week, having selected the hotel after a great deal of research. Besides wanting a nice facility with decent-sized rooms, I was very concerned about being able to avoid smoke. I sought a guarantee about all public space being smoke-free, as well as my room. To my delight, this was the case. No smoking allowed in the lobby, the restaurant, the Internet area, which is exactly what I wanted. And the room had no lingering odor, and was quite clean and comfortable. The beds could have been more comfortable, however. Very standard mattresses. Also, I would have liked a clock in the room - bring your own. The location is excellent, and close to a major Metro stop. It's always just a very short walk from the bustling Ramlas and Boqueria Market, a real bonus. Another positive is the assistance I received from a young man named Derek, who helped me out with a tricky dilemma, by making calls in Spanish for me, and being very accommodating. The area towards the back of the lobby was just right for use of the Internet, and because there are three computers, I always found one available, a real necessity when traveling. I can highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “2 star rooms hiding behind a 4 star facade”
Reviews.Author: ShropshireRon
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights late March 2010. The hotel was undertaking renovations of the lounge and bar areas throughout our stay, which wasn’t ideal. There were heavy odours of industrial sealants etc plus dust and noise in the ground floor common areas. Beds were good, location great and staff generally friendly and helpful BUT Room 514: Like a rather tired prison cell, small, dark with a frankly unacceptable bathroom. No natural light save for an alcove with a window with views of a five storey concrete screen. What light does enter the room from this window falls on the wardrobe in the alcove and not the room. The bathroom was once a wet room (perhaps from the early 80’s) and the addition of a half length, half width bath does nothing to change that, other than make it less useable. Dirty tired tiles and mouldy grouting. The shower over the half bath with ineffective screen makes showering a chore. Shower your left side and then exit to turn around to re-enter and shower your right side. Exit after showering to a flooded room. You couldn’t make it up!! The lighting in here was also very poor. Nowhere for you ladies to apply your make up. Now to the low point. Soundproofing. Well there is none. I am now intimate with the bodily functions of the fella in the next room. Let me clarify. When I say next room, the rooms are not adjoining, oh no. The rooms are adjacent and across a hallway. Aircon: Didn’t work. Reported it, a member of staff came and adjusted the settings and said give it ten minutes. Still didn’t work. Room was stuffy and far too hot to be comfortable. Like being in a prison laundry. Requested a new room, apparently none available until the next day. Room 409: Much better, bigger, brighter, fresher and more modern, with a view and natural light. But, same issues with the shower and the soundproofing. Oh guess what? The aircon didn’t work. This room had a shared balcony with two other rooms. Whilst the balcony was divided and on the fourth floor, it would be possible to pass from one part to another. Here in lies the worry. The outward French doors didn’t lock, once latched any application of pressure and the doors would open. This being the case the occupants of the two adjoining rooms could, if so minded gain access to your room. It gets worse. The door to the room doesn’t lock from the inside. Usual card access and exit applies. So the absence of an internal lock wasn’t a surprise. Imagine my shock then, on the last morning, to turn around after leaving the bathroom to see the room door swing open on its own, clearly as a result of a draft in the hallway. So in summary neither the room’s door or french windows locked.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!.. clean, stylish and in a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: champs_7
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in the Hotel Regina for St Patrick's Day for 2 nights, and had a very enjoyable stay. The Hotel is stylish and modern yet not in anyway "stuffy". I mentioned at the time of booking that we were travelling for a special occasion and we were upgraded to a Exec Room. I recommend you upgrade as you get a slightly bigger room. Hotel/rooms very clean, fresh towels/toiletries daily. There was some building work going on in the bar area, but stopped by the time we had got back from exploring... Breakfast was lovely, and what we loved about it was that it was all covered over, all the pastries etc were covered which makes a change in Hotels! Perfect location.. right in the hussle and bussle.. if you want a quiet located Hotel, then this is not for you. A little noise from traffic at night.. but what do you expect being in the heart of Barcelona. Will defo be travelling back with our 6 year old!... :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: scanetta
Reviews.Content: Cannot beat the location for this nicely furnished comfortable hotel just of the Plaza Catalunya. Close to the Ramblas without the noise and very near shopping, airport bus and tour buses. Flat screen tv, ample size rooms with comfortable beds and quiet. Only one problem. When I woke in the middle of the night to use the bathroom saw a bug in the bathroom. My only complaint. Imagine it may have come from the drain in the bathroom but still was dissappointing. In fairness to the hotel, I did not mention to the management because I didnt think there was anything they could do about this situation but did mention to housekeeping. All in all the hotel was clean

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gweez481
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were taking a cruise out of Barcelona in Nov. 2008. We stayed at Hotel Regina before and after the cruise. It was a super clean hotel, friendly staff, and a great location. We liked it so much we are coming back again this November for another few days.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location... we could not have picked a better place.”
Reviews.Author: twilson22
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The location was easy to access all things a "tourist" would like to do while in Barcelona. Internet was complimentary, rooms were spacious and extremely clean, beds were comfy. The manager also sent us a bottle of champagne. It was an unexpected delight as we were getting homesick after 10 days away from the United States. Fabulous hotel in a fabulous city!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Maudvilla
Reviews.Content: Location is fabulous! Get the aerobus from the airport and the hotel is literally a few minutes walk from Place Catalunya (head for the street with Habitat on the corner). Our room was small but very clean and well decorated. Bathrobes and slippers were provided and the toiletries were very good. We booked direct with the hotel and I advised them that it was my husband's 40th birthday - on our first night, a complimentary bottle of Cava was delivered to our room! This was a total surprise and such a lovely gesture - thank you Hotel Regina! The reception staff were also very helpful when we made enquiries about the Metro system. I wouldnt even consider looking for another hotel in Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: VancouverBubber
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Regina for three nights in November. We were on our way to Barcelona by car when we were robbed. When we arrived at the hotel we told the staff at the front desk what happened and they were immediately helpful. They found the phone number and directions to the Canadian consulate and also walked us to the police station so that we could report the incident. They also upgraded us to a suite at no extra charge. Our room was very clean and big. The location was excellent right next to Placa Catalunia. Plenty of restaurants and shopping nearby. The hotel also has a great bar and a bartender that makes a mean martini.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Excellent location - will definitley be returning”
Reviews.Author: TravellerSas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Regina for 2 nights just last weekend. Location was excellent and close to everything. Our room was spacious, very clean and quite (considering we were right off the main shopping area). The staff were helpful and friendly. I will definitley be returning to Barcelona and with that will be returning to the Hotel Regina.

Reviews.Title: “Excellente”
Reviews.Author: envy4u
Reviews.Content: Our one night stay at the Hotel Regina was excellent in every way. Jose Sanchez, the general manager, was extremely helpful to me prior to our stay via email. He went above and beyond in making sure we got what we requested. The rooms were very clean, modern and large for European standards and its location perfect for getting around. I would not hesitate in staying here again and would recommend this hotel to our family or friends.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more”
Reviews.Author: AJsanfrancisco
Reviews.Content: I had the most delightful stay at this hotel. The location was perfect for people my age, although it is very touristy on the La Ramblas. The rooms were very clean and modern. The service was not bad. We stayed in a triple although they just provided us with a rollaway bed. It was more on the expensive side but well worth it compared to all the other crappy european hotels i've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay but not exceptional.”
Reviews.Author: DNLs_mum
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 4 adults and 2 kids. We stayed at the Hotel Regina for one day pre-cruise and 2 days post cruise. Location : Excellent. Convenient for shopping, food and gothic area. Rooms : Huge by European standard. Nice minimalist style which is rare in Europe but common in Asia. We had originally had 3 kids with us, 2 pre-teens and 1 toddler. When I made the reservations, the hotel had kindly indicated that our 3 year-old toddler could stay free. So we booked a quad for my husband and I and our 3 kids and a standard double for my parents. Subsequently, we had some change of plans and one of my older boys couldn't join us on this holiday. I decided not to change our reservation. When we arrived pre-cruise, we found the quad room really big and comfortable. We had 2 twin beds in the main bedroom area and 2 single beds in the separate corner for the kids. My little girl saw the huge bed in the main bedroom and decided that she wanted to sleep with me and my husband, not her brother. We decided to change our rreservations for the 2 nights post cruise to a triple instead. We saved EUR25 per night by doing that. The triple room we got subsequently was just as good. The difference is the smaller annex area which had only one single bed. My little girl was very happy and comfortable sleeping with my husband and I. The double room that my parents had was also comfortable and of very decent size. On our post cruise stay, the hotel gave them a triple room instead next to ours as they were not fully booked. My parents did however complain that the aircon in their triple room did not seem to work and they had to open the windows otherwise their room gets really stuffy. Amenities : My grip is that the hotel does not provide facial tissue paper. They only provided 2 sheets of serviettes per amenity kit. I think their were 4 amenity kits in our large room. It is a small thing and we had our own anyway, but it was inconvenient. This is the first time that I have stayed in a 4* hotel that does not provide tissue paper. Amenities provided is also not consistent. My parents room has bedroom slippers for both stay, but our room had none for both stays. Another inconvenience is that they did not have a kettle in the room and we had to ask for hot water each time my little girl wants her milk. The plus however is the free wifi internet connection. It is extremely convenient to use with our laptop and best of all free of charge! Service : We experienced nothing exceptional. In fact, when we arrived in the evening of our post-cruise stay, there was no bell boy to help with our bags. One of the counter staff operated the service lift and my husband moved all our bags himself with a little assistance from the counter staff. Also, the taxis that the hotel got for us were not honest. We needed 2 taxis to the port. The meter price for each taxi was around EUR16-17. One of the taxi wanted to charge meter price, but the second insisted to be paid EUR27 with no explanation why there is an additional EUR10. He got the second taxi to charge the same EUR27. We could not speak spanish and just paid the amount. When we informed the hotel when we returned from the cruise 12 days later, the counter staff told us that we must inform them the very same day of the incident and it is too late now. Frankly, we were already at the port. Did they expect us to call them from there? Their attitude is nonchalent and not helpful at all. I now wonder if the hotel staff got a cut from the taxi driver. Even if they have surcharge on our bags, EUR20 seem excessive as we had only 1 large bag, 4 medium bags and 2 small bags and a stroller. My advice is to flag your own taxi or perhaps book a transfer. I was offered transfer by Barcelona Day Tours at EUR50 for all of us but did not book that as I had read on this forum that taxi to the port was less than EUR20. My mistake. Overall Conclusion : Decent stay but not exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: margarbi
Reviews.Content: We spent a few days in Barcelona prior to a cruise. This hotel was the most perfect location. It is right next to Catalunya Square and all buses, trains, tour buses, one block from the top of Las Ramblas and minutes from the Gothic quarter. Lots of shopping in any direction, a grocery store across the street, information center in the square, lots of coffee shops, besides the high priced Starbucks attached to the hotel building. A local bus and an airport bus go right to the square and the hotel is one minute walk from there. There is free internet usage at the hotel, They hold your bags in a locked room for you if you arrive too early and the best of all was our room located at the front of the hotel. Beautiful, comfortable and a great price. Over all I'd rate this as a 10. Meals in the area were very high priced. That was the only down side.

Reviews.Title: “This is a damn good hotel”
Reviews.Author: sloughboy
Reviews.Content: excellent location, central. top of las ramblas, close to all public transport including train, underground and buses. definitely 4 stars and also rooms of high quality. Good service too. In summary, value for money, quality, great location - what more do you need in a hotel for a city break

Reviews.Title: “Very poor hotel - weakens my confidence in tripadvisor.com”
Reviews.Author: zerochaos
Reviews.Content: First, i really question the validity of tripadvisor now that i've used it a few times. I'll use Frommer's or professional hotel rating sites from here forward. We stayed at Regina one night (of 3 planned). It is a 2 star hotel. I would not give it a 3 star rating. (this is a 4 star by tripadvisor and 11 of 580 rated). It was not clean, small rooms, many of which were smoked in, poor furnishings, noisy, not attractive, very basic. Service was decent. We were terribly disappointed so I told them I wanted to cancel and move to another hotel. We chose Hotel Neri (tripadvisor 4 star and 50 of 580 rated) which was an outstanding hotel as a very strong 4star and almost 5star! We chose it based on Frommer's and other major websites after tripadvisor lost credibility.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location. Modern, spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: MaroKat
Reviews.Content: This hotel ticks all the boxes. Great location (around the corner from Las Ramblas). Modern rooms. Spacious. Clean. Added bonus of rooms having balconies. Definately value for money

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience good clean hotel very central.”
Reviews.Author: DorsetHeather
Reviews.Content: Hi My daughter and I will be returning to stay with you on the 9th December 2009. We have previously stayed at the Regina, and my daughter stayed there with a group of friends. Each time your hotel has made it special fo us, nice clean rooms, lovely breakfast helpful staff and nice safe area. I see on another review it is possible to reach the hotel by bus and it stops outside the deapartment store from the airport for 5 euros. Please could you give me information on this service, as we usually catch the bus to bus staion and then get a taxi to the Regina quite costly. Thankyou for your help. Looking forward to our stay. Heather

Reviews.Title: “Fabuloso”
Reviews.Author: Woofarama
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. Couldn't have asked for a better location, round the corner from Placa de Catalunya and las Ramblas. It's quite pricey but if you're only there for a couple of days you're better staying right in the heart of things so it's definately worth it. The room was a good size, and the bed was the best I have slept in for a long time. My husband was impressed with the fact that we had 4 pillows and they were perfect! I had arranged beforehand for champagne to be delivered to the room as it was my husband's birthday (many thanks to Vanesa for all the help on this) when we returned from a bit of sightseeing and shopping it was there waiting for us with strawberries and little cubes of chocolate brownies - very yummy. We had a problem with the tv in our room which we only knew about at about 10pm and a nice young man came to the room straight away but couldn't fix it, he then came back to tell us that it would be fixed first thing the next morning (sunday!) and it was. I couldnt fault the staff at all, very polite and helpful. Barcelona's a great place and has a lot of shops and museums. El Corte Ingles is huge but not as good as it used to be. The shops in the Rambla de Santa Monica are much better and it's not quite as hectic. The Picasso museum is really good and well worth a visit. There's a chinese/dim sum restaurant accross from the hotel that's great value for money - 4 courses and a drink fro 10euros!!! It's not the best chinese in the world but it is fresh and hot. if you decide to go on the boat tour around the harbour, make sure it's a warm day and not too windy for obvious reasons!!! Here's my top tip - make sure your travel itinerary has on it what terminal your flight leaves from as ours didn't - we got the airport bus and it dropped us off at Terminal 1 but we should have been at Terminal 2, we then had to get a shuttle bus then walk for ages to get to the correct check in area then walk right to the end of the terminal to our gate - it's a very long walk!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wanted it to be nicer”
Reviews.Author: travplaces
Reviews.Content: I am an avid user of trip advisor so I felt it was time that I began to help other travelers in their hotel decision making. We travel a lot and like very nice hotels. This is hard hotel to review because there were a lot of things we liked about it and then a lot we did not. The location is EXCELLENT. Off on a side street around the corner from Las Ramblas and the Plaza Cantalunya...it can't be beat. We walked everywhere but were happy to come back at night to a more peaceful environment. I would not recommend staying on Las Ramblas at any of those hotels. The staff is very courteous and helpful Free wireless- a huge plus when traveling with young adults. The hotel itself is just moderate. The rooms are small and the bathrooms are even smaller. The decor is very minimalist. We had just come from the Westin Palace in Madrid...a true 4-5 star hotel. This hotel just isn't. There was a really weird odor coming into our room every night...almost sulphur like. There was a vent in the bathroom that vented into an interior shaft and when I closed the vent, the smell subsided somewhat. The first room we were put in had black mold on the ceiling around the A/C vent...I found it hard to get that out of my mind even though the staff gladly moved us into another room. Overall our stay at the Regina was fine...but that's it..just fine. I think there are better hotels in Barcelona in this price category.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - Spiffy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrerBear63
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel. The room was a bit on the small side, but the fixtures were new and stylish. The minibar had decent prices for that, and the wireless internet was free. The location, 50 meters from the Plaza Catalunya was unbeatable. From there you can access a major Metro station and the cheap (5 euro) bus to the airport from the front of El Corte Ingles department store. The Rambla is right outside your door, major Gaudi edifices are a short walk away. My buddy found the location noisy and found it hard to sleep, but I didn't notice. We got the room for about $150 a night. I say it was a major deal.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - totally!”
Reviews.Author: Aviva60
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after much research on TripAdvisor and other sites - and were generously rewarded for doing so. The hotel is lovely in its public areas and its rooms, comfortable and roomy; the staff could not have been nicer or more eager to help. Best of all, it is mere steps away from Placa Catalunya, the heart of the city! We were so very pleased with our choice and would stay here again in a flash.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: kaether0
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located at the end of Las Ramblas, just around the corner. I really like the location because it would take us literally 1 minute to be in the middle of all the action, and yet at the end of the night I felt we were far away enough to not hear all the noise in the streets (people are still outside at 4 in the morning!) The look of the hotel is modern, and the rooms are clean and spacious. They have free wireless internet, which was a big plus (half the hotels we stayed at while in Europe charged for this service). I really liked the hotel's lobby, me and a friend had a few drinks there at the start of the evening. All the staff is very courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: NYCGirl21234
Reviews.Content: The location can't be beat! The rooms are clean, nice balconies, great water pressure. But, I highly praise the hotel staff. I had an incident where I asked the front desk clerk to call me a taxi to a popular nightclub. When I arrived at my destination, the taxi driver charged me double what the fare should've been - I realized this when my return taxi was half my original fare. When I informed the desk clerk of the taxi overcharge, she aplologized and said that was unnacceptable as the hotel's reputation was at stake since they excluisively use this particular taxi company, and immediately called the taxi company and demanded they refund me the overcharge. Which they did. There was an envelope for me at the front desk the next morning containing the difference in fare. It's refreshing to see a hotel that looks out for its guests. Highly recommend hotel Regina. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant time”
Reviews.Author: swatson358
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the Hotel Regina & had a fabulous time. The staff are extremely helpful, the room was spacious with little extras & the location so central for getting around the city. This was our first visit to the city & it certainly ticked all the boxes & we would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CorndogCorndog
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Regina in Barcelona was outstanding. My wife and I stayed here after our cruise, and spent 2 days and nights exploring the city. The location could not have been better. We walked everywhere! The room was clean and well decorated. The hotel staff was very helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel! Cincinnati, Ohio U.S.A.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but too pricy”
Reviews.Author: MarieSylvia
Reviews.Content: Hotel Regina has great location. It is a walking distance to Las Ramblas, Plaza Catalunya, Barri Gothic, etc. The rooms are huge and clean but the bathrooms are small. The bathroom tiles are kinda old as well as the hallway tiles. There are chipping. I love the internet room . Internet is free. The lobby is just OK. The staff in the front desk are NOT so friendly. There is only one small elevator. It could accomodate only 4 people. But what turned me off with this hotel is the rate/night. Paying $200/night without breakfast is too much. There are much better hotels around the area with this rate.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel in great location for walking the Ramblas and exploring Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: ShanVancouver_Canada
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in Sept. 09 for 4 nights - the service was great, room spacious and comfortable but most importantly, the location was central and walking distance to everything.

Reviews.Title: “central location”
Reviews.Author: seasider63
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here on a sight seeing trip to Barcelona. We found the Hotel to be centrally located, easy access to Catalunya Square, from where you can visit most of the tourist sites. Our room, was large, good bathroom, only downside was that it faced buildings at the back of the Hotel. No view. Room was clean and adequately furnished for a few days stay. Bedside rug did need a good steam clean!! Trendy looking, comfortable bar, though on a Monday night this was very, very, quiet. After leaving for the airport, we discovered we'd left a mobile phone in the bedroom. On contacting Reception from the airport, we luckily heard it had been found and would be posted back to us. It arrived safe and sound 2 weeks later. Many, many thanks to those concerned at Reception. Would recommend this Hotel, but ask for a room with a view and a little iron balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel let down by breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Billdf
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent five nights at the Regina. It is a lovely hotel situated in a nice street just off Placa de Catalunya and near Las Ramblas. Perfect location. Our room, situated on the fifth floor facing the street, was quiet, very clean with a good range of toiletries and linen was regularily replaced. Provision of robes and slipppers in the room and free access to the internet near reception was a bonus. Only small gripe about the room was the space at foot of bed which was too narrow to allow our larger case to be pulled through. However general layout and space in room and bathroom was excellent. Reception staff were very efficient, helpful and friendly. A couple who were with us had problems with a leaking shower but the response to their complaint was immediate. Attempted repair was ineffective but they were offered a change of room - excellent response and service. Overall this is a great hotel but let down by the breakfast.
