We found the hot dishes and the "hot" water for tea to be lukewarm and one morning we waited 25 minutes for the bacon to be replenished despite being advised, a few times "it will only be a minute". However the range of food on offer was fairly good. We used the hop on hop off bus for two days and found it very useful. The Bus Touristic is the most popular and there were long queues at a few stops. The other company, red buses, did not appear to have queues but check which sites they visit. The discount booklet provided helped save a few euros on entrance fees. You can also save couple of euros by purchasing your bus pack from reception. Expect to queue at some of the more popular attractions e.g. to get on the lift in the Sagrada Familia we would have had to queue for about one and a half hours.

Reviews.Title: “The only hotel I stay at in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: MartinStockholm
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel 4 times over the past 6 years and I've been very pleased every time. The location is perfect, just around the corner of El Triangle, top of Las Ramblas. I've stayed in their newly renovated rooms and they were very stylish and smart. Great beds. Can not complain about the breakfast and the staff was always friendly. I've paid around 100 Euro per night for a double room, using various discounts etc, and for that price I think it's one of the best deals you can get in Barcelona. I recommend this to friends going, and they've all liked it too. If you want to go for a small, cozy hotel in old style, this is not for you. But if you want a central hotel with great confort, but still quiet, you should try this. /Martin, Stockholm, Sweden

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: srcit76
Reviews.Content: srcit76 Wilmington, DE Based on recommendations found here we stayed two nights prior to a cruise. No regrets.The location, on a quiet street with it's proximity to the Placa de Catalunya, La Ramblas and restaurants was perfect. Our room, facing the street on the fifth floor was very clean and the beds comfortable. Excellent lighting to read in bed but no so at the desk. The only negative was a leaky shower door that puddled water on the floor. A very friendly and helpful staff. We would stay here again. (Note: The floor plan posted on the door did show some rooms to be quite small. Those facing the street are much larger).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - perfect location”
Reviews.Author: dacitek
Reviews.Content: From this hotel you can get wherever you want. Actually it is in the middle of everything. Metro and busses just next, nor far from the market, the sea and the Gaudi buildings. The room was nice and clean and big. We had an excellent view. We also received a bottle of cava and chocolate from the hotel which was very nice. Sometimes it was a bit noisy in the night, you could hear the train... but that's normal for a hotel with such an excellent location. The bed was very comfortable too. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A smart hotel at the heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: calvin-the-dog
Reviews.Content: We spent a long week-end with friends in Barcelona and we had chosen the "Regina" for its "location vs price" value. We were not disappointed: the hotel is very close to the Plaça de Catalunya, the Ramblas, metro station, etc. The building is, from the outside, a very nice "1900" architecture but the "inside" underwent, a few years, ago, a major refurbishment. The "trendy" rooms are up the best standards regarding equipment, bed comfort and bathroom... We could nevertheless regret the relatively small size of the rooms and bathrooms. The staff is well qualified, efficient and extremely responsive (desk and dining room as well). The major and sole weakness concerns the soundproofing. The windows soundproofing is good but the "internal" soundproofing (noise from the corridor, from pipes and from the metro) could be better... At the end of the day, it depends you are a "light sleeper" or not...

Reviews.Title: “Well designed hotel”
Reviews.Author: wrigleynj
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our children (age 8, 5) in a quadruple family room. We generally book adjoining rooms when we travel but this was hard to find in Barcelona. The layout was great. The kids each had a twin bed in a small alcove in the room. It gave enough separation that we could be in the main part of the room reading or watching tv. Rooms are also really spacious by European standards. Decor is simple and contemporary and very functional. Breakfast was great with more substanstial offerings like eggs, potatoes and bacon as well as the typical continental choices. Service was friendly and helpful. The hotel is well located. We were able to walk everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: phoebe226
Reviews.Content: We could not have asked for a better location!! It was close to many major attractions (we walked to most) and close to the metro. It is really close to everything, La Rambla, Passeig de Gracia, the marina, etc. There is a supermarket across the street from the hotel. The room was "large" by european standards, the bathroom was a little small... The staff were very helpful and even let us check in several hours early. The room was clean and modern. My only complaint is that there was some mold in the bathroom, which was probably due to the fact that there was no vent or fan in the bathroom. The lobby bar was elegant and quiet. (It was a little too quiet for my taste.) There is a side room with several computers and printers, no charge to use, which was a plus. The breakfast room was bright, clean and well-appointed. Breakfast is "buffet" style, and all you can eat basically. I think the cost was 15 euros per person, but it was worth it for us. There are many cafes and such in the area, but we couldn't find ONE that served actual "breakfast food"; all they serve is pastries and coffee/tea. Breakfast at Hotel Regina had eggs, bacon, english muffins, cereal, fruit, granola, etc etc. I would recommend this hotel to people in their 30's and up. This is a perfectly fine hotel to stay at; I just would've liked for it to be a little more "lively", and no mold in the bathroom... It is close to all the action, but located on a quiet street, which was also a plus.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST........WESTERN”
Reviews.Author: Rebeck09
Reviews.Content: I often travel for work and when I come here in Barcelona always choose the Regina Hotel. Comfortable rooms and ideal location to move into town. Range and quality breakfast and pleasant reception. I recommend it to all of you.

Reviews.Title: “Football Weekend”
Reviews.Author: mikeyp69
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel with modern rooms in a great location, quiet but close to main attractions. price can be cheaper if you book and pay upfront

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant experience - well above expectations”
Reviews.Author: eeeTraveller
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Regina, and enjoyed our stay. We arrived early and check in was a breeze. The rooms are very spacious and clean, and there is free wifi. Although we had a problem with the aircond one night, the reception staff was very helpful and changed our room right away. The hotel is superbly located with supermarkets, shops and transport all close by. We were impressed by the service attitude of all the hotel staff we met, and must specially commend the two young ladies at the reception - Andrea and Lucila who were most helpful and cheerful. Although we were out of the rooms most of the day, it was sheer delight to return to the hotel room at the end of a long day. One small negative is that the rooms can do with better sound insulation. Overall, we had a great time in Barcelona and highly recommend this hotel to other visitors. It will help to inform the hotel of your needs prior to yr arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: LS_Scotland
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Hotel Regina, which I really enjoyed. The room we had was very modern and clean with large twin beds. I was surprised at how quiet the room was, considering it was on quite a busy street. I thought it was a nice touch that there was bathrobes and slippers in the bathroom. The only downside in the bathroom was that the drain in the bath was blocked for the duration of our stay, but it wasn't really a problem for us. We were staying on an accommodation only basis, but we had breakfast in the hotel on two mornings. There was a good variety of food, which was all lovely. I would return if I ever visit Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spacious rooms & great staff; We loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 604Paninaro
Reviews.Content: Everything about the hotel we loved: the spacious rooms, wonderful location and the helpful staff. We stayed there for 4 nights. THE ROOM: Modern and spacious (positively huge since we just came from our tiny room in Paris). The room was well appointed with two double beds, big LCD TV (some English channels), huge bathroom with bidet, separate area for sink and tub w/shower, lots of desk space. We requested a quieter room and got room 219, it was fairly quiet. Our bathroom did have a view of the back of the El Triangle sign that faced Carrer de Pelai. THE LOCATION: A block from the Las Ramblas and Placa Catalunya. The train, subway and airport shuttle bus are all within a blocks walking distance. The shops of Eixample and Diaganol are a close stroll. Food and drink wise are abundantly close and of varying prices and quality. There are great places to eat at everywhere. We tried to avoid eating on Ramblas since we thought it was all touristy. There is a Co-op supermarket directly across the street from the hotel. From the hotel it was an easy walk to Gothic Quarter, Barceloneta Beach, Born District, Eixample shops. THE SERVICE: We had arrived at 9:30 in the morning and the staff were very helpful getting us the best possible room. We were surprised by a bottle of champagne in our room. The manager had sent It for our 10 year anniversary. We were always greeted warmly by staff. The location of the hotel made it close to everywhere. From experience, we've come to realize location is the key to a great vacationing experience. Hotel Regina certainly has that in spades. Literally steps from all the action, yet still a quiet night rest. We could easily drop off shopping or siesta in the afternoon yet still be in the thick of things once we were ready to go. The spacious room and great staff made this one of our best stays ever!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: faae
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel Regina for 2 nights. We were traveling with our two sons and found the room to be spacious enough for the four of us. The location is outstanding. Just around the corner from the city bus tours and the busy streets of Barcelona. The room offered a modern decor and was clean and the beds were comfortable. Bathrooms, slippers and nice towels and linens added a touch of luxury.There is free internet in the lobby and many cafes nearby. The area seemed safe and secure. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended - great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: LH2219
Reviews.Content: As first time visitors to Barcelona staying for 5 nights, we were very pleased with this hotel. It is located very close to the Place de Catalunya (useful for the airport bus and sightseeing tours) and is very central for sightseeing but is itself on a quiet street. The room was stylish and spacious, air conditioned but also with a balcony. We would stay here again - if only for the free wifi in every room!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: acemiller211
Reviews.Content: Rooms were small but had everything we needed. We traveled with another couple, and our room was twice the size of theirs. The computer lounge was nice. The proximity to Plaza de Catalunya and Las Ramblas is perfect. You are paying for the location. Close to metro, 15 minute ride to beach, you need to switch trains once. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay in Italy (2 weeks)”
Reviews.Author: dovesm
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. Wood floors, clean lines. The location was fabulous. Only 1 block from the hop on hop off bus, grocery store across the street, (you can buy big bottles of water so cheap), Ramblas one block away. Front desk friendly/wonderful/helpful. We slept like babies in this room. It was dark, the air conditioning was fantastic and you heard no street noise. We were traveling with a 5 year old (not recommended, especially in 90 degree August) and felt most comfortable in this hotel after traveling throughout Italy. Hotel Alimandi in Rome is also a great hotel. Great business center downstairs (3-4 computers). We were on the 5th floor. We didn't try the breakfast but there is a great little coffee place on the corner (but it doesn't open until 10 AM which I didn't understand - sort of like an Italian Starbucks). I HIGHLY recommend this hotel. (You can go to the fitness center of another hotel.)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Hemel1
Reviews.Content: Staff very helpful, cool place, close to sights, but quiet. Breakfast okay. Had a 4th floor room, overslept twice. Downstairs you can feel rather than hear the tube, but not really a problem. We kept our room until 6pm for an extra small charge. Nice bar. Generally a good place to stay, recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: ZwarteKater
Reviews.Content: Great hotel located in the heart of Barcelona. Perfect location at one end of the Ramblas (Metro Catalunya). The service was great, the room was made ready and available before check-in time, breakfast was very nice. Truly a four star hotel (quality levels may vary among four-star hotels unfortunately). Free internet and print service in the lobby (in the other hotel, Royam Ramblas, we had to pay!), nice bar also in the lobby. Cleanliness scored four out of five as the carpet in the hall /corridor had a few spots, but the room was large and cosy (we had a standard double) and TV had a nice selection of international / EU channels (but also CNN). We also went for the Romantic package and for 20 EUR we got breakfast for two and a bottle of Cava, it was really worth it. Breakfast was downstairs in the breakfast room so we had a full bufet not just a limited eat-in version. Cava was served the night before in the room. The swimming pool was closed for repair, but hey, we had the sea! Overall an excellent impression and I really regret that we were not able to spend all of our stay there (previous booking in another hotel). I highly recommend Regina.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay before our cruise!”
Reviews.Author: LoveToCruiseFamily
Reviews.Content: The room was simple but comfortable for the four of us (two teenagers 15 and 13). The beds were GREAT!!! The room temperature perfect. The room was clean. At night, it was quiet even though we were footsteps from loud Las Ramblas Street. It was an ideal location. Starbucks around the corner.........Las Ramblas around the other corner.........Hop on Hop off tour bus a block away. Close to restaurants, shopping and sight seeing. Quick cab ride to the ship - it was perfect for our needs. Would recommend without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “A Good deal”
Reviews.Author: clatimermd
Reviews.Content: For the price, excellent location. Red buses and the Rambla in the corner. A good room and excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: travelagentnancy
Reviews.Content: Can't wait to return!!!! We were fortunate to stay at the Hotel Regina one night pre & post of our cruise this spring. The staff was very helpful, our room was large and on the upper floors. We were celebrating our anniversary and the staff brought us a bottle of wonderful Cava! The best location, next to Rambla and the old city, within blocks of many fantastic restaurants and the famous market. Would return in a heart beat!!!! The city sightseeing buses and subway stops are only one block away. Thanks Regina for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Regina”
Reviews.Author: ulsterrover
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my wife and family in Regina from 17th to 20th July, we were givin a large family room that had all we required ( except a balcony), bathrobes to slippers.......The hotel is in a great location, quiet street, had very pleasant and helpfull staff , everything you could wish for on a visit to this fabulous city. My only drawback that their sister hotel next door was the one with the fabulous roof garden, well worth a visit..... Watson Co Down

Reviews.Title: “central as it gets and good offers”
Reviews.Author: NordicYoung_couple
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights. We liked the hotel very much; friendly/service minded staff, great location, nice design in hotel/room and cool lounge. Breakfast was good with sufficient range of offers. Very central location attractive to us just next to Plaça Catalonia, Plaça Universitat, Las Ramblas and El Corte Ingles. Quick access to metro for reaching sightseeing goals. Our room had double balcony doors so the lively noise of Barcelona did not disturb us at least. Room door was however not very soundproof - so could hear if anyone slammed the door during night, but we slept quite well. In our view this stay was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Susievet
Reviews.Content: After spending what felt like days googling hotels in barcelona I stumbled onto Hotel Regina and booked an early booking offer via a discount webpage. Very friendly hotel staff greeted us on arrival and directed us to our room - 408. I booked the trip for my boyfriends birthday and about 10minutes after getting settled the door went and it was a birthday cake and champagne courtesy of the hotel - very nice touch!! Rooms are lovely . Spotlessly clean and our maid done a fantastic job - coming back each night to an immaculately tidy room. Mini bar has a variety of drinks and snacks. Location is excellent - 30seconds walk from plaza catalunya. Have already recommended Hotel Regina to everyone Ive spoken to! Everything about it gets a thumbs up from me!!

Reviews.Title: “Although not very soundproof, a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fage
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews on this website,my girlfriend and I decided to book a stay for 3 nights at this hotel. We booked online and when we got there the staff was EXTREMELY friendly. Everything was as requested and we were able to use our room before check-in time. The room itself was perfect. The bed was very comfortable and the room contained all the luxury you'd need on a citytrip (minibar, TV, airconditioning,...). The bathroom was really nice and although the bathtub was a bit on the small side, we had no complaints here whatsoever. However, during our first night we were woken several times by the family next door. We realize that the hotel can't be responsible for this, but unfortunatly it wasn't the only case of noise we experienced. Everytime someone in the hallway closed their door or when the cleaning staff was working in the room next door, it felt like they were inside our room. During our final night we weren't able to sleep until 3 am due to a "celebration" at the hotel next door. We decided to give the reception a call but weren't able to reach them because our telephone was malfunction. When we told the friendly receptionist about our problem she was very polite and did all she could to resolve the issue. We will definitely visit Barcelona again as it’s a beautiful city. We tend to believe we just had bad luck with our room and might stay at this hotel again (requesting a quiet room). Finally, we would like to thank Mañanar for being so helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Regina has it all...great location, nice rooms and fabulous staff!”
Reviews.Author: jenw89
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Regina in June before departing on a cruise. Our family group was quite large (18 people) and we had 8 rooms. We arrived on several different days with some of us staying 4 nights and others only staying 1 night. Luckily we all had a wonderful experience. Most of the rooms were ready when we arrived (around 10 am) and for the few that were not ready, the hotel held the luggage and contacted us when the rooms were available. The rooms are spacious with plenty of storage. The bed was very comfortable. My husband and I shared a triple room with our 9 yr. old daughter. This was a great set up!! She slept on a twin sized bed in a small alcove in our room. She loved having "her own space". The breakfast buffet was a nice treat. We enjoyed having a quick, delicious breakfast before starting on our sightseeing each day. The fruit on the breakfast bar was especially tasty and we loved all the pastries. The hot choices were always the same, but that was fine. Most every afternoon around 5 pm we found ourselves gathering in the bar/lounge area to decide where we were headed for the evening. The bartenders were very nice and took good care of us. The sangria was delicious. On our first night we were so tired from the day, that we decided to eat dinner in the bar area. We had several different foods, but the most popular was the hamburger!! Everything tasted fresh and was served quickly. As you can tell, we really enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Regina. The location is great for walking and sightseeing on Las Ramblas and the Metro station is so close that any area of town is easily accessible. Even with all the positive things I have already mentioned, I saved the best for last....the best thing about the Regina is the service. Everyone who worked there was fabulous...helpful, friendly and kind. Lucilia at the front desk is absolutely a gem!! She really goes out of her way to help with anything you need, from restaurant suggestions and reservations, to tour reservations and outlet adapters. Lucilia really knows the meaning of customer service. If we ever make it back to Barcelona we will definitely choose the Hotel Regina again.

Reviews.Title: “Hip boutique hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: art_is_life Posted by a Worldhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Regina with some colleagues of mine. We were there for a business conference, but of course, made time to enjoy the city as well. The Regina was the perfect spot for that and was within walking distance to great shops, restaurants, and to CCCB/MACBA. The staff was friendly and helpful, plus spoke English which helped us greatly. The rooms were comfortable and although a little on the small side, on par (if not larger) than some others I've seen in the area. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel despite hot room”
Reviews.Author: kingpgmr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night pre cruise on June 13, 2009. The hotel has a great location near the top of Las Ramblas and Placa Catalunya. Our room wasn't ready as we arrived in the morning, but they will gladly stored our luggage for us. We had a family room which was a large room with four comfortable beds (two of the beds were pushed together to form a queen size bed) so all four of us could stay in one room. The bathroom was good sized and had wonderful amenities (shampoo, lotions, and individual toiletry kits for gentleman and ladies). There are also three computers with internet access available for free us which was convenient. The only problem with the room is that the air conditioning did not work very well and the room was hot (it was 78 degrees F in the room most of the time). Fortunately, we were so tired that we slept fine anyways. The staff was fairly friendly and called a taxi for us when we departed the next day for the pier.

Reviews.Title: “A return visit to the Regina and Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: 29north
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Regina again this year and was not disappointed. Great service and a surprise welcome back gift of Champagne and Chocolates. I do not know if they do this for everyone, not that I'm special, but a neat surprise. The entire staff went over backwards to make our stay excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: jjapples
Reviews.Content: We are checking out tomorrow after a 3 night stay, and I could not wait to give this hotel a review. First upon check in the desk staff was very professional. The room, 309, was clean and modern. We did not experience the noise, doors closing, that other people have experienced, the location, about 50 meters from Plaza Catalunya, a cafe around the corner, about 150 meters from La Ramblas. The staff was very helpful with reservations, directions and advice. I do submit to tripadvisor after every trip and not often with no complaints...Keep up the good work Hotel Regina.......Joe A.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: karlab
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights last week with my mom, and we were pleasantly surprised. The location of the hotel is amazing - just a five minute walk from the Aerobus stop, a five minute walk to the top of Las Ramblas, about a 10 minute walk to Casa Battlo and Casa Mila and there is a subway stop and a small grocery store right across the street! We were easily within walking distance to all the major sights in Barcelona. We thought the size of our room was very generous for a room in Europe, and we really liked the fact that the sink area was not in the bathroom - someone could use the shower while someone did their hair/makeup, whatever. We felt that the room itself was very clean and modern - nice flat screen TV, fridge with minibar, plently of room for our clothes and suitcases. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel, so I cannot comment on the food. As for the noise, we really did not hear a thing - there was a baby in the room next to us that we could hear a bit, but it really did not bother us too much. We were just so tired after sighseeing all day that we came home from dinner and just passed out cold! Our room was facing the street and we did not hear any traffic noise at all. All in all, I am planning on going back to Barcelona sometime with my husband, and I would like to stay at the Hotel Regina again. I would highly recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: MJLAlberta_Canada
Reviews.Content: We were here for 3 days last month and thouroughly enjoyed our time. Barcelona has so many beautiful sights and this hotel is in the ideal location to walk, hail a cab, or take the metro. The staff was helpful and friendly and gave us great tips for restaurants, especially Brasseria Flo. We ate there twice! We did eat at the breakfast buffet and as mentioned, there were limited hot choices. The fresh fruit and pastries were nice as well as the Iberian ham. it was not worth 16E each, possibly 10E would be more appropriate. The beds and pillows were comfy. The shampoo, lotions, etc were of good quality. We did not watch tv, but there seemed to be a few English choices. There was a little noise/movement from the metro. We will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: alaskabob
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location, just off Placa de Catalunya, less than 5 minutes walk from the Metro station, the AirportBus stop and Las Ramblas. There is in fact an entrance to the Placa de Catalunya station literally across the street from the from front door. There is a little supermarket across the street and an abundance of cafes and shops closeby. Due to delays to our already late evening arrival flight, we turned up for check-in somewhat tired and bedraggled at about 11pm. The entire check-in process was conducted in a very efficient and friendly manner by Navarro, and we were assigned a very spacious double room on the fifth floor at the front of the hotel with a balcony overlooking the street with a view of Placa de Catalunya to our right. Navarro also gave us a little guidebook and map of Barcelona along with our keycard which was a nice touch. The double bed is basically 2 large single beds together and was extraordinarily comfortable. (This is quite usual in European hotels) The decor has a contemporary feel with wooden floors and a white and chocolate colour scheme. The room was immaculately maintained by the excellent housekeeping staff daily. Room 502 had plenty of open storage space (ie while there isn't a wardrobe, there was plenty of space for hanging clothes, two neat drawers and lots of shelf space) The room is also equiped with a standard hotel room electronic combination safe, flat screen TV, good lighting and large mirrors. There are an array of toiletries supplied, including razor, shaving cream and aftershave balm, comb, lip balm, mint foot massage gel, toothbrush, toothpaste, shampoo, shower gel and body lotion, as well as bathrobe and slippers. The sink is actually in the bedroom which is a little unusual but it's an idea that works well. The shower (no bathtub) was spacious (with a full height glass door) with an excellent supply of hot water (and not one of those uncontrollable scalding hot and then freezing cold systems some many hotels seem to have) The actual shower room does feel a little small, partly due to the lower ceiling and also the slate grey wall tile colour scheme, but I'm nitpicking now! Some reviews complain about noise, and I can see what they mean. Yes, it is possible to faintly feel the trains go by underground and yes there can be street noise, but to be honest, the noise we found most irritaing was the commotion made by other tourists in the hallway outside our door yelling at some of their friends further down the hallway! There are 3 computers with free internet access available on the ground floor which is a nice touch. (Ideal if you want to check out Tripadvisor restaurant reviews!) The bar has a fairly extensive menu and cocktails average €8 (which is cheaper than the bars where we live!) We did not avail of breakfast at the hotel. The staff we encountered (reception/bar/housekeeping) were all terrifically friendly and pleasant at all times. There is a little wear and tear evident in some of the carpeted areas around the bar, but I can't really fault the hotel or its staff at all. We found it to be excellent value and in an excellent location. We would recommend it to our friends (and already have) and we would return again.(This was in fact already a return trip) (Complimentary access to a nearby Holmes Place Leisure Centre is available though we did not make use of this. Regarding safety in Barcelona, the hotel is in a very safe and busy area and I think that the same sensible approach one takes in any city or town are perfectly adequate.)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NikkiMcBride
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 9 - 11 May 2009. The rooms were clean, modern and very comfortable. The only downside being there is no storage space for clothes! The hotel is right in the centre of everything and with a Starbucks next door which we made full use of during our stay. I would definately recommend this hotel to all types of traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Classy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LRK
Reviews.Content: I should have written this review months ago since we so enjoyed our stay at Hotel Regina in September 2008. Better late than never! The location could not have been more perfect at the top of Las Ramblas right on Plaza Catalunya. So convenient to everything without being right ON Las Ramblas which would have been a little too crazy. The decor was hip sleek and contemporary, a surprise given the beautiful old building it is housed in. Our Room, 410, was fabulous. Beautifully appointed with a sinfully comfy bed with luxurious bedding, luxurious feather quilt, and fabulous slippers. We loved the fluffy towels, robes, and slippers; all kinds of toiletries (his and hers), a big safe, double sinks and bidet . The large balcony, accessed from either the bathroom or the main room, delivered amazing views of Plaza Catalunya and down Las Ramblas. One day we left the room, forgetting to lock our safe. We came back that evening realizing it was wide open, yet none of the contents were missing or disturbed in any way--even though while we were gone, maids had come in for turn down service and a hotel employee came in to leave us a note regarding a message that had been left for us. I don't know of many U.S. hotels where we would have been so lucky. Bravo to the staff and management for their honesty and ethics! The front desk staff for the most part was efficient and polite....not particularly warm and fuzzy, and some but not all of the clerks were a tad snotty, but helpful and professional and never rude, which was fine with me. Optional Breakfast is amazing, but pricey--a very impressive spread. However, we opted instead to grab coffee and a scone at the Starbucks directly next door to the hotel, with inviting tables and chairs outside on the plaza. The hotel has a very nice, classy, comfortable bar and lounge with free unlimited internet access and very friendly bartenders. . The only negative I can report is that, as in a couple of other (nice) European hotels, the glass shower door only extends half way down the length of the tub, making it impossible to keep water from flodding the beautiful marble floor. I wish someone would tell me why they do this--it's such a mess! Suggestion: request a room with a balcony looking out at Las Ramblas. Room 410 was awesome. Barcelona Tip: Although we were not pick-pocketed ourselves (and we felt very safe in and outside of our hotel), we heard stories every day of other tourists who were expertly separated from their valuables, usually without even realizing they were being robbed. Best to keep your money and other valuables in an inside pocket (preferably zippered or buttoned), not in a purse, backpack, or back pocket, and do leave whatever you can safely locked in the hotel safe.

Reviews.Title: “central and clean, but a tad small with tiny window”
Reviews.Author: acornsowner
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at a twin room at Hotel Regina in mid April. We picked this hotel for its location and we weren't disappointed. Everything was either walking or subway ride away, subway station was definitely less than 5 minutes walk away. The staff was OK but they sure made us wait when checking in (previous group was large and took forever). The room was rather small (we got room 211). I think we were facing the back side of the hotel but couldn't tell too well because there was only one tiny, narrow window facing walls with hardly any light coming in. The lighting in the room was fine, so we didn't feel all that bad, but a view would have been nice. We did hear some subway noise during the day time, but that didn't wake us up early or anything. Also, the room was kept quite warm, so we didn't even need the blankets when trying to sleep. The bonus was free access to 3 computers at business center-I wasn't expecting it, so it was nice to have. And there was a little supermarket right across the street, which made it easy for us to buy water and other snack items. Overall, I thought the hotel was clean, modern looking and in a great central location. Ideally, the room could have been bigger and with more natural light, but for busy travelers just needing a place to sleep, it was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel-location AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: AmandaJayneWales
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights in Barcelona staying in the Hotel Regina. I e-mailed Mr Sanchez ahead as the purpose of our stay was our 10th Wedding Anniversary and 1st trip abroad without the children. My husband is a light sleeper so I requested a quiet room. That's exactly what we got. We overlooked a small courtyard garden with no view but that was exactly what we wanted. Very, very quiet. On arrival in the room, we found a note congratulating us on our special ocassion which was a lovely touch. Five minutes later, we got brought a bottle of sparkling wine and some chocolates! We had a very spacious room. The bed was huge!! Everything was spotless. The bathroom was a great size. Twin sinks, bathrobes and slippers included, with some lovely toiletries. The best part of the hotel was the location. You could not get ANY better than this. The hotel was 2 minutes walk to the top of La Rambla and the same distance to the main bus and metro stations at Placa Catalunya. The airport bus dropped off across the square from the hotel for 4.25 euros. Bargain. MUCH cheaper than a taxi and so easy to do. Barcelona is a wonderful city and is packed with amazing sights. The only thing I wouldn't recommend is the Bus Turistic. It cost 27 euros for a 2 day pass and you can hop on and off at your leisure. The problem we had were the horrendous queues - and we were only using it on a thursday and friday. God knows what weekends would be like.On Saturday morning as we were leaving,the queues were miles long. The circuit was 2 hours all round and only went in one direction. So if you missed something, there was no way of going back unless you went right round the circuit again. On Friday, which happened to be a public holiday, part of the circuit was closed off due to a demonstration. We were not advised of this so after sitting on the bus for an hour to reach our destination, we had to get off and walk as the bus just returned to where we started. A real waste of 54 euros!The ordinary bus and metro stops are all close to major attractions so I would suggest this way of getting around. If you are thinking of visiting Barcelona, then stay at the Regina - you will ot be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Ticks all the right boxes...”
Reviews.Author: CruzControl
Reviews.Content: Great location. Hotel rooms are beautiful (the beds are sooo comfy) and the concierge service was second to none. The staff are extremely helpful and polite, we wanted to switch our double room to a twin and they arranged it straight away. Great place to stay, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: PeterLk
Reviews.Content: Myself and my fiancée stayed in this hotel from March 31st to April 1st this year and were very impressed. As I seen on this site that many people had praised the hotels location and there were very few disappointments I thought I will book it. Well I have to agree with you all - The Hotel Regina was Excellent, I sent the manager a mail that I found on this site "Jose" asking that if I booked the hotel would it be possible to get a balcony that looked over the junction and thats exactly what i got. Room was small but was perfect for two. The bar was very relaxing and the Location was well - Its all about Location location location and this has the best location ever. Top of La rambala in 2 minutes and 2 minutes to the Bus turstic main start and stop.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, professional - business class”
Reviews.Author: traveler200810
Reviews.Content: Friendly and Pro Staff. Nice Lobby with Bar and separate Internet points. Fitnessroom included but in a near dislocaded place. Safe free. MiniBar. Big Flat LCD TV with many spanish, english, Rai1, ARD and Pro7. Free WiFi in Room. A bit noisy corridor doors are not good insulated. In our room we heard also our neighbors talking and .... ;-) Recomanded nice place to have a business or travel stay in a busines class.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic property in a great location”
Reviews.Author: GavinF
Reviews.Content: Other have said it and I can only repeat - wonderful hotel in a great location. Add to that a dedication to customer service, from the GM on down, that cannot be beat! I highly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: flyingporcupine
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Regina. We were given a room on the second floor with a huge balcony overlooking the crossroads to the left of the hotel. We had booked the romantic package that this hotel and the Pulitzer offers for the first day, which includes a free bottle of Cava and a full continental breakfast the next morning, and so we spent the afternoon people-watching from the balcony, which was a perfect way to start our mini break! The room and the bathroom were huge, the room was completely spotless and the beds very comfortable. Our continental breakfast was amazing and the room service staff very attentive, and we also had the buffet breakfast for our last day in the lobby where the staff remembered who we were from the day before which was a very friendly gesture. We also relaxed in the bar one evening with some snacks and some drinks which were very good value for money. The only slight downside was that you could hear the Metro from our room quite easily, but it was easy to get used to and seems to be an issue with every hotel in the city. Prior to my stay at the Regina I was staying in the Alimara in the north of the city, miles out from the centre, and people complained about the noise of the traffic there too so I think it's unavoidable. The location of the Regina is perfect - out of the tourist-trap of the Ramblas and close enough to the north of the main street for the Gaudi houses and the nicer restaurants. Metro stop Placa Catalunya is very close to the hotel and is easy to get to. So overall, a 10/10 stay at the Regina!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel -- Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveler616
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the central of it all. From Las Rumbas street, to shopping, to great restaurants, the square, the port, historical district, Borne area and I am sure to be missing something. This hotel is so accessible to so much whether it is the bus to Guadi's park or the cathedral. This is a walk to everything hotel and steps from the Metro which is so easy to navigate. And that is coming from someone that is apprehensive in taking the subway in Manhattan. So don't be intimated!! Hotel is helpful with anything needed. Rooms are spacious and clean same goes for bathrooms. Great value! Would recommend to anyone staying in Barcelona! Shh I did stay at their other hotel too...the Pulzer. Both are nice but Hotel Regina has bigger rooms which is a plus for me, everything was basically between the two unless you are the younger 20-30 age group who is looking for that posher feel pick Pultzer. Go to their websites they are true to what you will find upon arrival. HUGE PLUS they offer free internet which GREAT and it is reliable...everyone loves free. Helpful Hint: Ask to have a room further away from both the elevator and maids closet area. This will make for a quieter stay; with most hotels in Barcelona having paper thin walls take advantage of staying away from other noises.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly helpful staff. beautiful room”
Reviews.Author: pezzaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a day early prior to leaving on a Mediterranean Cruise. We had heard bad things about Barcelona hotel and were not sure what to expect. We were greeted by exceptionally helpful and friendly staff. Every one we came in contact with spoke English except for the bartender. Our lost luggage was tracked down by staff members and delivered to our room when it arrived. Our room had a king size bed, beautiful bathroom and a sitting room. Very clean with all the amenities. The only bad thing I could say was noise from the hallway filtered into the room quite a bit. As it was pouring rain we decided to eat in the bar area. The food was fantastic and the service was quick and efficient. The hotel location is a very short walking distance to the Ramblas. A great cultural and good shopping experience.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel”
Reviews.Author: gp4free
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there on Valentines day. The hotel offered a great deal on a special package..champagne,chocolate covered strawberries, rose petals, bubble bath etc...The hotel set everything up while we were out. When we got back to our room my wife was thrilled. The hotel really did a great job. I will stay there whenever I am in barcelona. The location cant be beat either...also free internet..just the best

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, generally good service.”
Reviews.Author: VPV
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Regina around the same time in 2008 as well as in Feb 2009 - on both occasions I stayed four nights in a standard double room. As with many hotel rooms, it appears that a request for twin beds yields a bigger 'standard' room than a request for a double bed in the same standard room. Something to keep in mind if you don't want to pay extra for a bigger room! The rooms are a good size, cosy without being tiny - although I know the bigger superior rooms are very spacious. Cleanliness is excellent, although it takes a couple of days to get used to the fact that the room is not made up until early afternoon - a problem only if you are not out for the day. Location-wise the hotel is in a great position - literally a 3min. walk to Las Ramblas, the tourist heart of Bcn, but without the noise and dodgy characters that abound along it, particularly at night. Unusually for Europe in my experience, the hotel also offers free internet access from 3 computers near the bar - not just wifi connectivity which was very handy as I don't carry a laptop. Service-wise the staff are generally excellent. In particular Lucila (I think) who is speedy, efficient but does not sacrifice good service. There is an older man who works there, a Snr, who is much grumpier. One night when I had a number of recommendations for restaurants I asked for directions - he simply told me he didn't know where 2 of them were and was completely uninterested in looking it up for me on the internet. On the other hand, Lucila spent much time clarifying a business address before showing me its location - and even made sure the taxi driver knew exactly where to go! A big difference there. Restaurant recommendations were not bad, but not superb. The hotel sent us to a restaurant called L'Olive, which was nice - but very expensive considering it is just local food. I would rather the hotel provided local restaurants that would have been equally good. We went to 7 Portes (also touristy, but very good) and Biblioteca (near La Boqueria).

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and location”
Reviews.Author: essendee
Reviews.Content: The hotel Regina has more customer caring touches than most 5 star hotels. What can I say everything was perfect, prior to going on our weekend break I emailed the manager to request non smoking and high floor room and also mentioned it was my wife’s birthday, when we arrived with friends our requests were recognized and there was a bottle of champagne and snacks in the room, which was such a nice touch. Speaking of the rooms they are a modern room with nice touches, bath robes, slippers and extras, there was also a safe in the room. Even though the room faced the road there was hardly any traffic noise with the windows closed. The hotel is convenient placed at the top of the ramblas, the tourist buses, normal buses and metro were around the corner, plenty of restaurants and bars were also in the area. We did not have breakfast in the hotel as there was a star buck coffee shop close by, every night the beds were turned down with chocolates waiting on the pillow as we returned to the room in the night, the cocktail bar was pleasant and on the day of my wife birthday this provided the setting for the hotel to provide more champagne and a birthday cake for my wife. All of the staff were so friendly and professional in there job, I would like to thank all of them for providing such a nice break. IF YOU STAY IN BARCELONA THE HOTEL REGINA COULD BE THE PLACE TO STAY.

Reviews.Title: “loving it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: aidem
Reviews.Content: really enjoyed our stay at the regina. its in a great location - right beside all the shops, restaurants etc. the staff were friendly and very helpful - we even got cava and cake for my birthday!

Reviews.Title: “Will always stay at Hotel Regina when in Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: Bangkok_GlobeTrotter
Reviews.Content: Stayed here December 4-9, 2008 on a mini holiday to Barcelona (my third trip). My experience with the hotel staff before AND during the stay was top rate throughout. The General Manager Mr. Sanchez was extremely helpful during the rate inquiry process and answered every email. I'm from Bangkok and took this trip during the Bangkok airport closure first week of December and therefore had to fly out from a military airport 200 km north of Bangkok. This made the trip extremely tiring and I was a zombie when I got into Barcelona after a 20 hour trip. I had to check in early as my flight landed from Singapore at 9 am. The room was ready and they did not charge me extra. Mr. Sanchez surprised me with an exceptionally gracious gesture. First, I had requested for a room with a view over the square during the reservation process but did not expect to be accommodated as I had booked a standard room. Much to my pleasant surprise, he had arranged for a corner room with a perfect view and the bathroom and bedroom area was huge. I strongly recommend Room 410. It was perfect after a long journey. Second, as I was unpacking a knock on the door came and two hotel staff presented me with a bottle of bubbly and two boxes of chocolate covered pistacchio nuts. All complimentary!!! This totally took my tiredness away and I was totally impressed by Mr. Sanchez's hospitality. He even had a welcome note personally signed to welcome me to the hotel. All this is totally unexpected, especially in Europe where you're often put into a room facing another building's wall if you're paying standard rate, and the sincerity and care of the hotel's GM is totally heart warming, the best I've ever experienced in Europe. The room was airy, with floor to ceiling French doors and very bright. Hardwood floor and very comfortable bed and sheets. I had asked for restaurant recommendations and Mr. Sanchez sent a letter under my door with list of top restaurants in Barcelona literally minutes after I'd talked to him on the phone (he is also GM at the next door Pulitzer Hotel). Everything is absolutely first rate at half the price of what you'd have to pay if you were to stay at the Le Meridien just a few blocks down. The location was excellent, just steps from Plc. Catalunya underground station. Thank you again Mr. Sanchez for a wonderful stay in Barcelona. I never had a chance to thank Mr. Sanchez in person as he was on holiday just after my arrival but the service I received was more personal than many other hotels I've stayed at. I will never stay elsewhere and will definitely recommend my colleagues to book the rooms here when they attend Euro PCR in 2009. Sam

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Comfortable Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: NewYork_NYNygirl
Reviews.Content: Thank you to Mr. Sanchez for accommodating all our requests - room with balcony, early check-in, non-smoking floor. Since we also informed him that it was our anniversay, he had a bottle of Cava and chocolate covered pistachios in the room when we arrived - very classy and thoughtful touch. Thank you again. Wonderful, charming front desk staff - very helpful, friendly and well informed - most especially Raffa and Manuel. Suggested great restaurants - Cinc Sentits, Espai Sucre (dessert place), and Olive - all exquisite cuisine in the new Spanish style plus a couple of more traditional ones - Cal Pep and Cerveceria Catalunya (which we all went to and recommend highly) he also let us know what to avoid as tourist traps - helpful information anywhere you travel. Perhaps the noise problem has been addressed since talking and other noise from cleaning staff was kept to a minimum and did not bother us at all. There were double windows on the balcony which overlooked the street and so no noise penetrated from outside either. The rooms are clean, well-kept, well-stocked and had more than adequate space for two people. The bed was comfortable (as they say, when travelling, it is all about the bed) and afforded us several good nights' sleep after a long day of exploring. The hotel is centrally located between the old town (Rambla, Born and Barrio Gothic) and the new areas (Eixample) but on a quiet street. Getting to either place was so easy since all transportation was just half a block away (including the airport bus) on Plaza Catalunya, although I think Barcelona is a walking town and we highly recommend doing this. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone. The staff is very responsive and will address any of your questions and concerns in a very professional but friendly manner.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: SBTravller
Reviews.Content: From Goh S.B. and Family... We have 4 nights of wonderful stay in Regina Hotel Barcelona just last week. The Family Room is huge - 4 single beds with large space to move around. It is very clean - it seems that the housekeeper would come in to clean and tidy up the room each time we are out. The receptionists are friendly and have no problem conversing in English. Breakfast is good, with wide range of meat, cereals, fruits and juices. A bit expensive though. I am particularly glad that the management readily modified the room rate each time it is reduced from time of my booking. One thing we find missing in the room - the complimentary coffee and tea, or at least an electric kettle. Though Starbuck is just next door, it is always great to return to the room and make for ourselves a cup of real hot drink to complete the day, especially during winter. Location is fantastic. Very convenient - direct transport by Aeroport Bus from the airport. This Hotel will definitely be our first choice if we decide to re-visit Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: qvs
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel a few years ago now, but it does have a great location, possibly unrivalled. Being just off the Ramblas is the best spot (not on it, its too noisy) and this hotel is just there. Its also a few minutes from the metro, shops and places to eat out. Its not cheap but you wont miss anything from a stay in Barca if you choose well.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: steviemagid
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! From the moment that we contacted it on the internet to check-out. Very professional--rooms were large and immaculate. Staff at the front desk helpful. Free internet was great! Wonderful location. Right in the heart of Barcelona. Also the rates for Nov. were half the price of the summer rates, which made the stay even better. Wish we could have stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel close to the action”
Reviews.Author: LJ2008
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Regina for four nights. Good points: 1. Hotel is very central - just off from Placa de Catalunya. Good for almost everything. Top marks for location. 2. Decor and furnishings around hotel are fresh, modern and to a consistently high standard. 3. Reception staff were very pleasant and helpful. They gave us a map, brochures and booklets of local attractions and events which were very helpful. 4. Room was small but bright, modern and stylish. Flat screen TV, hairdryer, dressing towels, slippers and his & hers toiletry kits (nice touch) supplied but no tea or coffee making facilities though. 5. Room had a modern safe controlled by pin code and didn't cost extra. 6. There's a mini supermarket across the road - buy snacks/drinks here at a fraction of the minibar prices. Things to watch out for: 1. Hotel breakfast runs until noon but was very expensive (12 Euro for basic coffee/juice/croissant or 16 Euro for wider selection) although poor value for money hotel breakfasts seems the norm in big cities. Tip: try the excellent cafes near the hotel including the Happy grill (sounds cheesy, I know!), a five minute walk up Rambla de Catalunya where 2 Euro gets you a croissant and coffee and 5 Euro gets you a freshly squeezed OJ and cooked breakfast with toast. Or try the mini-mart across the street that sells croissants etc. Save your cash for the many amazing (but expensive!) Gaudi buildings that must be seen. 2. Hotel bar very expensive e.g. 8/9 Euro for a whisky. With lots of fantastic bars and cafes in the city, we gave the Regina's a miss. 3. Because of its central location, be prepared for sirens and the very regular rumble of the underground until it shuts for the night. Also the walls seem very thin - you hear everything that's happening around you. 4. The 3rd floor is the smoking floor (all rooms). While the smell wasn't too bad, it's one for non-smokers to avoid if possible. 5. When we checking out, the hotel had added a 7 Euro minibar item to our bill which we disputed although to their credit they did remove it without any fuss. 6. We booked through an online booking site however local tax (7% I think) was not included in the rate we were quoted and was added to the final bill - watch out for this. Recommend Taller de Tapas (lots about) for good food and La Luna (Gothic Quarter, Guinness sign out front) for a very nice bar. Avoid La Pomma and on Rambla and Fargo on either Rambla or Gracia, can't remember which. Recommend Maim cuban bar - amazing setting, very friendly relaxed atmosphere and killer mojitos for 5 Euro! If you're in another party of the town at night e.g. Barrio Gotico or Gracia then a taxi will cost between 6 and 9 Euro to get back to hotel, although metro system is excellent and runs till very late at the weekend, you can get a ten journey ticket ("T-10") for 5 or 7 Euro. Despite the things to look out for, it's a great hotel and I would go definitely go back to it.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, bad sound insulation”
Reviews.Author: MiDi27
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a week vacation in Barcelona. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful, they've even organized tickets for a football match (which was quite complicated as we arrived on the match day). The hotel is modern and has all neccesary facilities, including free WiFi access. The breakfast is good, though a little variation would be welcomed. One thing to ruin it all was extremly lousy sound insulation - it sounds like walls are made of carton or something. Every day we followed the same routine - at night you cannot sleep because of neighbours returning from famous Barcelona nightlife. In the morning our wake up was set at 7:00 when the cleaning personell is starting to vacuum clean the corridor talking out loud to each other. Later, when early birds start to go for sightseeing, we could hear every word they said. All in all, the hotel management has to do something to improve this, because otherwise the hotel is mostly reccomended.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hellnini
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a very convenient location, close to the Plaza de Catalunya and Las Ramblas. It was extremely clean and the staff were very accommodating. It had a complimentary breakfast and free internet access. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel in ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Nibbles
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed here 1 night post cruise and chose the hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews and I can see why the hotel gets such a high rating. It couldn't be in a better location, only a 100 yds off Catalunya in a quiet side street. It's a stylish hotel with a very welcoming staff and nice public areas. Our quad room was large and well equipped with nice touches such as bathrobes and slippers and a complimentary plate of fruit and water provided in the evening. The bathroom was big, with plenty of fluffy towels and the bedroom had a large TV with a good selection of channels. The free internet (and WiFi) was a welcome addition - particularly since our stay coincided with 2 VERY rainy days! A couple of minor gripes - the room was VERY hot and although it appeared to have aircon this didn't work - despite the fairly cool weather we still needed to keep the window wide open to air the room. The design of the hotel (wooden floors) doesn't lend itself to quiet - we stayed in a similar hotel in Barcelona before and found the same thing. The breakfast looked very good - but not worth 17 euros so we opted to go elsewhere. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel, or to stay here again when we next visit this wonderful city

Reviews.Title: “Funky and well located, some windowless rooms”
Reviews.Author: MobileDane
Reviews.Content: It was very fine to stay at the Regina three nights for a nearby conference at the university. A bit on the expensive side, but it was generally modern, elegant, attractive and funky. Free fully functioning in room WIFI included. First I was put in a very small room with no windows, I did not like that! It was changed next day no problem. Lively streets, but excellent glazing keeps it quiet inside if you prefer. Breakfast is good but expensive (they almost seemed to panic when they discovered I was having breakfast one morning, not included in my deal, but relaxed when I flashed my key and credit card). Starbucks is right next door, not too cheap either, but nice outside seating. The location of the hotel is very good near Metro, sightseeing bus start, shopping, and head of las Ramblas. I would gladly stay here again for business or pleasure, but be more alert about getting a good room from the start.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: clivethegadget
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 stayed in a family room for 3 nights from 8th October. The room was very large and clean with very comfortable beds. The position of the hotel was excellent as it is situated just around the corner from Plaza Catalunya with all the transport faciities and restaurants on the doorstep. On arrival we found that my daughter had left her mobile phone in the taxi ... but i would like to thanks the hotel staff for their help and consideration as they offered and helped us with trying to get the phone back. (Thankfully, we did manage to contact the finder and get it back). We did not have breakfast at the hotel as the price of 16 euros per person seemed expensive (a family of 4 costing 64 euros). However, there were plenty of places close by which were great for breakfast at reasonable value. The hotel went to great lengths to ensure that we had a great stay for our Wedding anniversary. Thank you Mr Sanchez .. we loved your hotel and your kind hospitality and I would certainly stay there again when we return and would recommend it to others. Thanks !

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased!”
Reviews.Author: vandkl
Reviews.Content: I arranged for our small staff to stay at the Hotel Regina during a convention in June of 2008. Even before we arrived, the staff at the hotel was very responsive to questions that we sent via email, etc. Once we arrived, I was again pleasantly surprised at how nice and helpful the staff was. The lobby was small, but very well kept and beautiful. The rooms were comfortable and really modern, clean and nice. The internet was free, so that was great as well! The hotel is in a great area, very close to the Catalonia Ramblas. It wasn't very close to the convention center, but the subway was close and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travel0h0lic
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Regina during 2 nights for a week-end getaway for my 45th birthday early Sept. In all, this hotel is OK and what you would expect of a 4 star city hotel. Nothing special but nice design. Husband, myself and our teenage daughter shared a 'family room'. It was spacious and nicely decorated with modern dark wood furniture. We were pleasantly surprised that we did not hear the traffic - the hotel is located right in the middle at the top of La Rambla and therefore quite a lot of traffic noise. However, inside, the hotel is very poorly insulated. We were unlucky to have the cleaner's cupboard just outside our room and at 07:00 in the morning we heard everything they did and said ... very annoying! There is a 1.5 cm gap under the door which makes anything said in the corridor like if said inside your room. While fully equipped with bathrobes, slippers, toiletries, towels etc for 3 people (which is good, you usually have to remind housekeeping of the third person), we thought the bathroom was very small and the double sink next to the bed was weird. Since the bathroom/room obviously had been remodelled, it would have been better to move the wall across and include the sinks within the bathroom. We enjoyed Barcelona very much. Beautiful city with lots to do and see for a week-end getaway and warm temperatures still in September. We even spent an afternoon on the beach. The sister hotel Pulitzer next door has a much nicer bar. Can be recommended. We'll probably stay at the Pulitzer next time.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sousse
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for one night for sightseeing in Barcelona. Room 220 spacious, big bed seperate area with day bed/3rd bed. Immaculate bathroom, bathrobes etc. & soooo quiet. Dare I have a tiny complaint, diffuculty getting BBC World on the plasma to catch up on the Credit news at home. Otherwise the Hotel scored 11 out of 10

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PipsterFYL
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Regina for 4 nights in August and it was Brilliant. If your searching for somewhere with good location with great rooms and good service then you've found it. We booked online and had the normal worry about if the hotel would be good or not but we really shouldnt of. The airport bus dropped us off and only took us a few mins to find hotel walking with our bags, we were greeted by friendly staff and impressive entrance to hotel. Room was great! very stylish with large plasma tv and great view, extremely comfy bed and wee mini bar to keep us going. loved it! Hotel's in a great location, only a few mins walk round to las ramblas and main square; the tour bus also goes from this area too so didnt have to go far at all to start the city touring. We ate in the hotel and it was really good, very relaxing atmosphere, free internet if you have things to do/catch up on, there is nothing I can say that was wrong at all and highly recommend staying here. Hotel also has room to store luggage if you dont leave till late on your check out day which was very handy for us! Thank you to all the staff and also for the bottle of Cava we received and hope to see you again soon. phil and louise

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Regina”
Reviews.Author: claire462
Reviews.Content: Surly check in clerk. Air con did not work despite complaining twice. Not one good nights sleep in 3 night stay due to non existent sound proofing between rooms and corridor. If you like the sound of slamming doors, stay here, otherwise spend your euros more wisely. 2nd attempt to review this hotel so hopefully this one will get shown!

Reviews.Title: “First class”
Reviews.Author: Doon
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel in a fantastic location for viewing all sights and access to transport links. Friendly and helpfull staff and a fantastic breakfast selection.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, wonderful beds”
Reviews.Author: downsmead
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Regina for 2 nights in August in a family room. The room was exceptionally spacious, the bathroom well stocked with towels, robes and toiletries. The beds were the most comfortable we have ever had in an hotel room anywhere in the world. Our teenage girls especially appreciated the free internet. The hotel is brilliantly situated for exploring Barcelona with most of the attractions within easy walking distance. The family room offers good value for money. The staff are very friendly and accomodating. I can thoroughly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “balcony adventures and beautiful people”
Reviews.Author: sandihno74
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Catalunya on the Sunday evening of my birthday and I was immediately impressed with the Hotel location. Whilst central and very close to La Ramblas, the Regina enjoys the quiet luxury of being on a street slightly off the main thoroughfare and is therefore not too full on when you don't want it to be. A one minute walk away is the tour bus stop, from where you can gain access to the wondrous cultural and historic sights of Barca. I'd never been on a tour bus but trust me, in Barcelona it is so nice to just tour and jump off at a place you fancy. The room itself was spacious, very clean and well maintained and stylish. Personally I really enjoyed the balcony. Standing there at bedtime or in the morning before heading out and consuming the sights and sounds of such a brilliant place, the different characters and local people just going about their daily business was fascinating. Thinking about it now, I really am not sure if I have ever slept in a more comfy bed. Such good sleep, it was real proper comfort. I also received cake and Cava on my birthday, which was an unexpected surprise and a lovely gesture. The staff at the Regina were great. My lasting impression is of a quiet confidence and professionalism. I was highly impressed on our check out day. I mean OK, most hotels (good ones) have a luggage room but on our check out day I did not feel hassled at all. There was no rush and we were still being treated as guests. We had a small issue with our flight and the super people at reception let us use the hotel phone and generally cared and concerned that we were OK. Bear in mind that this was AFTER we had stopped being paying customers. Now that's how the hotel world should be.

Reviews.Title: “An allrounder”
Reviews.Author: MaltaMerc
Reviews.Content: Perfect location - just off Placa de Catalunya, right at the heart of Barcelona. Room was small but very clean and tastefully furnished (although lacking a full size mirror). Very comfortable bed. A functional modern bathroom. Free internet in the lounge area. Breakfast - buffet style, varied, good quality food. We recommend this hotel. with confidence.

Reviews.Title: “Spot On!”
Reviews.Author: africanangler
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, POOR air-conditioning but that was fixed in the next room. Good staff. Superb location and breakfast until noon which was a real bonus. We had brunch and headed out everyday. Good choice of hot and cold foods... excellent service at the restaurant. My only complaint was that there was NO WATER AVAILABLE in the hotel after 11 pm. We were told that the bar shuts at 11 pm. and hence there is no water available to drink!!! The reception staff was also a bit rude. On check out I offered to pay for a mini bar item that they had not billed me for. I was asked to walk down to the bank and get the correct change so I could pay them for something that they had not billed me for!!!! The nerve!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous in Every Aspect”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Rox
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the Hotel Regina for 3 nights and 4 days after reading reviews and seeing photos on Trip Advisor. We were not disappointed in any way and this hotel, its staff, service and location were ideal for our trip. I e-mailed the manager 3 days in advance and requested a smoking room, balcony and bath tub. The manager responded speedily and was very helpful, which was much appreciated. Even though we didn't get a smoking room (no doubt due to the late booking), the rest of our requests were met. Also, as it was my fiancée’s birthday on the day of our arrival, he was treated with a delicious birthday cake and bottle of Cava as a surprise. He was delighted by this warm welcome to the beautiful city of Barcelona! The location was ideal; we were based in the hubbub of the city but without the noise and bustle. A 2-minute walk to a city tour bus stop (which is the best way of getting to the hidden and more well-known sights and areas of Barcelona) and Las Rambla (with its marvellous variety of street artists, cafes, markets and people). A 5-minute walk to the enchanting Gothic Quarter and 10 minutes to the Arc de Triamf whilst surrounded by the spectacular architecture of Gaudi. In fact, the Hotel Regina was so well located, everything was within in easy reach. As a couple on a romantic break, we wanted privacy, comfort and a touch of sophistication from our hotel and room. We weren't disappointed. The staff were friendly, non-invasive and very helpful even abiding our poor but eager attempts at speaking Spanish with wide smiles of amusement! The bar seemed more suitable for business/non-intimate guests due to its layout and but was perfect for intimate late night drinks after exploring the city’s nightlife. This is another great appeal of the hotel; with Las Rambla 2 minutes away and its many cobbled side streets leading to mystically lighted and delightful squares, there were an endless variety of bars and restaurants catering for all people, tastes and budgets - morning, noon and night. The room and en-suite bathroom were very spacious, clean and beautifully designed in modern decor. And now, for the beds! It was like sleeping on a cloud; with no noise from the street or air conditioning (which was superb); this was an amazing experience in itself! If you’re looking for a romantic, hassle-free, relaxed and seductively modern hotel with easy access to all of the great sights of Barcelona without the noise, I strongly suggest you stay at this hotel. I would not hesitate in recommending the Hotel Regina in Barcelona to any lone traveller, couple or small family visiting this cosmopolitan yet traditional city steeped in fascinating history.

Reviews.Title: “Superior location + Pofessional staff = Superb Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Nick28Ontario
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Regina on the 25 July for one night before our Royal Carribean Cruise. We booked this hotel based on the strength of the reviews here at Tripadvisor, and we were not disappointed. From the moment we booked the staff answered all questions timely and efficiently. We even got directions on which airport bus to take which saved us time and money. Barcelona is a superb city and this hotel's location near Los Ramblas was excellent. The counter staff upon both check in and check out were great. They made supper recommendations, sightseeing musts, and just made us feel welcomed. When we got to our room, we were so pleasantly suprised! It was huge. We had a room with a kingsized bed, and two singles, and it still appeared big! We went out for an early supper on Las Ramblas, which is something you must do! When we returned we had a bottle of Cava cooling in ice and some chocolates...what a treat! This hotel manager and staff really went above and beyond to ensure that our holiday got started to an awesome start! Thank you for everything. We recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Tewnie1
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 day stay in at Hotel Regina with my mum which was a special treat for my 30th Birthday. It goes without saying that Barcelona is a fantastic destination for any occasion with something for all - culture, great architecture, restaurants, beach and shopping but the hotel we stayed in just enhanced our trip even more. Hotel Regina certainly ticked off all the boxes: 1. Welcoming and personable staff who made us feel at home as soon as we arrived. They also arranged for a complimentary bottle of champagne and a lovely chocolate cake to be delivered to our room as a surprise for my birthday. 2. Stylish hotel with great rooms - we were even got a free upgrade on arrival 3. Location wise its the most convenient and central to all the attractions and restaurants. Even though its in the middle of the city you dont hear any traffic due to great double glazing. 4. Really good value for money There really were no negative points to mention! I will certainly be recommending this hotel to all my friends when they visit Barcelona and would use it again when i return to the city next year.

Reviews.Title: “apparently most smallest room , really anti-climax”
Reviews.Author: YLTang
Reviews.Content: Before I booked my air plane ticket to Barcelona, I intensively looked at Tripadvisor for suggestions. After a long search I stumbled to this hotel; looked at most of the positive reviews and actually also the traveller's pictures. When we actually arive on July 30th, we got a room which apparently was the smallest room of the whole hotel (imo), 202. All the good and positive reviews turned out for me to be unreal. No bath, just a shower, small toilet, which I actually have trouble to do my daily things. The bed was good, but small. We actually have not much room to put our lugages. The staff at the reception I actually did not find that friendly as what I see most of the reviewers are telling. Maybe, they have a different service based on your appearance? I do find the cleaning staff friendly, always greeting you and smiling. For me it is a once time stay at this hotel, I will try other hotels nearby with the same price. The location though is super.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good second time around”
Reviews.Author: jamin662
Reviews.Content: Just Visited this hotel a second time, and whilst everything was still very professional, with the busier season, the service seemed less friendly, which I guess is understandable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NWGirl25
Reviews.Content: It has taken me a little while to post this review but as we had such a fantastic stay didn't want to let this pass! went away with my female friend to celebrate my birthday - *location - couldn't be better very central *rooms - perfect size, fab bathrooms, lovely little balconies *service - very helpfuk, carried our bags to the room, had dinner in bar first night which was very reasonably priced *extra - first night were given complementary bottle cava & yummy chocolate cake for my birthday sorry this is short review but just wanted to stay would stay here every time I go to Barcelona - fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Boss Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: frances_alex
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Regina for 3 nights and loved it. The location couldn't be better, perfect for getting around the city quick and easily. Our room was lovely and had a big balcony looking down on starbucks cafe area. Staff were lovely and very helpful. our room was spotless when we arrived and was cleaned more than once a day, very good service! The only concern was that the bathroom got very wet when the shower was used, due to the shower door not being long enough to protect the floor. But it didn't cause any major problems because it was always cleaned up afterwards by the maids. Really close to 2 underground stations and only a 2 minute walk to the airport bus stop. Getting around the city from this hotel couldn't have been easier. Definitely recommend it to anyone considering a short trip to barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a weekend break”
Reviews.Author: cybergirlScotland
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 4 night break staying at the Hotel Regina in Barcelona. Absolutely perfect location at the top of Las Ramblas just off the main road.
