Brilliant for getting the open top bus in Place Catalanya. Had a room on the 3rd floor overlooking the main entrance. No trouble with noise from the street. Decent sized room with everything that you need in it. Lovely toiletries and fluffy towels. Didn't have breakfast in the hotel. Went to the Royal hotel for breakfast where there was a good buffet for 10 euros which set us up for the day. Would definitely use this hotel again. Not the cheapest place to stay but you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Regina is a superior hotel”
Reviews.Author: india1939
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Regina for two nights in late June. We had a double room, (2 beds), our children and grandchildren had a quad room (4 beds). The hotel is right off Plaza Catalyuna and the main thoroughfare Las Ramblas. It was quiet (except for the night that Spain won the world cup), the rooms were modern, clean and beautiful. Bathrooms were crisp and clean. The complimentary bathrobes were a plus. Their small bar is quiet and perfect to relax in after a day of sightseeing. They will arrange for sandwiches and small meals upon request. The internet is free, with 3 provided computers. The staff was very friendly and accommodating, answering our questions and providing taxi calls and restaurant recommendations. The beds were very comfortable, the rooms fairly large. Although not inexpensive, it compares very favorably with any 4 star hotel in New York City...indeed the rooms are larger and cleaner. We would be happy to use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Conchobar
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Barcelona and I chose the Hotel Regina for our stay. From the initial communication with the hotel's gracious manager, José Mª Sanchez, through our checkout, the experience was outstanding. The property is located just off the Placa Catalunya which provides VERY easy access from the airport. Hop on the A-1 bus (blue) and in just minutes you are there walking a short distance to the hotel (look for the blue banner on the side of the building). Having arrived in the morning I was quite pleased after the long flight that our room was available upon arrival and check-in was very pleasant and efficient. Our 5th floor room was spacious, contemporary and very comfortable (pictures posted) and the bathroom was good sized. As previously reported here, the bedding is very comfortable. The location of rhe property is fantastic for visiting the city sites as it is an easy walk to the historic areas and La Rambla. Also, the Bus Turistic (hop on hop off service) launches from the Placa Catalunya so gettting around the city from the hotel is very, very easy. We found each staff person at the hotel eager to help, very knowledgeable and very friendly. Our travels brought us back to Barcelona for the night before our flight home and we were happy to return to the Hotel Regina for our last night. The room we had this time was an interior room and was much smaller than our initial room but was comfortable and met our needs for the night. I don't know when our travels might bring us back to Barcelona but when we return, I happily know I have a home away from home in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “avoid room 502”
Reviews.Author: kjs55555
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Regina for two nights preceding our cruise departing from Barcelona. Although the hotel is ideally located just off the city center, our room had two major problems. First, was that the airconditioning, if you want to call it that, was practically non-existent. We have a thermometer on our travel clock radio and the coolest that the room ever got was 73F. Anytime we left the room the Air conditioning was turned off, resulting in a considerably warmer room upon our return. Although there were thermostat and fan setting switches on the wall of our room, neither appeared to be functioning. Our second complaint was that the bathroom floor completely flooded each time the shower was used....due to a leak under the shower door. We brought both of these problems to the front desk after our first night, even explaining where the shower was leaking from and nothing was done to correct either problem. One other side issue is that the chair in the room is extremely uncomfortable....too low and no arms. (If we wanted to sit anywhere, we had to sit on the bed.) My parents were in another room and theirs had a beautiful leather chair.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: getawaysLondon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here last week for 2 nights. We found the hotel absolutely perfect, the location was great the service was good, it was very clean, very contemporary and offered us everything we needed for a short city break. I have to say the beds were absolutely amazing, so comfortable I don't think we have ever slept so well being away from home. Would definitely book a room again should we revisit beautiful Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel, will return”
Reviews.Author: Unsie
Reviews.Content: Our family of 9 ( 7 adults and 2 children) just returned from our wonderful 7 night stay at the Hotel Regina, Barcelona. The hotel is located 2 minutes from Plaza Catalunya and could not be in a better location to get around the city. We got the airport bus in which leaves you off outside the Corte Ingles right opposite the street the hotel is on. When we arrived, check in was quick and the staff could not be more helpful. They gave us a family room for 4, a triple room for 3 and a superior double which also had an extra partition with a bed in it. The rooms all had bottles of champagne, large bathrooms with 2 sinks and lots of toiletries. The beds were huge and very comfortable and each room had a 32 inch plasma screen. We asked for rooms on the first floor and they were all located together so it was like having your own little section of the hotel. I contacted the manager who is also manager of the award winning Hotel Pultzier which is next door and we were also able to use their amenities too. The manager arranged for us to have rooms plus breakfast, which turned out to be the best choice and well worth the extra money. It was a buffet breakfast with a variety of breads/ croissants/ cakes/ cheeses/juices/ cereals/ tortillas/ fresh fruit and salads and more.. The staff were extremely helpful, in particular Lucila who heled us get concert tickets. The food in the hotel is really good and reasonably priced and the bar staff make sure everything is perfect for you. For some of the group, it was our 2nd time in Barcelona and it was even better this time around. before we stayed in Barceloneta beside the beach which is a bit of a trek into the city centre. Everything is within walking distance of Hotel Regina and it really helps when you have somewhere luxurious to come back to when you have had a long day playing the tourist. I would 100% reccommend this hotel and Barelona to any traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: FinbarratBrixworth
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 2 night stay, and thoroughly enjoyed it. The location of this hotel is perfect. It's right in the centre of the city, so a perfect starting point to explore. And also very easy to get back to - all types of transport are right outside. From the moment we arrived, the staff were very helpful and efficient. The room was an unusual shape but an acceptable size. The beds were comfy. Our only complaint was being located right next to the infamous housekeeping cupboard, and therefore heard every door open and close as the staff went about their work in the early hours. To be fair, we didn't mention this to management, as we were only there for 2 nights and didn't want the hassle of changing our room. The staff were very helpful in letting us store our luggage after checking out, for nearly a whole day. Also, no free wine or chocolates in the room, as others have noted. We felt safe and secure in and outside the hotel at all times, which was nice, being 2 females. I would recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnnDonald
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Regina in May for 3 nights. I booked two rooms and I couldn't have been happier with the two rooms we were allocated. The rooms were really spacious and modern and both had great outlooks and even although both rooms were to the front of the hotel they were both really quiet at night. One of the rooms was for my brother and I booked this on a "double room for single occupancy rate" and I have to say it was well worth booking this room. I had emailed ahead with specific requiremets and they were met in every way. Every member of staff, from reception to bar staff were extremely professional and helpful. We used the facilities of the adjoining Pulitzer hotel, ie. roof top bar and courtyard, if we returned during the day, and on returning to the hotel later on in the evening used the bar area at the Regina. On returning to the UK I wrote to the Manager to thank him and his staff and received a really nice response from him, which I wasn't expecting. I had such a good time in Barcelona and was so happy with the hotel that I couldn't even say goodbye to the staff as we left as I was crying!! Would most definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: krisNewYork
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were visiting Barcelona for 3 days in April and we picked hotel Regina based on its great reviews. We had a very large double room with large french windows that opened out onto the street. The room was also available in the mid morning when we arrived from our flight which was wonderful and unexpected. They even sent up a bottle of champagne! And the location is perfect! It is on a side street off one of the main central plazas. Subways and bus stops are all right there but we ended up just walking to most sites. There is a quiet bar area in the hotel which we didnt really use since we were out all the time. There is also free internet but often at least 1 of the 3 computers wasnt working so you sometimes had to wait. Overall I would highly recommend to hotel to anyone visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate”
Reviews.Author: Boio
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night at the end of a 3 week trip to Spain. Staff at the reception desk were helpful with any requests or questions. However, I had booked a double room in advance, and confirmed it was a double at check-in, but when I got to the room, it was a twin. When I phoned reception to see what was going on, they told me that a booking for a double room is only treated as a REQUEST for a double. Huh??? Hotel Regina & I obviously have different concepts of what a confirmed booking is. They did find a double room for me, so it was all fine after that. Free internet access in the business centre near the hotel bar was great. Overall, I don't have any complaints about the hotel, but nor is it one I would rave about. Perfectly adequate sums it up.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonStoofa
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in a triple room for two nights with two girlfriends on a city break. The location is perfect in a quiet road set just off the main square with metro stations everywhere. Reception staff were wonderful, very helpful and happy to reccomend restaurants if you let them know what you are looking for (eg. typical catalan within walking distance). We did not have breakfast at the hotel as 16euro per person seemed overpriced and there are plenty of wondeful cafes in the area. Our room was on the 5th floor and was spacious with snacks, wine and plenty of toiletries which were restocked daily. There is a minibar although the price list is confusing and very expensive. The only downside is that the hotel information allowed us to believe that it was possible to get a direct train from the airport to the hotel; it is not and requires several changes. Not a problem if you speak Spanish/Catalan but could be a problem if not.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing experience”
Reviews.Author: KathleenManchester
Reviews.Content: We visited Barcelona for a long weekend and booked La Regina after a great deal of research on Tripadvisor. We were looking forward to a spacious, comfortable room and good service. On arriving at the hotel at 1pm on a Saturday we were impressed with the pleasant and quiet reception ( the surrounding area is extremely busy and in retrospect not the place for a relaxing break). However, we were greet by a middle aged male receptionist who was less then helpful or friendly. We were told we could could either have the 4th or 1st floor, on asking which room was nicer he simply shrugged. We took the 4th floor, however on opening the door of room 421 were greeted with a room the size of a matchbox with NO window and right next to the maids room. As this was Saturday and were paying 224 Euros for the night, this was unacceptable and I returned to reception to request the room on the 1st floor. The receptionist was not pleasant about this and grumbled in Spanish to his colleague and waived his hands in the air. The bell boy took us to room 107 and on the way confided that they always had problems with room 421. Room 107 was just as small but did have a window, as we had no choice we took it ( I must comment there was no cava or chocolates either) However, on arriving home late on Sunday night we were overwhelmed by the stench of sewage coming up through the drains in the bathroom. We informed reception who were already aware of the problem but had not tried to contact us. They then moved us to room 202 and we had to pack our things at midnight to switch rooms. Again 202 was a very small room. On the Sunday we had also asked the bell boy for a restaurent recommendation and were recommended Case De Tapes which was nearby, as far as we could tell there were no Spanish eating in this restaurent , only tourists. It was an unpleasant atmosphere, it was overpriced and the food was below average. The only pleasant memory I shall take of La Regina is that it has a lovely bar, it is very soothing after the business of Barcelona and the bar staff were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in a very comfortable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: nhhunter
Reviews.Content: We were a family of 4 with teen age children and could not have asked for better. Great Location in the heart of the city with La Ramba, Passage de Gracia and the Old City within walking distance in minutes. Hotel Staff was very friendly and helpful. Would stay here again even if alone on business.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: TravelerCool
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel regina for 3 nights in May with my 2 children. We ended up staying here by default due to a problem with the aircon in our original hotel. ( See review on Casa Camper). The transfer was handled beautifully.From the moment we arrived things looked up. There is an air of understated elegance as you enter which is most relaxing after the bustle of the outside world. The manager appeared from the sister hotel next door to welcome us, bedraggled and bereft of sleep, and we were shown to our room. Unfortunately, we did not get the cava and chocolates that other reviewers have mentioned, but I suspect that it was simply the nature of our arrival that resulted in this ommission! The room was light, airy, spacious and, most importantly, the aircon worked! The room had a relaxed contemporary feel, anhanced by the simple colour scheme. The bathroom was somewhat small, but adequate. The alcove for the sofa bed was fine. Television, mini bar, safe, toiletries were all present. There was plety of storage space. We found the beds to be comfortable and slept reasonably well- except for the noise outside. Having complained in the previous hotel we had stayed in, I was slow to make a big deal here- but I would recommend travellers to request a quiet room. Breakfast was super. The selection was very good- and though one could not get eggs, omelletes etc cooked to order, there was plenty to choose from...Breads, rolls, toast, fruits, yogurts, croissants,pastries, caprese salad, cold meats,cheeses, scrambled eggs, sausages and sauteed potatoes, teas coffee, juice....essentially a very good choice. The breakfast room itself was light and airy and offered views on 2 sides of the streets outside; so one could just eat breakfast and watch the world go by. The location of this hotel is second to none- 2 minutes from the Placa Catalunya, where the tour buses leave; and 2 minutes from Las Ramblas pedestrian street. Taxis are easy to get if you want to travel farther afield. We visited the bar in the Pulitzer- a little of the poser crowd, but pleasant. The bar in the Regina was relaxed, intimate and I was able to sip my wine and read my book while the boys spent 45 minutes on the computers. I appreciated the faact that I could watch them easily from the bar....and that there was no cost for this service. Speaking of cost, I do not know whether I gto a good deal or not. Due to the hotel change, I was offered the room for the same rate as the casa camper. I suspect that I lost out but , to be honest, was so pleased to be gone from the other hotel that I did not even query it. My views were mixed on the reception/concierge staff. Some were very helpful. Others not so much. Unfortunately, i cannot remember the names. On arrival we were given a booklet on Barcelona. I chose 2 Italian restaurants and asked reception to book them. I was advised that the restaurants did not take bookings and that we could just take a taxi. Reception booked us a taxi at 715 but when we arrived we found that the restaurant did not open until 830. This meant that we had to walk around for over an hour- not such a nice prospect with an 8 and 11 year old in tow, after a long day touring! We called into the Astoria hotel for a drink to pass the time and got chatting to the concierge; who telephoned the resaurant and booked it for us.On return to our hotel, I mentioned to the reception staff that booking was possible . Surprise was expressed! I asked him to book another restaurant for the next night but, again, was told that it was not possible. I asked him to check...and the reservation was made! I feel that if a hotel if giving these guides to its guests, it should be familiar with things like opening hours and reservation policies. As someone with children, it is very important to me to plan carefully. Regarding the restaurants; we like Italian, so the following may help other travellers:- Ottimo - enric granados 95 : we loved this stylish place. food was exquisite. lovely for a romantic meal for 2- though my romantic meal with my sons was also most enjoyable. Lovely pea and asparagus starter, consomme with ravioli, beef, pasta. This is not a pizza joint. A classy experience. i Sapori dItalia- Aribau 152_ Again, we enjoyed lunch here. Choice of set menu or a la carte. Good choice. Pizza available. We ate here twice. Non solo pizza enric granados? - what a charming little place. Great buzz, great food. small simple menu with daily specials. No pizza but great pasta. My sons loved the steak here. Very limited wine choice- but the athmosphere is great. One word of warning: the idea of Starters does not really apply here. We ordered caprese salad and 2 penne arrabiatta to begin but the portions were monstrous. When the bill arrived I realised that there is one size, one price ....so maybe share the salad..or just stick to main course...and lovely tiramisu and sorbet. We ate here twice. We ate at one pizza joint near familia sagrada- cant remember the name- piazzente??recommended on this site but, in our opinion,- it was awful. Undercooked pizza with too much mozzarella, unclean tables and place almost empty. If you like Italian choose from Ottima, I Sapori dItalia or non solo pizza. We did the bus tour on 2 days- great way to see the city. Luckily, it was sunny. The day we went to the aquarium it lashed rain. My boys loved this place. We also went to the Cosmo Caixa, which I highly recommend. It is a great experience, with lots of interactive educational fun for everyone. In all, I would highly recommend the Hotel Regina. Were we to go back to Barcelona we would stay there. However, I feel that it is not a city i would rush back to anytime soon. We have the sense of "been there, done that"; and it may be hard to broaden the experience until the children are older. That said, the same is true of any city when you have youngsters! Our next stop will probably be Rome...any suggestions?

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Pessahs
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled to Barcelona with my two sons, ages 9 and 7, for a FC Barcelona match. This hotel was not only a perfect location for seeing the city, but a great place to stay with my kids. The staff were very friendly and extremely helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sh_travelerFlorida
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a three night stay at the Hotel Regina in Barcelona. This hotel is highly recommended. It is very convenient to the main shopping street; the room that we had (#403) was situated at the front of the hotel - it was very comfortable and quiet; the staff is friendly and very accommodating - making dinner reservations, reconfirming air reservations, etc. I would definetely stay at this hotel should we make a return visit to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable rates...great location”
Reviews.Author: toyee
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located at the foot of Las Ramblas. If you want to be in the heart of the city, this is the place. The rooms are clean, well appointed and modern. The service was above average to good. The staff made an effort to accomodate me with my issues and did their best. I found a great rate on the internet and I strongly believe that I received the best bang for my buck for Barcelona. Note to light sleepers! The walls are pretty thin and you can hear even the slightest activity outside your door. But, this is understandable given the age of the building.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Regina - a lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: susanne703
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Regina is in a fantastic location, just off La Rambla and the Placa del Catalonya. It is next door to the Pulitzer Hotel and has the same manager. I was there for 5 days in April 2008. I had requested a room on a higher floor, away from the elevators and maid storage room, with a balcony. I received exactly what I had requested. The hotel provides all guests with a complimentary bottle of cava and a box of dessert chocolates - a very nice touch. The staff was very helpful and attentative. Maid service was terrific. The bar area serves some food or you can go to the dining room at the Pulitzer Hotel. There is room service - breakfast through late evening. The hotel room itself was great - nice size for a European hotel, extremely comfortable bed, in room safe and television, nice bathroom with amenities. It made for a very pleasant experience and stay in Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: t0pcat
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from four days at Hotel Regina Barcelona, which we chose on the strength of the reviews here, we were not disappointed ! We have both been to Barcelona several times before so we knew the area, the hotel is in an excellent location just of Catalunya Sq, 5 mins from La Rambla. Don’t get a cab from the airport, take the bus it’s 4 Euros from the airport and runs every 10 mins and stops in Catalunya Sq, get of the bus look across the square for the BBVA clock and Habitat, the hotel in 2 mins walk across the square between the two buildings. We were in Barcelona for my birthday, we booked a superior room and requested a high floor room with street view. We arrived at 11am expecting to be told you can leave your bags as the room is not ready, not so, checked in OK as the room was ready (I would not expect this though, as the time we went was a quiet one) upstairs to rm 405 – high floor, street view !! 5 mins later their was a knock at the door, a bottle of Cava and two glasses with a birthday wish compliments of the hotel ! Our room was large, clean, bright and airy it felt more like we were in an apartment than a hotel room, the only slight disappointment was that we had two single beds pushed together to make a double rather than just a double, but it was very comfy all the same. Some people have commented about train noise etc. We didn’t experience any of this, in fact once the balcony doors were shut outside traffic noise etc was virtually non existent. All areas of the hotel we found were clean and tidy at all times. The hotel bar (at the time we were their) was quiet, I would recommend the cocktail bar at the Pullitzer next door (part of the same group) I stay away through work quite often and make a point of avoiding eating in any of the hotels I stay in. My wife commented on how whenever we go away the first nights meal is always the worst as you never know where to go and are just to tired to bother. If you have dinner at the Pullitzer next door on the first night I guarantee you will not be disappointed, the food is superb. We didn’t have breakfast at the hotel – got up to late ! I’d avoid the diner/restaurant across the road (rude & surly staff) Starbucks is 20 yards left out of the hotel. The last time we were in Barcelona we had lunch at one of the many outside eateries on the Ramblas, my advice avoid this overpriced tourist fare, go into the market on the Ramblas and head for the ‘eat at bars’ at the back the food is cooked fresh while you wait in front of you and is very good. Whilst we are talking about food L’ Olivia (left out of the hotel, cross the road and up the passage between the shops) is very good. I would definitely avoid Les Quinze Nits in Placa Reial just of the Ramblas, we queued for an hour to be served tasteless food and when we complained the manager said ‘how do we know what it should taste like’ !! with your back to Les Quinze look to the left corner of the square and go to Santa Monica, good food, great staff. If you go down to the marina/Port Vell, Luz de Gas (the blue boat) is a must, the atmosphere and the tapas is excellent though you will have to queue if the sun is out ! but once you have sat down your table is yours to soak up the sun and atmosphere for as long as you want it. If however the queue is to long walk past Luz de Gas to the history museum, take the lift to the 4th floor (entry is free) the café serves superb food and if it’s sunny you can eat the superb food on the terrace with excellent views over the marina. Anyway back to Regina, great hotel, great location excellent staff for who nothing seems too much trouble I would recommend it all day long, in fact we are going back in June !!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Birchdene
Reviews.Content: We stayed with friends for a long weekend in early April. The Hotel is ideally located and within a short walk of the Bus Stop for the airport bus. Tip pay the bus driver dont queue at the machine to pre purchase your ticket - the wait is too long! the hotel is located done a side road and therefore just far enough away from the noise and hutsle and bussle. Rooms are cosy and very clean. You can feel/hear the rumble of the Metro underground but seems fairly general across the City and was certainly not enough to disturb our stay. You must try the market off of las ramblas it is a real experience. We stayed for three days which was not long enough and another two days would have been nice to have explored further. we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: kate055
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the regina on the strenght of reviews here, we were not disapointed. We had room210 a large corner room very clean comfortable, and noise free. The location is brilliant as is beautiful barcelona !!! I would have liked to have tea or coffe making available in the room.I found the wash basins outside of the shower to be a great idea. We had a lovely meal in the attic on las ramdlas would highly recommend it.The bar in the hotel is VERY QUIET perhaps alittle more life and upbeat music would encourage people to stay longer . I would recomment this hotel to all my friends, and starbucks was next door.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Winegirl921
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Regina for two weeks in February while on a business trip and was extremely pleased with the overall experience. As an American who speaks very little Spanish (and certainly no Catalan), I was put at ease by the staff who spoke very good English and were extremely accomodating. Both the front desk and bar staff called taxis on a moment's notice, filled all requests for needs in a timely manner and were very helpful with directions and providing local information about transportation, restaurants, etc. The room was modern, comfortable and included most of the usual ammenities (no coffee maker). Hairdryer was not very powerful and there was no iron (but desk provided one upon request). Unfortunately, my room was next to the maid's closet, close to the elevator, and view was of a small airshaft (from which I could hear the people in the same room on other floors when my windows were open). I believe it was room # 12 (212, 312, etc). If you get this room I would suggest moving as it is very noisy. I am returning in April and the front desk suggested I book a room at the front of the building. I did not eat breakfast at the hotel, as the cost was 17 Euros ($25 US), which seemed quite overpriced, but there are several places nearby to get breakfast or coffee - Starbucks, Cafe Catalunya, etc. The bar at the hotel is quiet and relaxing. My coworkers and I found it a great place to relax and have a cocktail after returning from dinner most nights. The location is very convenient, as the subway has several stops within a few blocks, the tourbus stops at the end of the block on Placa de Catalunya and, of course, the infamous Las Ramblas. Las Ramblas is about as touristy as it gets (do NOT eat there), but I would highly recommend visiting the market. As I'm sure you have heard already, be very aware of pickpockets. One of my coworkers was targeted on the subway and almost had her camera stolen out of her purse which was inside her backpack! Restaurant recommendations: Me' (my absolute favorite), Siete Portes, Cuidad Condal, O' Beach (for the view and atmosphere - NOT the food), Terrabachus. In summary, Barcelona is a wonderful city and the Regina Hotel is in the heart of it all. For a hotel at this price you can't ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in a diamond city”
Reviews.Author: NVLN
Reviews.Content: A truly memorable experience. Nothing whatsoever to fault. The room was modernistic but homely, clean and comfortable. The staff were exceptional. I contacted the hotel prior to arrival to advise that this was my husband's first trip to Barcelona (in fact to mainland Spain) and it was also his Birthday. They could not have been more obliging or more helpful. They provided their own touches to mark the celebration of his Birthday. They gave recommendations of where to go, advised of the easiest method to get from A to B and overall were quite the most outstanding staff I have EVER come across. The hotel itself could not be better situated for ease of access to tour Barcelona. Right by Las Ramblas but just off the main street so not too much noise. I shall definitely stay here again. A hotel truly fit for a Queen and very worthy of the name Hotel Regina!!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PARIS182
Reviews.Content: I have been meaning to write this review for awhile and am just now getting around to it. I stayed at the Best Western Regina for two nights prior to a transatlantic cruise. It was my second choice and I have never been so pleased. The hotel sits on a street not far from Las Ramblas in an old building that has been redecorated in modern European style. My room, while not large was attractively decorated and had french doors leading to a Juliet balcony overlooking the street. As far as I was concerned this was worth the cost of admission. The bed was comfortable and in a alcove and out of the way. There were great Bath amenities and the Bathroom was good sized and well appointed. I still don't get the glass half door thing on the tub, but there you go. There is a great bar although one night it was full of unpleasant americans (and I am an American) and a decent restaurant in the sister hotel next door. I had breakfast that came with the meal and the breakfast was excellent and the room attractive The location is great near the main plaza, Las Ramblas and El Corte Angles (great department store) is nearby. There is a tourist bus stop across the way. I found it conveniant to walk to many things. A few caveats (which would not keep me from going back) Several times early in the AM someone would rattle the room door And the staff while friendly and efficient was unable to cash a travellers cheque or convert currency which I found odd. That said this hotel was a find and cost about 140Euros which I felt was a deal

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: brd25
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nghts form 18th Feb 08 with our 2 teenage sons. We have stayed in many hotels around the world & have to say this is one of the best. Rooms were exceptional, clean comfortable with an abundence of toiletries & useful items (toothbrush, etc...) Great linens & towels. We arrived early (11.00) & reception staff were excellent, friendly & advised our room was ready for use. If only all hotels were so accomodating..... We used the hotels bar for food & drinks & the high levels of service were exceeded here by the bar staff who could not be more friendly. Food / drink was not expensive (significantly cheaper than the Ramblas). Position could not be better being minutes from the metro, tour buses & major tourist locations. Congratulations to all the team at the Regina Hotel, you stand head & shoulders above the major groups & i have already reccommended to friends & family..

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: wcfluffy
Reviews.Content: From the moment I walked into this hotel I experienced excellent service. The check in process was quick and friendly with plenty of staff behind the desk. The room was of a good size and had the most comfortable bed I have ever slept on. One small negative was the sink, which was located in the room rather than the bathroom. The TV didn’t work and when this was reported to the front desk it was remedied immediately. Drinks taken in the hotel bar are a pleasure, with friendly bar staff that can mix cocktails and long drinks with skill and a smile; nothing is too much for them. The hotel is located at the top of Las Ramblas and next to the main shopping district where all the top names have stores. I have stayed in some of the worlds top hotels and this will always sit in my top 5.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy with this Hotel ...”
Reviews.Author: Perfectus
Reviews.Content: A Hotel that started life in 1917 is bound to have issues in it's infrastructure, but this was more than compensated with the BEST staff ever ... ...although the General Manager Sr. Jose Mª Sanchez-Harguindey was away, it was left in Good Hands... My sincere thanks to Rafael, Jose and especially Lucilla, who sorted out our Flight Problems with the staff at Easyjet (should be renamed Hardjet). ~ Highly recommend this Hotel and the Staff are 5*

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Regina!”
Reviews.Author: Cheekylou
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay for a long weekend in Barcelona. Location: Very convenient for the major atrractions and the Bus Turistic which picks up from Placa del Cataluyna. Also in a lovely area to walk to local restaurants etc. Rooms: Clean, classy and well laid out, we were not bothered by the noise of other guests or outside. The only thing was the faint rumbling of the occasional underground train. There is also a free internet lounge. Staff: Excellent and only too happy to help, they went out of their way to help when my husband was ill. The also organised our departure. In summary, we highly recommend the Hotel Regina for your next stay in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service in top location”
Reviews.Author: Esteven
Reviews.Content: booked this hotel, belonging to the chain Regina Hotels, because of its excellent location, just off the Plaza de Catalunya. Last year I stayed in the next doors hotel Pulitzer, belonging to the same group, and wanted to check out the Regina now. The hotel staff was super friendly and very nice in accomodating me immediately, altough it was only 9.30 am when I arrived. They fixed me a room with lateral view to the Plaza de Catalunya. The room was of decent size, small bathroom however, but all the necessary ammenities were there: minibar, television, bathrobes, toiletries... and above all FREE INTERNET access, which was great, as I still had some work to do. The beds were much better than in the Pulitzer, but rooms are not sound proof. The windows keep all the street noise out, but the walls are paper thin, so you can here everything from next doors. Apart from that, I can only recommend the hotel. Staff is excellent and will do anything to give you the best possible service. I really enjoyed my stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Staff- it is that good!!!”
Reviews.Author: Andy-Nickname
Reviews.Content: We booked 4 nights at this hotel after a lot of searching. I was impressed by the fact that the manager took the time to read all reviews and respond. It shows someone w.ho really does care about the service the hotel is giving. I booked this break as a birthday treat for my wife. We arrived very late at night after a cancelled flight with only 1 bag ( thanks BA!) , tired and stressed. We were greeted by the Manager who took details of our missing baggage report and said the hotel would look after the enquiries. When we got to our room on the 3rd floor we had our first pleasant surprise, it was immaculate, stylish and large Well stocked minibar-prices reasonable for a hotel. In room safe deposit. We had a room with shower only ,but it was big enough for a whole group to use. The bed was very comfortable, I don't think I slept in better. As a previous reviewer has stated, there were some really good toiletries- essential in our case as our luggage was still in England somewhere. Then our next surprise, room service arrives with a complimentary bottle of Cava and cake to celebrate my wife's birthday. The look on my wife's face said it all. This turned around a nightmare day and set the tone for the rest of our stay. The staff were all very helpful and pleasant, particularly the lobby bar staff. As i said in the title this is an excellent hotel, with a great location, Excellent manager- one again a big thank you , and superb staff We have been to Barcelona before and will go again as we love the city. I know which hotel I'll be booking from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: gk
Reviews.Content: I picked the Hotel Regina because I was looking for a reasonable, 4-star, central, modern hotel in Barcelona. Believe me, I looked through nearly every hotel in Barcelona! I chose Hotel Regina because it ticked all of the boxes and because the manager had taken the time to respond to tripadvisor (always a good sign!). Upon arrival we were greeted by the lovely woman at reception who was all smiles. Nothing was too much trouble either. We were given a guide to Barcelona and a map (another nice touch). Our room was on the fifth floor and overlooked the small square where the hotel backed on to. About 5 minutes after we arrived, one of the bar staff came to the room with a complimentary bottle of cava and some chocolate pistachios. Amazing! Now to the room. It was everything I'd hoped for and more! The bed was deleriously comfortable; the room was very spacious and the furnishings modern. Included in the room was: room heating controls, free wi-fi, desk, mini-bar (packed full with snacks and drinks), in-room safe, 2 wardrobes, 2 sinks, his and hers toiletries (what a nice idea!), hairdryer, flat-screen tv, phone. In the separate bathroom was the toilet, bidet, combined bath/shower, bathrobes, shelving area and slippers. Honestly, I didn't want to go home. There were some particular small touches like the individual toiletries and Barcelona postcards that made it special. The staff were impeccable. The bar staff / room service staff in particular were incredibly helpful and accommodating. When we arrived back at the hotel with a cheap bottle of wine bought in a supermarket, the staff brought up an ice bucket to use and also included some chips / nuts for us as well. Nothing seemed too much trouble. We asked for a hotel recommendation in the area and the man on duty reserved us a hotel at the excellent (and highly recommended) L'Olive. The location of the hotel is excellent. We caught the Aerobus direct from the airport (€3.90 per ticket) and it was only about a 200m walk across Placa de Catalunya to the hotel. We walked everywhere in Barcelona, but the metro and the bus stops are only a very short distance away as well. The bar area was wonderfully decorated and the drinks were cheap (coming from Ireland it was a nice surprise!). We didn't use the computers provided but there was 3 or 4 for use (including a printer as well). We also didn't use the gym/pool facilities in their sister property (too much to do!). Now, to suggest some improvements! Tea/coffee facilities in the room would have been really welcome, but I did look through a lot of hotels and it didn't seem to be the norm in Barcelona. We had come prepared with a travel kettle so weren't put off at all. As some others have noted, the walls are a bit thin between the rooms and the corridors. This didn't bother me at all, but if you're a light sleeper it may affect you. If I returned to Barcelona, I wouldn't look at any other hotel. Hotel Regina is just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, fantastic room, the best hotel I've stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: adztheangel
Reviews.Content: I wanted to visit Barcelona for my Birthday weekend and as such researched a whole range of different hotels in the city. I was very impressed when I saw on the tripadvisor that the Manager of 'Hotel Regina' personally answers every review, and from looking at the hotel website decided to get into contact. All my questions were answered quickly and efficiently, which left no doubt in my mind that I wanted to stay there. On arrival, everything that I had requested was in place and the room we had been given was truly excellent, with a balcony overlooking the square. The hotel itself is in a fantastic location, just a minutes walk from the top of La Ramblas and all it has to offer. Inside, the hotel feels very modern, with nice interior design and lightning, it's certainly impressive. But what really struck me was the service, nothing seemed like too much trouble, staff were always smiling and willing to help. Ontop of all this, on the morning we were set to leave (my Birthday), the staff sent a Birthday cake to our room - Such a touch of class and something that really made a great start of the day for me - Thank you so much to all involved! Next time I go to Barcelona I will definately be staying in the Hotel Regina, I have never before experienced such high quality service and surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Truly amazing hotel A***”
Reviews.Author: amnesia_man
Reviews.Content: I sourced this hotel through Trip Advisor. Having read all the great reviews, I proceeded to book a short city break to celebrate my wife's birthday. I emailed the manager direct and asked if he could accommodate my requests: quiet area, double bed with street views. He promptly replied and on arrival we found that he had far exceeded my requests. I wanted to thank Mr Sanchez, and his staff for their kind hospitality. We encountered absolutely no problems what so ever and certainly would recommend booking this fabulous hotel when visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley fabulous hotel - wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: divasparkle
Reviews.Content: I cannot reccommend this hotel highly enough. My 10yr old son and I stayed here over Christmas for a wonderful week and this was a real treat. The location is fantastic - incredibly central for walking, public transport, airport buses and the Bus Touristic (highly reccommend doing this) with hot and cold running taxis and lots of great food nearby esp on Rambla de Catalunya and Passeig de Gracia. But the rooms are really quiet - no street noise unless you open the balcony doors. There is a lovely smell when you come into the hotel and everyone on reception was welcoming, efficient, friendly and helpful. On Christmas Day we had an unprompted phone call from reception to say that they were there to help us with anything we needed. On our last day, they were happy to bring down and store our bags until we left for the airport at 4pm which was a great relief - nothing was too much effort. I had emailed the manager Mr Sanchez (who impresses me by replying to every review on tripadvisor) to ask if we could have a twin, non smoking and street view room on a higher floor and he accommodated us completely giving us a huge room on the 5th floor at the front of the hotel. The rooms are in the "Minimalist" style but luxurious, very comfortable and CLEAN! The beds are fantastic we had a twin room and the singles are huge and very comfortable! Gorgeous cotton sheets that seemed to be changed daily - not 100% on this but the pillow cases certainly were. Big fluffy towels changed daily if you wanted and a good selection of toiletries and things like razors, shower caps etc. Black out curtains under the main ones are a great idea, especially for those early summer sunrises. The huge telly was a bonus with BBC/CNN News, National Geographic and music channels as well as the rest. Took along a portable DVD player that can be run through a TV which came in very handy for playing the odd film. In our room, the sink was in the room which works well when two of you need to get ready. A little dissapointed with the tiny bathroom. In 502 there is a shower and a loo and whilst the shower is lovely and powerful the sealants are a little grubby. It looked like the chambermaids gave it a good clean but it needs something more drastic! Wouldn't have minded relaxing in a bubble filled bathtub after a day spent on the feet but then I did not specify a bath! And our room was huge. The safe was easy to use and a pefect size. A very welcome fruitbowl is a thoughtful touch. There is no noise between rooms but you can hear noise from the hallway. Perhaps the doors could be soundproofed during the next renovation...Because we were in Barcelona to sightsee, I didn't mind hearing the chambermaids in the morning as it got me up but I can see that this could be a problem if you wanted to lie in.. Had breakfast in our room on Christmas day and wow - fresh, great selection of pastries and cheese and gorgeous coffee/juice and brought up with a cheerful smile and hola! When we got back early that evening, we had been left a gourmet foodie present and card! Didn't try the breakfast room as we were never really hungry in the morning having eaten so late the night before...The bar area is great - super service and a nice place to chill out. The internet had a fast connection - made a few restaurant bookings via toptable (reccommend doing so for 7 Portes) and also checked in and printed off our boarding cards the night before we left. Can see where this would get busy when the hotel is full...(Oh by the way Mr Sanchez, the printers need ink as they are running low..) We got a little lost getting off the airport bus when we arrived (in the rain and in the dark - not my best thing) and would like to mention that the hotel is located on a street (Bergara) off the Placa Catalunya, opposite to the El Corte Ingles side (which is where the airport bus stop is) in what is known as the Triangle which houses FNAC (our point of reference from then on) and Habitat. All in all - so very impressed with this hotel - would reccommend it highly and will definitely return here (for a long weekend next time!) Mr Sanchez - compliments and congratulations to you and your staff - I can see that you all work very hard to make the hotel what it is today.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Anon98
Reviews.Content: Just back from a superb stay at the Hotel Regina. The hotel could not be any more central or better located than it is from both La Ramblas and the shopping. The hotel is beautiful, and the staff are very friendly and helpful. Rooms great, slightly small but perfect for what we needed. Cleaned everyday and central heating was great. Have been recommending the hotel already! Still cannot believe the price we paid for the location and the quality. Overall had an excellent stay and will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: AmFl
Reviews.Content: We wound up here after picking a bad hotel and having to change. Could not have made a better choice! 1. Location - We did not want to be on a noisy street, but wanted to be near shops, etc. This hotel is in a perfect location - it is at the north end of the Ramblas, but on a one-way side street. We had a room overlooking the street (with doors that opened onto a balcony) and never had any trouble with noise. 2. The room - Comfortable and super clean. Bathroom was modern and had big, fluffy, over-sized towels. A/C worked well and the TV had more than one station in English! Hurrah! It was still all news, but at least we didn't have to watch only Sky News all day. Lots of closet and hanging space, mini-bar and safe. 3. Internet - Might not be a big deal to everyone, but to us this was important. WiFi worked perfectly and was free. Also, there is a business center in the lobby - if I remember correctly there were 3 computers, each with printers - also free. 4. Staff - Very nice and helpful. Our phone wasn't working (we never would have know this since we didn't use it) but on our last night we asked for a wake-up call at 4:15am in order to leave for the airport at 5am. They actually came up to the room and knocked on the door to make sure we were up since the phone wouldnt work! There is also a nice bar in the lobby - we did not have a chance to check it out though. All in all, we had a great stay here and would go back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and good hotel, could use some improvements”
Reviews.Author: Jade97
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as single female traveller for 4 nights in a single room. Room - is clean and comfortable. This is the only hotel in all the Spain hotels i've been in that actually supplied full set of toiletries in particular toothbrush, sanitary bags, shower cap and slippers. The toilet could use better cleaning cuz it smelled a bit bad. The room is otherwise comfortable and well maintained. I also agree with other reviews that the banging doors could be a bit annoying. I also stayed at their sister hotel Pulitzer Hotel, in comparison Regina's decor is not as stylish, and service is not as comprehensive but the facilities are almost just as good. Service - is good. A few faults I could pick: The room service plates were not collected until housekeeping cleans your room the next day. The other thing was I posted 2 postcards via the reception and these are the only 2 cards that didn't reach the recipient. Not sure the reception or the postal service was to blame. Location - is excellent. Feels very safe to walk back to at night. Just 2 minutes away from the middle of town Plaza de Catalunya, where the tourist buses depart from and where the tourist information center is located. Very close to the Rambla and the surrounding shopping area. Walking distance to Barri Gotic and even to attractions that are further north such as Casa Batllo if you care to walk a bit further.

Reviews.Title: “Location..location...location..”
Reviews.Author: francesca-b
Reviews.Content: Just returned this evening after an excellent four night's stay at the Regina. Location - couldn't be better, just off the Placa de Catalunya, within easy reach of most sights and seconds away from the Metro. Hotel - very chic, tastefully decorated with clean, minimalist lines but with plenty of warmth. Bar/lounge area particularly attractive: wonderful sitting here in the evening, our son immediately makin use of the free internet service whilst we were able to have a nightcap! Room - we had a family room (519) which was very spacious with an alcove off which had two extra beds. Loved the huge beds, quality bed linen and excellent lighting. Agree with other reviewer, although no noise between rooms, the banging doors and noise from other people in the corridors was rather irritating. Service - very helpful, friendly staff. The reception staff always willing to help, the bar staff made gorgeous Irish Coffees and the breakfast staff kept their buffet well-stocked whilst their customers were well looked after. (Continental breakfast was probably the best I have come across; the pastries were delicious!) Overall a well-managed, friendly, classy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: biggaplanet
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Regina for 5 nights and had a great experience there. We had prior contact with the manager to ensure we got a good room and he was very helpful and responsive to this request. We were very satisfied with the room and it was of good size and had all the amenities one would want. It was near the cleaning cupboard though and one suggestion is that maybe the cleaners could start later than 8am as it does wake guests up to hear them out in the corridor. The location of the hotel was great and it was accessible to the buses and all the main districts. Internet access was good but slowed right down toward the end of our stay and I think the hotel had technical problems with the internet connection. Overall though I would highly recommend this hotel and its location in Barcelona. It was clean, efficient, well run and well managed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: SimonSultana
Reviews.Content: My family (2 Adults + 2 Children) together with another family (2 Adults + 3 Children) stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. We booked via the hotel's web site. Having given them instructions regarding our rooms, we got what we asked for - lovely rooms, quiet and spacious. Location is perfect - 2 mins away from the Rambla. Staff were very helpful and English speaking. Recommend to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Vivera
Reviews.Content: We had a triple room for three women and it was a fine spacious room. Staff were really nice and so helpful. Breakfast was excellent. The first morning we asked one of the waitresses for 'boiling water' to make tea which she got for us with a smile. On the second morning she arrived with the water unprompted! The location is just perfect for sightseeing and shopping. We asked the hotel to recommend a restaurant to us for our first night and again they were spot on. (The name of the restaurant was 'La Gavina' down by the port). We will definitely go back to Barcelona and will stay in the Regina again
